train.question:
title: Good
text: very good quality cardstock!

title: This one is a winner!
text: Finally a shredder that works well and shreds the amount of papers that it advertises!

title: Llama Lovers unite!  Excellent quality card.
text: Very good quality card, arrived from Scotland by Royal Mail, which the Birthday girl was pleased by.  Arrived in perfect condition, A+.

title: Lots of stickers
text: These stickers were very nice. They were a good size. You got a lot of them. They were bright and vibrant. They were really cute. The kids liked them. They stuck pretty well. It was a nice assortment. You can use them on all sorts of places. They really can make something look unique and nice. They were pretty easy to peel. They stayed on well. I was pleased with quality and durability. I would recommend it.

title: Too wobbly for significant use
text: [[VIDEOID:7ea413ea76dfefa9f2a4bd8539f3613e]] Overall, it seems to be fairly well made and is a nice size.  Unfortunately, the stand is so wobbly that it is unusable for anything that requires typing on a laptop or writing notes, drawings, etc. on paper. (see video)  This limits it's use to a book holder, which can also be a problem if you are sensitive to motion when reading (as the book will wobble).  Second, while the product photos clearly show it being used as a standing desk, this is not feasible as the skids are so slippery that the desk will not stay put. In an attempt to rectify this I added non-skid rubber to the skids, which works fine.  Unfortunately, the desk still wobbles and is unusable, and cannot be returned because of the rubber which I added in an attempt to use the product as depicted in the manufacturer photos. This may work as a dining tray in bed, but I can't see it being usable for any sort of work or writing / drawing, etc.

title: Quality table
text: I woke from home and I like to take breaks from sitting at the desk all the time so I wanted something really sturdy to work from the couch or really anywhere else. It has enough leg room to sit with your legs crossed. Really sturdy table and I love the support at the bottom so the laptop doesn't try to slid off if you tilt, and the little tray underneath. Then when you're done it folds up very easily and takes up minimal room

title: Takes a few minutes to warm up.
text: Seals the entire document  Seals comes in many dimensions. Cool down time takes several minutes.

title: Yes
text: Perfect little tags! Just what I needed!!! Love them

title: Really strong, earns the title Heavy Duty
text: Packing tape is so expensive!  This 6 pack of Heavy Duty was the right price point for me and it certainly isn't flimsy or easily torn.  Some packing tapes tear themselves and then you have to find their lead and it takes forever and then you can't get it to tear evenly so it breaks into all these jagged edges.  NOT THIS TAPE!  This tape is thicker than most though still perfectly flexible and transparent.  I've been shipping lots of packages lately and this tape sticks to everything without peeling off or crinkling.  These rolls are pretty hefty to so you won't be running out anytime soon.  Great tape!  The only packing tape I will buy from now on!

title: Classy file tabs, great for anything that needs a "marker" ... text: I've been using these to mark sections of a travel journal. I recently discovered the joys of cruise travel, so I do a chapter for each day / port. I tend to do longer trips (14-40+ days), and I try to section it logically (e.g., for the recent Alaska cruise, I had section for Ketchikan, Endicott Arm, Juneau, Gulf of Alaska, etc.). Sure, I could use less "flashy" tabs, but these are really nice and fit the gold/silver highlights I've added to the journal.

As usual, these are high quality - typical of Avery products in general. I use indelible markers (Sharpie Ultra Fine) -- works perfectly!

I'm preparing for a 38-day trip this summer through the North Atlantic, and I'm sure I'll purchase these to use for that journal. Definitely happy with these - solid 5 stars.

title: Good
text: Goid

title: Works great
text: Very comfy , I use in my truck and raised me up quite a bit. But NO coccyx pain when driving long distances.

title: Great text: My daughter loves it she does her college homework on this everyday I got these at too!

Winter

title: Nice
text: Gave as a gift to a new teacher.  She really seemed to like it

title: Could not put wheels on
text: The directions could be better.  It is a really nice looking cart feels like it will be sturdy. I just can’t figure out the wheels. I could have paid extra or I could have shopped around more.  But I really liked the look of this one.  Eventually I’ll find someone to help me

title: Wish I could just get one that doesn't have any problems!
text: I ordered one of these two months ago and it worked GREAT for the first two months, then it started having a weird clicking noise every time it would pull from the paper tray and then paper soon started jamming.  We returned it to Costco and ordered a new one.  We just received the new one and I went to set it up and received an instant error that said "Machine Error. Call Brother."  I called them and they told me the error I was receiving was because it was broken and I would have to use the warranty to get it fixed.  Thank goodness we purchased it from Costco, because we will be returning it tomorrow.  So... why the 2 stars instead of 1... well... it was a great printer while it was working. It was fast and with the wireless option, it would work with all the computers in our house.  It scanned and faxed well.  I just wish we could actually get one that works. Chances are... we will probably try one more time to purchase it because there is not another wireless all-in-one that I could find on the market for a reasonable price.  Wish us luck on our third one!

title: Great Price
text: Great price

title: The winner
text: Grabbed this for my partner and he says it's the coolest, best mousepad he's had.

title: Great
text: Good product

title: It’s comfortable text: [[VIDEOID:c5087032f6d5325ff355361573dc5cb3]] This is a pretty comfortable cushion to sit on.

I was afraid it would make me taller but it doesn’t really feel that way at all.

It’s nice to sit on. Provided some nice extra comfort. I like it. Very soft

title: Decent price I guess
text: ...but these pens are kind of hit and miss. Some of them write really well with a good ink flow, but others have a seemingly scratchy ball or something of that nature, because the ink flow is terrible and the point seems to scratch the paper. I had to just throw those away when I pull one out of the box. The pens are all plastic body and feel really light and are kind of "cheapy" looking. I gave a couple to a couple of coworkers, and one of them got a good one, the other got a bad one. The point on the bad one bent when the coworker started writing with it - LOL - so I offered her another one and she said no thanks! HAHA she said she would just get a pen from the office supply closet!

title: Might Need to be Bigger?
text: I love the rest my wrist gets with this support, however, the circle where the mouse needs to sit is a teeny bit too small for the range I need.  Granted, I spend a lot of time grading and clicking around the screen for different windows, etc.  When I'm doing casual things like scrolling sites or social media, it works just fine.  Overall though, it's really pretty and works well to keep the stress off of my wrist.

title: Useful notebook but unattractive cover design
text: If the appearance of your office products matters to you, you may be disappointed, as I was, by the design of the covers of these notebooks.  The company, Mead, chose to print a white advertising banner, almost as big as an index card, on the front cover.

title: Good product!!
text: I like this product since we couldn’t buy them in a store because of the Pandemia. Is a good product, adhesion perfect value for money.

title: Excellent for the price.
text: Good quality with a long range.

title: Awesome, heavy duty, super adhesion...
text: I'm starting to see so many of these clear double sided tape on Amazon, and you know what? I've had good luck with them all, including this one. These are very strong, heavy duty. I'm willing to bet these tapes are a white label product. Meaning they're coming from the same manufacture somewhere, and different sellers simply put their own logo on them. Products that come with double sided adhesive such shower holders, under the table cable organizers, etc... sometimes their adhesives are just terrible. Having a roll of these clear double sided tapes in your drawer will come in handy. 5-Stars!

title: My brother printer recognizes these and the value cannot be beat
text: My brother printer recognizes these and the value cannot be beat

title: Little waste with binding covers or packaging
text: A pack of 100 7 Mil Fellowes Ultra Clear PET Binding Covers in the Letter Size can be used not only in a binding system but are easy to cut by hand for other purposes needing sturdy sheets of plastic.  After binding some documents with these as front and back covers, I needed to find something for packaging earrings I'd made.  I have been repurposing lightweight cardboard stock from coffee shops, then was inspired to try incorporating pieces of this plastic in the packaging.  It works extremely well and provides a substantial base for Sharpie markings (which must be allowed to dry or they will rub off), holes or cutouts, and other hand stitched or cemented embellishments.  I had no idea when I requested these binding covers that I'd be going through the box of 100 so quickly.  Packaged in a perfectly sized white box with a flip top, it's easy to remove each sheet without messing up those which remain in the box.  They are separated with tissue paper which I've also reused.

title: Pretty text: The cover was very pretty. The print was vibrant. The journal was very nice. It looked just like the picture. It is a nice product. It is very useful.

The quality was good. They were reasonably thick. They seemed well made. They held paper well. It was easy to write in.

We were pleased.

title: hard to find
text: I file my taxes in these. they are very hard to find. thankful Amazon had them. they open up enough to put a good number of files in them

title: Everything I expected to be.
text: I liked how sturde this corner cabinet is. The color is just right for my area. Was not hard putting it together. You have to lay everything out and just follow the instructions. Needed extra hands at the end to help to make sure the doors are even. I love it.

title: Cute set
text: These are cute 5 inch cards. They all have a "thinking of you" positive message outside and they are blank inside. It's nice to have these on hand for impromptu notes or gifts. They come in a Kraft paper box and lid. They fit perfectly into the included envelopes and seal with a lick.

title: Wonderful Desk and highly recommended
text: Great lap desk. It’s a little larger than I thought but absolutely perfect. I love how you can tilt the desk and raise it. I purchased this because I just had surgery and needed something to use while sitting on the couch and in bed and this works so very well. I’ve been using this and it is so very useful. I love how there is a little drawer on the left side. That is where I have been putting my stylus for my iPad and my pen. I have been using this for my coloring books to color and for my iPad. I love my SAIJI Laptop Bed Tray Desk and highly recommend this for anyone looking for a good sturdy desk.

title: Five Stars
text: Good product

title: Nice case text: [[VIDEOID:fc9a218a4253c315a81a3a63a7e558a3]] Seems like a nice case. I’ve received label makes before and this seems like it would fit them

Case seemed ok. Nothing really that fancy. Would offer some protection if you were traveling with it.

Overall it seems nice I think

title: Five Stars
text: great

title: Nice Assortment of Colors
text: I am a long time fan of Paper Mate Flair markers. I have several sets of Flair Tip Pens and I love them! Unfortunately, I was disappointed with this set. The first marker that I took out and used was fine. It smelled yummy! It wrote nicely. Then I didn't touch the pens for a few days. Then this morning, I sat down to plan my meals and write up my shopping list. The first marker I grabbed today (second overall) didn't have any ink in it! I have included a picture. The light blue  one has a white tip whereas the others all have the appropriate colored tips. Since it had been a few days since I had used the first one, I sat there shaking it and thinking that it needed to be primed. Nothing. I then started checking the others and they were all fine. I tested them all out and they wrote as expected, except for the one without any ink. Of course, the one without ink happens to be one of my favorite colors! The scents are pretty light. There were a couple that I could barely even detect. The packaging does say that they are lightly scented. I did have to hold the pens at the far end so my hands were as far from the tips as possible because I kept smelling my hand soap instead of the markers on a few of them. I like these markers, but I wish they had all worked as expected.

title: Heavy packaging tape
text: For heavy cargo this seals the heavy duty box just perfectly, and the box edges do not lift back up.  I couldn't be more happy that this tape does the job perfectly.  We just packed a heavy computer unit, over 30lbs: the box held! Don't skimp by using other tapes: time saving and works.

title: Gorgeous
text: Mighty fine

title: Great paper for flowers!
text: I bought this paper for paper flowers and was very pleased.  Perfect weight and pretty color

title: very nice
text: These cards are very nice and on sturdy card stock.  The cards themselves are slightly glossy and the patterns are as represented.  They also came inside a very strong box which is great for storage. No one ever writes and snail mails any more... except me... once in awhile.  :)

title: Lines aren’t aligned
text: At first the notebooks were great, but when I flipped towards the middle and end, I noticed the lines weren’t straight and aligned correctly. I already used them so I couldn’t return.

title: Dino mobile --good paper product
text: I gave this one to my son, 21, who loved it.  Clever and good paper product.

title: Precisely what I needed, great product.
text: I'd been looking for a door stopper that I liked for a while without success I ended up buying these ones because I wanted something well normal but not too big or expensive I also just wanted something simple. These work great and I liked that it comes with two as well, it does what it's supposed to do. I'd buy again if needed.

title: Must have desk ... for floor or bed
text: I like this desk a lot, since WFH is a common practice.  This helps me work sitting on the floor or working on the bed.  This desk is very spacious and the quality of the materials is superb.  In terms of sturdiness I think this still needs a bit more structural rigidity, but I'm being picky since this is the best floor desk I have tried of this category.  After buying this desk I will definetly recomment Saiji as a brand.  Great Job!

title: For granddaughter's 8th grade graduation
text: When my only granddaughter graduated from middle school I wanted to give her something to show how much I value and support her.

title: Very heavy duty
text: I really like them

title: So if she is that pleased, then it is a great product to me
text: I purchased this for my mother (83 yrs old), she said it hits the spot perfectly on her back that aches.  So if she is that pleased, then it is a great product to me.  Thanks!

title: Handy letter opener
text: Great, .sturdy letter opener for home or office. Fits the hand and opens envelopes effectively.

title: Fun Way to Paint
text: Fun way to paint without the mess. My granddaughter (a blossoming young artist ; } ) loves these brushes. We have several different sets of colors and they're all great.

title: Miss leading photos text: Product image shows the stand up and angled for use with the phone and tablet upright. This is not possible. You can only use the phone holder and book/tablet holder when the surface is flat. And tilt and your stuff will just fall on its face.

Would not spend the extra money for those attachments again. The stand itself is great quality. It’s a shame they let functional details slip through.

title: Very nice
text: This is a very nice coin bank. It is a lot of fun for the kids. I really like something that can teach the kids about saving money. The kids thought this was nice. It worked okay. I think it would make a nice gift. It is easy to use. I would recommend it.

title: Seems to work pretty good
text: I think I can say that there is a different quality to the prints.  They seem a little less fully melted to the page than the original toner, but definitely not nearly enough of a difference to be worried, especially at the price difference.  We got reviewer cartridges a while ago and finally gave up on waiting for the HP one to run out.  We put in the new cartridge and did not get any errors or have any issues seating the cartridge.  It may "squeak" a little more when printing, but again, we might be nitpicking too much.  All in all, it pretty much works the same.

title: Works better than expected.
text: I was really surprised to see that this set of inks worked in this old printer I have got. I bought this printer some time ago to print on CDs and it has been a great printer for that. So, when I saw this set of ink that would fit this XP 620 for the price cheaper than the black ink alone by the WE WILL says, the E Co. I had to try it and buy it and to my surprise it worked fine. I was going to give it a lower number because I did not realize that I had to put 2 ink cartridges in at the same time, both of my black inks, the big black and little black was out.  I only replaced the big black at 1st and I still could not print it took me a while to figure out that it was also saying PK and the black, but I got it and it worked fine I had replaced two cartridges instead of 1 as I thought I should. So, it is all to the good. five stars should do it. Thank you for reading my review. I hope it has been helpful to you. God bless you. May the rest of your life be the best of your life.  OZ

title: Decent record keeper for 6th graders
text: Not too much ability to scrapbook but asks cute questions for the 6th grader to fill in them self. Some photo pages in the back and places to put things in pockets. Not too bad, could have been bigger pages with scrap ability, but otherwise cute

title: I LOVE my Brother laser printer, and will always use Brother ink cartridges for it.
text: I have had printers ruined by generic ink. I’ll only use Brother in my Brother printer. Reasonable price, arrived very promptly, has free recycling for used cartridge. I’m very happy with Brother products.

title: ... used these on our Disney Trip and I felt better knowing if one of my kiddos got lost in ...
text: We used these on our Disney Trip and I felt better knowing if one of my kiddos got lost in the crowds she had all the information needed to get back to us ASAP

title: Absolutely Precious and Adorable Cards for Valentine's Day! text: If you are looking for the most precious and adorable cards to give this Valentine's Day you can't go wrong with these. I won't be mailing these individually but am thinking about sending a card with cookies, so these cards will go in a box of treats! Two of the cards could be given to friends, but one is a cupid and says "Be Mine Valentine." One has hearts on it that say kiss me, be mine, you and me and hugs. The other cards say:

"Have a Sweet Day"
"Wishing You All The Happiness Your Heart Can Hold!"

and

"Happy Valentine's Day"

These have the charm of homemade cards without all the work! I love them and I know they are going to make the recipients smile. :) I think I'm going to make double chocolate cookies!

~The Rebecca Review

title: Fine shredder
text: Works well for small shredding jobs.  I shred monthly identifying information from bills, etc. For bigger jobs, I recommend the larger version if this  Amazon product.

title: Great for crossing out labels when re-using boxes text: I purchased these for one purpose only - to scrawl out labels on boxes I use for re-shipping. I purchased/tried quite a few markers and I wasn't happy with any of them - they are either too thing, or too light, or dry out too quickly. I didn't want to use paint markers because I need the ink to dry very quickly, within a few seconds, with no chance of rubbing off. So I purchased these instead and I use them only to cross out labels so I don't have to rip off the barcodes. They work quite well on everything except those special hydrophobic/oleophobic labels UPS sometimes uses which repel pretty much everything.

I also purchased the 4-pack of Sharpie Pros. I *think* I like those a little better, mostly because they have a broader tip and what I think is blacker (more opaque) ink, not sure. I like having both because where one doesn't work, the other sometimes will, the Milwaukee is rated for a greater number of surfaces than the Sharpie is. If you have to choose one or the other, maybe go with the Sharpie Pro, but these are good too.

title: Unsteady, etc
text: Stupidly I did not check it out soon enough and could not return it. My two reasons for wanting to return it, are that it does not sit still when sharpening. It actually moves around.....! Also, about 50% of the time, it does not sharpen evenly!  And then it stopped working completely!

title: Excellent Pocket Notebooks
text: This is a nice set of 60 pocket notebooks. The notebooks are the perfect size to slip into the back pocket of a pair of jeans. Each notebook features a protective cover and has 60 pages. The covers come in a variety of vibrant colors. These are useful notebooks to have around the house. They're convenient for grocery lists, daily tasks, or creative projects. This is a useful bulk supply of good quality pocket notebooks.

title: A Waste of Time and Money!
text: Although I usually use the Epson ink, I took a chance and ordered these remanufactured cartridges.  The colors work ok, but after only a few copies, the black ink did not work.  I use these for my Etsy shop and was counting on quality items as advertised.  Too late to return and I had to order the Epson cartridge which works fine as usual.

title: Disappointed
text: I'm super disappointed and I really wanted to love this planner but it's kind of silly that I have to buy (at least) two a year.. who wants to carry around two planners to plan their year out? For the money this planner is totally not worth it... :(

title: Seems nice text: [[VIDEOID:dedfd94a89a5d40cf74517610a71fbe3]] This seems very nice.

It looks like a good idea for tracking various expenses.

Pages can be inserted easily into the book and then replaced as needed. I would imagine this is good for something looking to better manage their money and understand how it comes in, and goes out.

title: Very professional and classy-looking!
text: This is a very sharp-looking notebook - very professional appearing, and it fits neatly in most handbags.  The cover is a midnite blue, very smooth to the touch.  The inside pages are ruled.  In this fast-moving age, a notebook beside the phone or computer is a necessity.  An excellent event planner, list repository or just plain note taker.  This is a notebook that makes a good impression.

title: High Quality Paper Mailer with Padding In Between the Paper! text: If you enjoy sending things in the mail and like padded mailers then these will make you very happy. They are made of high quality brown paper and what feels like some sort of advanced padding in between the paper.

You can fit a book or an item of clothing or maybe even a few bars of chocolate into the bags! The 11 x 13.9 size is generous. You could also fit documents that are 8 1/2 x 11 in these envelopes.

I'm happy with them and will definitely look for more when they run out. I love that they are self-sealing so you don't have to worry about packaging tape! Perfect!!!

~The Rebecca Review

P.S. My cat Fuzz did me the favor of totally ripping up one of these paper mailers so now I know what is inside the padded portion. It is paper cut in a zig zag shape. Very interesting. Thanks Fuzz!

title: perfect
text: fast and accurate

title: These worked great for us
text: Pricing for a garage sale is a daunting task. These are removable and some prices get switched. Humidity is really hard on the stickers. They will fall off.

title: Great buy
text: I'm a student and it's perfect for online studying. 100% recommend.

title: Attractive COVID vaccination card protector with hole for lanyard or clip (NOT INCLUDED)
text: This card is designed specifically for a vaccination card. It fits my COVID vaccination card perfectly. The green holder is super attractive but is a bit large to fit in a wallet. I put this in my wallet but it is one that should be used with a lanyard or some sort of clip and hung around one's neck or clipped to one's outfit. Note that no lanyard or clip are included.

title: Good Quality for the Money
text: Top quality compared to off brand and cheaper-made index cards. Lines are bold, consistent and paper quality is top notch. Only brand of index cards I’ll buy, and I use thousands within a year’s time.

title: Nice once you manage to set it up
text: I think it ended up taking me two or three days (off and on) to get this printer set up. I started on my desktop but had trouble with the software so I switched to the install on my phone. It was NOT intuitive and didn't "automatically" set up. I had trouble getting it onto my network and had to keep coming back later because it wasn't easy. I've still had trouble occasionally with printing from my phone and it seems to be working just fine now but it was a pain to set up. I'm fairly techie and this was just frustrating. That being said now that it's set up, it's a fairly nice laser printer. It's relatively fast and produces great quality. (Be sure to reset the printer to single sheets if you don't want front to back -- that's what mine defaulted to). Footprint is good, once I got it setup it seems to be working fine and hopefully it'll stay that way.

title: nice!
text: nice!

title: Ok for what you get and bbn pay for
text: Not the best, but I guess you get what you pay for

title: Super Useful
text: I ordered this item because I use my iPat, pay bills and write in my journal while in bed. This is the perfect thing for that. I love that this lap table tilts and has a large surface for writing. It easily closes and opens. This item is very sturdy and would highly recommend it,

title: Amazing Photos
text: The cards were so Amazing and I can’t lie both my son and I enjoyed them. I must admit I snuck a Jimin photo card.

title: Just wish the legs spread couple inches wider I use it in my recliner
text: It's fine like it.  This is what I've been looking for

title: Unique text: This card was so sweet.
The pop up feature is so neat.
What a unique card. It really is one of a kind. It is something they can really display.
This is a very nice card. We always buy cards from this company and are always happy. The quality of the card is very nice. The paper is nice and thick. It is always folded right. The colors are bright and vibrant.
The recipient liked it a lot. I would recommend it.

title: Heavy Duty double walled boxes
text: Purchased these to help a friend who lives in another state - who is moving.  She reports they are the perfect size because they aren't too big - which sometimes get overfilled and become too heavy.  They are double walled.  She plans to use them and break them down and store them - worth keeping.

title: Beautiful card.
text: It was a beautiful well made card. High end.

title: Ink Review
text: Got to me fast. Works well but like other substitutes, the printer won't read it because it's not their product.

title: As Advertised
text: I have to wear a lanyard everyday, with my ID and work keys attached.  I needed a little extender, as I found myself taking it on and off all the time.  The rhinestones weren't a necessity here, and I actually worried they would be too blingy, but it's all good!  These are both fine and work as advertised.  Overall, they're good and do what I need.

title: Printer paper.
text: Fine paper for value.

title: Beautiful! Perfect for Christmas card envelopes
text: We used these for our recent Christmas card envelopes and they were perfect! We loved the gold outlining on the labels. They were extremely easy to use when creating them on the computer and editing them. We just used the template that Avery recommended. The labels went onto the envelopes easily and stayed in place. We had many compliments on how classy these labels were on the envelopes! I would definitely use these again.

title: Laminator/trimmer/hole puncher text: -Laminator was easy to use
-instructions were easy to understand
-Plug laminator in and choose 3mm/5mm thickness of item to laminate
-wait for it to heat and green light to come on, indicating readiness
-place item in with folded sheet side first
-allow item to slowly move through laminator
-make sure there's enough room for the item to come out flat, if not and you have to pull it up and out then it will cause bubbles and not laminate smoothly
-the trimmer is iffy. It cuts a straight line from time to time, but there is too much wiggle room allowing the line to go crooked
-also, its kind of difficult to lay the item and find a straight line to cut on since the measurement marks are vertical and you lay the paper horizontally
-the hole puncher is a 2 hole punch, works fine, but I'm not sure most people use a two hole punch unless its for documents going into a folder with the clasp on the top
-overall works fine, the only thing I dont like is the paper trimmer and that I was really looking forward to

title: Accurate Electronic Scale; AccuPost Software Could Be Better text: This ACCUPOST PP-110 DESKTOP POSTAL SCALE with USB cable and 10-lb. load capacity weighs in 1/8-oz. increments, and seems to be quite accurate for its entire range. I tested it with letters weighing less than half an ounce or only a few ounces, and compared the weights to those registered by an [[ASIN:B002UEZ2FC Ozeri Professional Digital Kitchen Food Scale]]. Both scales gave the same results. (This scale replaces my old Pelouze 5-lb. mechanical spring scale, which weighed in 1/2-oz. increments, and wasn't at all accurate for lightweight letters.)

I also tested this scale with two 5-lb. bags of sugar, which weighed a total of 10 lbs. 1-1/4 oz. The results were generally consistent, although a single bag sometimes registered at 5 lbs. 3/4 oz. (instead of 5 lbs. 5/8 oz.)--probably because the extra packaging weight was very close to 3/4 oz. This scale also weighs in grams and kilograms.

I was a little disappointed to learn that the software doesn't automatically calculate the postage that needs to be added to the letter or package. (I was hoping for software that would let me download postage rate changes to my computer, and then would compute postage amounts automatically whenever I weighed something.) Instead, you must (1) visit the appropriate USPS, UPS, or FedEx web site, (2) find the appropriate page for calculating postage or shipping, and (3) paste in the weight. If you're using the MSIE browser, the software will send the weight directly to the calculation page (no pasting required), but this is probably not worth the effort of plugging in the USB cable and getting the weight to display on your computer screen.

The software was hard to find--the link in the user's manual didn't work, and the download link on the AccuPost home page didn't work for Windows 7. Eventually I found a working download link on the AccuPost 10 lb. scale product page in the AccuPost Online Store. The Win7 software requires Microsoft NET Framework 4, a free download. The software itself is a bit glitchy (doesn't always respond if it's been open for a while), but it usually works okay to show and paste in weights, handle the "tare" and "hold" buttons, and turn the scale on and off.

The scale comes with a power adapter, which is great to have if you do a lot of mailing. Since I don't, I opted to use 3 AA batteries (not included) to power the scale. The software works with either the power adaptor or the battery option (unplug the power adaptor first). Because my postal scale is located on a table some 6-8 feet from my computer, I used an [[ASIN:B001TH7GUU AmazonBasics USB Extension Cable]] to successfully supplement the included 40-inch USB cable.

The "tare" feature works flawlessly: you can add an item, such as an empty container, then hit "tare" to return the weight to zero so that you can put something in the container to find its weight separately. The "hold" feature allows you to hold the weight display when you are weighing something large that overlaps the display--you hit the button and wait for the two beeps, then when you remove the large item the weight will still be showing. The extra-large numbers in the display are another excellent feature.

I like this electronic postal scale a lot, and find that it does everything that's reasonably expected of a postal scale. However, because of the slightly glitchy and mildly disappointing software, I rate it at 4 stars ("I like it" on the official Amazon scale).

title: Inspiration in a Box text: I'm a writer and I have lots of inspiration cards like this. Each has advantages. This set is very practical. They are the kinds of things you can pull out in the morning, focus on during the day, and then reflect upon in the evening.

The affirmation cards have a similar format, each starting with a quotation, but the suggestion at the bottom is framed as something to tell yourself rather than a question to ask yourself. There are more question cards than affirmation cards.

title: Smooth as silk writing, comfortable in the hand ... text: I've used a few Paper Mate Inkjoy gel pens in the past and really like the smooth easy writing. This is a new set, more colors, and a different shape.

I received the 14-pen medium point set and the colors are really striking. I've played with all of them, and the ink color is quite close to the pen color (red is red, turquoise is turquoise, etc.). They're also quick drying -- much faster than earlier versions of the Inkjoy product. The size and shape are also nice -- I have severe osteoarthritis especially in my right hand (and of course, I'm right-handed), and the size and shape, combined with the comfort grip (a softer rubber-like material that surrounds the pen) really helps.

A note for those into adult coloring books: Not all gel pens are created equal. Some are better for writing, others are better for coloring. In my opinion, these are best used for writing, annotating journals or scrapbooks, etc. They aren't nearly as well suited to coloring in coloring books. For one thing, you don't get as much ink in these are you do in gel pens specifically designed for coloring. These will run out much faster. Also, they're retractable, which works great for writing and transporting a pen or two in your pocket or purse; not as much for quick access in coloring. They will work for coloring -- just like any other gel pen, they don't have as much of a bleed-through issue, and you do get a lot of colors that aren't as available in gel pens designed for coloring. But be aware that if used for coloring, they'll likely run out of ink faster than other brands.

That said, I really do like these, and will be using them often in my hand-crafted greeting cards and for annotating my journal.

title: Hard To Use text: I'm a planner junky. This planner has some good parts, but some glaring flaws. The good first:
I like the amount of space in each day. You have two columns on a page. You can either plan for two people (or split your work and personal planning in a side by side manner) for 12 hours (beginning at 7). OR you could plan out the entire 24 hours, using one column for day hours and the other for night hours. Each daily page has a small calendar at a glance at the top of the page for the current month, previous month, and next month. The days are numbered with the current day of the year and how many days are left in the year (3/363, 151/214, 289/76, etc.) This does contain the entire year. The last pages is a three year at a glance calendar. It does list holidays on the pages. It does lay completely flat when open.
Now, the glaring problems. There are no tabs, so finding a given month to jot something on the calendar isn't quick. Sundays do not get a full day. The bottom of Saturday is cut short at 11 hours instead of 12 hour and you get 4 blank lines for Sunday. If you have busy weekends, this may not work at all. (Which is pretty much where I found myself.) There are no transitions between months. No monthly calendar at all. There is only a tiny space (2 lines) to write non- time specific items. You could put washi tape over all the times and just write in whatever you want. My other issue is the inconsistency in the start of the year and end of the year. The calendar starts on January 1st. Which is a Tuesday. No Sunday and Monday for that week is included. You just start your new calendar on Tuesday. But it doesn't end the same way. You would think if they chose to stick to only 2019, the calendar would also end on a Tuesday, December 31st, right? Nope. It ends on January 3rd, which is a Friday. It didn't even finish that week. Just added three extra days at random. That completely bothers me.

title: Why Do I DO This To Myself? But Two Packs If you Plan to Use These text: I have been making business cards and other similar things for business for quite a few years now. Back when I first started to use Avery products, I might have had a few glitches with various printers and programs now and then, but most of the time, printing business cards was a breeze. They were not to awfully difficult to set up and print, having most of the cards turn out right except perhaps for the last row of cards, perhaps.

As time has gone on, however, I tend to get lulled into a sense of stupor, when I think that I can get business cards to print out successfully. I have tested them on two different printers. For some reason, the cards don't print out and line up the way that they should. Being that HP is one of the most common brands of printers, I find that to be doubly frustrating. I really don't want to have to work THIS hard to get simple business cards to print out. I really love the idea of two sided cards also.

This set of Avery cards is one of the most frustrating I have had to cope with to date.

The sheets of cards themselves are well labeled Front and Back so you know how to put them into your printer. They are thick and the perforations are not so flimsy that they come apart before you have a chance to print them out. Nor are they so hard to get apart that your cards look like they were torn from paper sheets. I am referring to the appearance of the PHYSICAL cards. The printed is another story.

I have tested these cards over and over in a variety of ways and to this point, I still have not been able to get a sheet to print out the way that it should. I have used the Avery program as it is with a few different printers, and I have nudged (for printer adjusting)on the Avery site, as well as tried to rearrange the graphics on the card to allow for any hidden marginal errors that seem to be throwing these cards into chaos when they print.

I can not do it at this point.

WHAT I LIKE
-Cards are heavy
-Perforations are sturdy
-Sheets are labeled well.
-Ink prints well on the paper (appearance not location)
-Gives me flexibility to hopefully print out unique cards as many as I would like (theoretically, anyway)

WHAT I DON'T LIKE
-Avery program does not lay out properly for my HP printers
-Program on Avery seems to conflict with my printer drivers sending them into freezing etc
-Sheets won't print out without printing another sheet afterward
-VERY frustrating to try to set up and print. Takes WAY too much time than it should
-Importing another saved Avery product is useless- better to start off fresh

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you are planning to use the Avery site to do your printing of cards, I HIGHLY suggest purchasing two packages- one for experimenting and one when you figure out how to make it work. No matter how many times I use plain paper (as suggested by Avery) when I think I have it right, on the card stock, it just does not line up right.

I know there has to be a way to get at least MOST of these to print out so I can use them, but I have not found it yet. These are great quality cards physically and I plan to do another layout using my graphics professional program and at least getting them to print out fairly well if I can do it. I have given these three stars because I really do love the idea of it, the physical quality of the double sided cards are great, but it is just the translating it from Avery site to printer to card that I am struggling with.

If you plan to do a quick and easy business card printing, you might want to rethink it and give yourself PLENTY of time and experimentation. If you are one of the lucky ones that gets this to print out perfectly right away- I envy you!

UPDATING
As with most of my reviews, if I have anything to add in the future or if I find a solution, I will update, re-adjust my rating and let you know about it.

PRINTERS USED
HP Officejet K550dtn
HP Envy 4500

title: Solid storage option text: The box is lightweight, but sturdy aluminum casing I believe. It looks great, and will be able to take some drops/knocks.
As advertised, it will hold at least 80 slabbed coins. It has 4 rows that you could probably fit 21 in each, although it would be tight. I was not aware when I ordered it, but the rows do NOT have notches for each coin, so the amount of space between coins is up to you. I am using this to house my slabbed silver State Quarter collection, which is about 60 coins. I have ~ 15 per row, and it gives them plenty of room to have some space between each coin, and year.
After storing them for a bit and moving it around and coming back to it, my coins were in exactly the same place I put them. They are staying securely.
This is a nice big box, which is hard to find for 50+ slabs, the only knock being that the foam is not individually slotted.

title: My Sanity
text: I started keeping one of these when I retired to record new things, but it turned out to be a godsend to pour out accomplishments and grief in during a year when my husband was in the hospital three times and I wrecked my beloved 14-year-old PT Cruiser. The publishers change the design every year and I really dislike the 2020 design so I bought another copy of this 2018 version for future years. I use it to keep track of my chores, things I've crossed off the to-do list, my exercise, what podcasts I've listened to, even to memorialize folks like Alex Trebek. I love these big planner journals and have bought much too many sets of stickers to go with them!

Seems to hold up well during shipping which is most important to me and my customers.. They are not thick but they have good tension if trying to tear. Sometime I get a small nick in them if my product has sharp edges or if I try to stuff the envelope too much. Otherwise, I love this brand and mil size. The colors and styles add a nice touch to boring mail, so I get many compliments from my customers. It's a bit more expensive than solid colors but well worth it if you want that extra flair in your mailings. Will definitely buy again if needed.

title: These stack and pull apart easily text: My 10-year-old son is obsessed with these block cubes! I can honestly say these are his favorite toy. He has severe ADHD and always has a fidget in his hands. He's also highly focused and comforted by numbers (counting, time, and math); so to have dozens of blocks that he can rearrange, count, and stack over and over again.... well he finds it ridiculously thrilling.
Our first home set was made by the name brand maker Learning Resources. But naturally, quite a few cubes have gotten lost over the years and his stacks are noticeably smaller. Words cannot even explain how excited he was when I pulled these cubes out of the Amazon box. Nor are there words to explain how relieved I was when I saw these fit perfectly with our old name brand cubes. My son is so happy. Can't recommend them enough!

title: Thirsty card just sounds like highschool puppy love text: I love cards and buy them for random reasons throughout the year. There's just something lovely about getting a sweet card in the mail unexpectedly and I try to pass that feeling on to our friends.

(Review of the Mahogany Thirsty Card)

This, however, just struck me as off. It's not unattractive per se, but it feels unbalanced and the decorations are just sort of scattered all over it. The message has a distinct immaturity as well. My first impression wasn't of love or adoration, but some poor, acne plagued, 14 year old boy trying to convince his first girlfriend of his undying love.

I asked my husband to read it without sharing my impressions. He laughed and said "are we in highschool?" So it's not just me. I won't be passing this one on to him for our anniversary.

title: Smoothest Pen I've Ever Used!
text: I like pens. I buy pens..... A LOT! Of course, the pens I usually buy are not 23k gold. I tend to buy fun, disposable pens that cost just a fraction of this one. I do have to say that this pen is the smoothest pen I've ever used. The ink flows so smoothly without any interruption. The cheap rollerball pens that I have, usually have some kind of hitch that require shaking or making circles/scratch marks to get the flow going again. This pen had no hesitation or interruption of ink at all which was very impressive. I was also surprised that the ink doesn't smear, at least on the paper I have been using so far. I'm sure a non-porous paper would smear, but I've been running my finger over my writings and there have been no smears at all. The pen comes in a fancy box, ready for gifting. It really is a gift worthy pen if there's such a thing. I do think it's pretty pricey, but it is a quality writing tool.

title: Almost a great gradebook.
text: My school has stopped providing us with grade and plan books.  While I have moved with the times and have a blended classroom, I am still old school enough to want physical gradebooks and planners.  Since I was paying for it myself I opted for a pretty cover.  It is convenient and I like that I have it all in one book. In the gradebook there are 50 rows to a page.  At first I didn't like this but with my smaller classes I found that i can skip a line between students allowing me to make more notations.  The rows are also shaded every two rows (2 rows white, 2 rows green) which makes it easier to distinguish entries.  Another nice feature is a 6th column at the end of each week. I use it to record daily vocab study on the website we use. The book itself is pretty sturdy and is holding up to the abuse of daily use and transport in my laptop bag. The gradebook pages are perforated at the outside edge which is typical of these books and is useful when you switch marking periods. The perforation is too close.  The pages tear easily when you flip pages.  I ended up using clear tape to secure the page so that I don't end up ripping out the student names. it bothers me enough that I'm not sure I would buy this again.  Others might not mind it so much.

title: Ready to use right out the box.  Ergonomically comfortable.

Used it over critical information and with just one swipe..you couldn’t read anything.  Ink dried super fast and hence you can’t rub it off.  Highly recommend at this price point.  I will still shred, but mind will be very at ease.  Very comfortable to use in 5 minutes of admin I was working on inspire this is small.

title: jaw clip good for notebook, will crunch single papers text: Looks exactly like it does in the picture.
I have both the small memo sized holder as well as the larger letter sized. I like both, not sure which one will get more use. I tend to do use the smaller one for my list making needs. I am always jotting stuff down, and I like that I have a hard surface to write on--- notebooks and the cardboard back of memo pads isn't always enough. I could use a flat clip board, but I use the compartment to store odds-n-ends (ie, coupons, rubber band, paper clips, calculator, writing implements, some other papers). It is a nice little size for daily use. But,

Thoughts:
-- I don't see the need (personally) for the cover. If I have a memo pad clipped to the front, the cover may not be able to cover it, depending on where the perforation is (ie, use clip to hold all of memo pad and it would be covered except for one page, and that page would still be attached, but sitting above cover. If perforation mark is low on notebook, then it will interfere with using it this way). I tried to show it in pictures, but hard to capture.
--The clip is strong, and it has teeth, both upper and lower. SO, just having a single piece of paper in the clip jaws will crunch it a bit from pressure of top teeth onto bottom teeth. This would not work well for company documents. As for holding a memo pad in place, or a stack of papers (maybe), it will hold everything together securely. I included a pic that tried to capture this.

title: Very nice all in one HP printer, but you'll need to do some homework regarding HP+ benefits... text: I got so tired of constantly having to reconnect my old Ricoh printer cause its network abilities was so bad. This HP was easy to set up, and the print quality is superb. However, I'm still a little foggy about the bonus 6 months free ink. During the set-up, I declined the 6 months free ink because the fine print was that you have to use original HP ink for the life of the printer. I'm someone who is not picky about print quality, since I'm not doing photos at home. So it's important for me to be able to use 3rd party ink. So I'm not sure what happens for those who do agree to HP+ terms. Do they beam some sort of firmware update that makes it impossible for you to use 3rd party ink? LOL! How will they police this? In any case, I didn't want to take the chance, and I declined the 6 months free ink.

* 2-sided printing and scanning
* Mobile and wireless printing
* Auto document feeder
* LCD screen
* Scan to cloud

Very good printer. If they had forced HP+ on me, then it would be 3-Stars. Since HP+ is an option, this is 5-Stars!

I have a large laptop and this works great. I can keep small items in the little pullout shelf, which may hold a writing pen or two and some glasses, or stylus pens. title: The best way to take credit cards
text: I own a small business and have a Square account. Using the equipment usually offered for mobile sales was a bit cumbersome and it was hard for me to keep track of where things were. I also didn't like dedicating one of my devices to the task of taking credit cards. This changed everything. It makes my business look much more professional and it is so easy to use. I go to craft shows and used this at the last one I was at. We initially ran into an issue with finding my hot spot but after a few minutes of anxiety, we got the unit up and running. In my case, AC is always an issue, but with the purchase of a small "portable power station" I can power this all day. Granted, this is marketed as a solution for a "brick and mortar" store, but it can be used for those of us that are more nomadic.  If you use the app, you can use this and the customer screen allows the customer to feel more confident and they never give up possession of their credit card. It's also easier for them to decide their receipt choice. All in all, this is a great addition for you to get. I highly recommend it.

title: One Of The Better Seat Cushions I Have Tried To Date text: I have been looking for a seat cushion. Some of the ones I have tried are so thin, they don't do much. Others are great, but they are so small they are built more for tiny people or children with small rear ends. Then there is the cushion that guarantees not to flatten out. Fred Flintstone would have like THAT one. Let's take a look at this cushion.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This cushion literally does have a dark blue covering but there is mesh where the gel part shows through. It is pretty strong mesh, though. The fabric on the outside is pretty tough- not velvety, thankfully. It is like a very thick double knit. The bottom of the cushion is slip resistant and it actually works as compared to others.

CUSHION SHAPING
This cushion has shaping to it which allows for the buttocks to fit on the cushion and it also has a curve cut out so that the tail bone is not having pressure on it. The front is not too high or sloped so that it is comfortable to sit on.

HANDLE
There is a fabric webbed handle that you can carry the cushion with you, so if you plan to move it around, it makes it easier to carry with other things in your hands.

COMFORT
This is way more comfortable than the Fred Flintstone cushion that I most recently got. It gives, but is not so soft that it will be flat in a week. I would say that this would probably stay pretty supportive for up to a year before it might start to flatten too much to use.

GEL
The gel part really does help keep cool compared to some foam cushions. I don't think it is anything miraculous, but it is also winter. When it is summer, I might feel differently about this.

HEIGHT
The height of this is about right. It is not too thick so you can not use it in a car, but it is not so thin that it is not much good. It is about 2 inches at its widest.

WHERE HAVE I USED THIS AT?
I have used this in the car, on a recliner, hard dining room chair, and on a desk chair that is too hard for me. It worked well in all of the locations and I was happy that it did not slide around easily.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For use in the house, car, or even wheelchair, this cushion is a good one so far. It won't last for YEARS, but it will last a good amount of time if you need to use it constantly. It stays put, has just enough give to it, and is shaped well for longer periods of sitting.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I like this one. I was going to give it to my daughter for her car, but I think I might have to get her another one. This one works better than the others I have tried so far. I hope it lasts quite a while. I like it.

title: These flat  rings are wonderful--read how to open them by pressing on them, without needing to use tools or your fingernails!

title: My Rating For These Is Two Fold Opposite- Please Read To See Why text: WARNING: This is a rather in depth review of these pencils. I am reviewing them from two points of view- beginners/kids/coloring book fans and professional level artists. If you prefer a brief summary, see section marked THE BOTTOM LINE
-------------------------------------------------------
To start off with, I am an artist. I use a HUGE range of professional top of the line pencils, bottom of the line, and everything in between. If there is a brand of pencils out there in a well known name, I have probably used them and most likely own some or all of them. I would list them all, but I don't want to bore you.

This review will be from the dual perspective of a new artist, kids, and hobbyists and then as a professional level artist.

WHAT ARE THESE PENCILS LIKE?
These pencils are colored on the entire barrel with whatever color the lead is. There are no numbers or color names on the pencils so there is no way to refer to them if you were trying to note which ones you were using to someone else.

BOX
The box is a hinged metal tin box and it closes pretty tightly to keep the pencils protected.

TRAYS
The trays in the box are flimsy. They have grabbing indents in them, but they are just not practical for using so I transferred them to a colored pencil case with elastic bands to hold in all of the pencils for easier use.

PENCIL COLORS
The colors in this set are gorgeous. There is a nice range, although if you are into grays, there are very few so that might be a concern for you. There are quite a few browns, brights, blues, greens, orange, yellow and reds.

QUALITY OF LEAD
Here is where I have to get you to pay attention to my review. The leads in these pencils are bright, strong, and lay down on paper pretty well.

LEAD QUALITY FOR BEGINNERS
For beginners, the leads in these pencils are beautiful, great assortment and will perform beautifully for most coloring books, art projects, or introductory colored pencil use for kids or older beginners.

LEAD QUALITY FOR ARTISTS/PROFESSIONALS
Now the colors in this set are beautiful, BUT there is a heavy waxy in these. That means that you can lay down a layer or two but after that, it becomes very waxy. That means waxy bloom really fast. So, if you are the type of person that likes to layer colors to get a lot of depth, these will not work well for that. In fact, this is probably the most waxy colored pencil set I have yet. The pigments are beautiful, but the waxy tendencies are these are best for few layers and just basic laying down of color.

DO THESE SHARPEN WELL?
These pencils do sharpen well. they don't seem to break easily and the colors do lay down nicely at first.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you are a hobbyist or have kids who really want to do some nice art with colored pencils, this set is a nice set. The colors are beautiful and the range is fantastic. If you are an artist who uses a lot of layers, these are probably not going to be what you want unless you plan to use a solvent with them.

In any case, I highly recommend getting a "book style" colored pencil case to keep these in if you decide to buy them as the trays are too flimsy for use.

MY RATING
For hobbyists and kids, FIVE STARS.
For artists and professionals TWO STARS.

Average rating comes out to be THREE STARS. These are nice for coloring books when I don't want to waste my really good pencils but still want beautiful colors. I will use them a lot for my down time.

PHOTO
In this photo with my review, I have posted the same three similar colors (some are layers of more than one) from some of the sets of colored pencils that I have. I have labeled them accordingly. I have tried to get the photo as accurate as I can, and I think you can see the differences well enough, despite how hard it is to capture on camera.

THE BOTTOM LINE

title: Favorite Pens - Big Thick Bold text: I love these pens. I have been using these 1.6mm VELOCITY Bold point Black pens for several years. I used to buy them at Walmart's Checkout Displays. But there were only four pens in the pack. I went through those pretty quickly with all the writing I do. These pens were so smooth they made writing effortless for my nerve damaged hand.

Buying them in a 12 pack was much more advantageous. Less trips to the store, cheaper cost, more pens to use over a longer period of time. I love how easy it is to write both in cursive and to print on my Wide spaced Steno notepads. They make me want to write even more. There's just not enough hours in the day, but I make sure to use them at home, at work, in the car, sitting on the porch, upstairs and downstairs.

Some people don't like the thicker body pens or the Bold 1.6mm pen point. Being retractable keeps them from staining my hands, or any porous surface like bedding, upholstery, and clothing. If you give them a try and know ahead of time the pen's lines and body are thicker, but lighter weight you will love it.

I recommend them with a huge smile of contentment :0)

title: Perfect for small spaces! text: I was looking for a storage shelf for my bathroom in a very slim area between the toilet and the wall, and this fit the bill. It fit perfectly in the spot I was intending it for.
It arrived packaged well and smart. All of the parts were within the cart bin. There are instructions, but they’re not in English- BUT, they are visual instructions, so you don’t technically need the text. You could always use google translate for it if you really need it. But, if you’re a handy person, you don’t need the instructions.
The actually shelf bins aren’t very sturdy and the sides can be bent with one finger. This doesn’t bother me, as I’m using it to hold toilet papers, etc. the plastic does bounce back after it’s been bent. I don’t know how well this will fair holding plates and such, as shown in the listing photos.
Overall, I’m happy with it. The shelf works where I need it, and the cut outs design on the shelves are really cute and make it look airy.

title: Does what it's supposed to do ... text: Super easy to assemble, even for an old lady with mobility issues.

I use two of these in my "kitchen." I live in an assisted living facility, so "kitchen" is a gross exaggeration -- I have a 2-burner electric cooktop, an 11"x11" sink, a decent-sized refrigerator, and a microwave oven -- no counter space at all, and only one small overhead cupboard. They fit under the counter and hold a lot of things that would normally be stowed in cabinets: small appliances like a countertop grill, measuring cups/spoons, pans that I use in my air fryer, etc.

I wouldn't store anything too heavy in this unit -- but it's sturdy enough to hold a couple of pounds of potatoes plus the assortment of cooking utensils and small pans/dishes.

Definitely worth the investment.

title: Large calendar with lots of writing space, tabs, reinforced hanging holes and a pocket
text: The calendar's designer has included so many thoughtful features missing in others. Each day of the month has a full line not just a little square, for appointments and events. Each month has a tab, so it's easy to find future dates in a flash. The last page has a pocket for receipts, tickets, schedules, and other important papers you need to keep handy. Best of all, each month has a reinforced hole. (You know how, halfway through the month the top of the hole tears and the top part flops down? Not with this one! Fantastic!) The only possible downside is the size. Because of all the features, this calendar is big--too big for our fridge door, and maybe yours too. No problem for us. We hung it up in the hall.

title: My ID Badge is Handy and Clean! text: I'm really impressed with the N1JSHN 3 Pack Heavy Duty Retractable Black Badge Lanyards. There are a few very useful/thoughtful features that make this set stand out. This is a lanyard with a safety release, the release is a hard plastic, but you are free to adjust the placement of that release anywhere you like. This will keep you from getting hurt if the lanyard is caught in equipment. There is also a retractable reel to hold the badge. That alone stretches my entire arm's length, so along with the additional length of the lanyard, it can go a long way and it reels back very smoothly. My favorite feature of this set is the ID badge sleeves. They seal, which is wonderful for me since I am often frequenting scrub sinks at work. I splash water all over myself constantly, along with occasional sprays from other sources.... now, since my badges are sealed, they are going to stay in excellent condition and I can wipe the sleeve easily. Six sealable sleeves are included in the set.

This set is a really great value. It's good quality and I really would pick this style over others I have tried, which have been many over the years. I highly recommend this to anyone that needs their ID badge visible and handy. Thank you for reading my review. I hope my experience is helpful to you and you kindly will click the button below.

title: Great Desk and Table With Great Features text: I recently had a major surgery that left me doing more sitting than I'd like. I also teach online classes and needed a way to hold a computer off my lap (because I had a lap desk that has a padded back, but it was uncomfortable). This one worked perfectly! There really wasn't much to do other than take it out of the box, pull the legs in to a standing position, and figure out how high I wanted it. Honestly, I really loved that I could put my phone at the front of the desk in the holder there, then angle the desk down a bit so I could comfortably type. I also have used it to read on my kindle. Again, I had a type of lap holder, but it wasn't comfortable with my surgery. The desk was a nice substitute so that I could read comfortably.

I get that not everything needs to be made more comfortable, but for my work and my surgery, it served a great multipurpose. I can also see using it for my aging mother if I need to step in more as a caretaker and need to bring her meals, etc. Overall, it's great planning for the future and for unforseen events. Don't get me wrong though, I'll be using this when I work from home too!

title: unsatisfactory-ness of life, book holders text: Four stars is probably the highest rating available for a book holder until consumer priorities change and it makes sense for companies to dump money into R&D.

This one is clever and offers a lot that others don't. It is by far the best i've used for small paperbacks, but book holders are really more handy for things that are unwieldy to hand hold - art books, anthologies, etc.

So, yeah - this is the best of its kind, which isn't saying much. It feels cheap and slightly fragile, though less so than any other I've tried, excepting a stainless steel holder my wife found at a kitchen store (not that it's a good holder - just _sturdy_).

For me the best combo available in 2021 is this book stand, plus any of the big, wooden ones with rubber-tipped, spring steel arms to hold the book open. That duo covers my needs closer to satisfactorily than anything else I've tried.

Maybe it would be useful to say something about why am I still messing with paper codices when I have extremely convenient alternatives in the digital realm, e.g. Zotero + PDF.

I haven't reasoned it all out, but I can say for sure that paper is durable in a way that digital stuff won't be any time soon - maybe they will invent durable digital media, maybe if Wall Street or the military wants it? Anyway, if someone 100 years from now is in the right place - a used bookstore, an estate sale, a thrift store - they might find the very books that I'm reading today. The Kindle books I "bought" 2 years ago have already evaporated and it would take some work on my end to find them again.

So that's a big part of it. I like to think I'm making a teensy contribution to the preservation of the printed word during a time when the idea of its unimportance is spreading like a gasoline fire - the way bad ideas do...

Also my experience of reading a physical book is different. Aesthetically, sure, but there's more to it than that. Like I said, I haven't thought this through, but there's something there. Nostalgia, sure. Maybe just that it's not a video screen, which maybe is permanently tainted ignoble in my mind - by association with entertainment and "social" media?

IDK the text is never the dream, and the medium is never the text. I just feel like more of it remains on a beautifully set paper page than on an imperceptibly flickering screen.

title: Better for small business than a home office.
text: I wanted to love this printer, and for the price (and it being a Samsung), I really thought I would. BUT...not so much. It's HUGE, far too large for typical home/family desk use, and was incredibly heavy to move from place to place until we found an appropriate spot for it. Our unit didn't come with a set-up CD, so we labored through some frustration trying to get it set up on our wireless and for use with our two desktop computers. The connectivity has been ok so far, and the printing is lightning fast. The on-board screen is not all that intuitive, which has made using its other functions (scanning, copying, etc) not as quick or easy. The unit comes with your first set of toner cartridges, but we were astounded at the price to replace them once we're through with these. Perhaps I am just the wrong customer for this kind of printer - we need it primarily for home office use, but it seems perhaps more suited for a small business. And for a home office, we have used and loved far cheaper printers (especially the HP Envy) that still have all the multi-function capabilities, including the cloud/mobile printing, but are far more user-friendly. We'll stick with those instead!

title: Handy, easy to use....off to the post office! text: The purpose of the label pad is for carry-with-you convenience. A handy pad for home, office, car. The concept is great, portable pads. What I don't like is that TO/FROM format. The From section is directly over the TO section, and that can cause confusion since many people don't read well. title: Commercial / Industrial Quality text: I used this well made, heavy duty lift cylinder to repair my 2001 Steelcase commercial office chair, that I use in the garage. A couple years ago, I tried to repair it with a cheaper cylinder, but it was no match for the heavy piece of American metal, that is the Steelcase. The Office Oasis lift cylinder quickly hoists up my garage chair like nothing.

One odd little bonus is that my lift cylinder came with some thin white gloves, with the "Office Oasis" logo on them. Curious bonus, but a bonus just the same I guess. I did not use the included collars at all in the cylinder replacement process, but they seem well made should you choose to use them.

If you are like me, and don't want to putz with collars and allen wrenches for such a simple task, a large pipe wrench (the bigger the better) and WD40 are your friends when removing your old cylinder from the mechanism bolted to the seat of your chair. There are You-Tube videos which go into further detail. If you spend more than 20 minutes trying to install this thing, and you cuss more than twice, you are doing something wrong. I didn't even spend 10 minutes, never cussed once, and I cuss a lot usually...

title: Perfect Solution for Organizing Stored Paper Products, Rolls of Trash Bags; Moderately Difficult to Assemble text: This wheeled KING SIZE WIRE BIN FILE (in white coated steel) is the perfect solution for organizing stockpiled paper products (food storage bags, trash bags, toilet paper, facial tissues, etc.) in my garage.

To save money, I usually purchase paper products by the case or in large-quantity packages. I have to store them in the garage. I've been storing them in [[ASIN:B002ORQ0QU Rubbermaid Storage Tubs]], but the tubs (1) don't let me see the stock on hand; (2) need unpacking whenever I need to remove something (a single roll of plastic food storage bags, for example); and (3) are heavy to move around when filled.

It makes perfect sense to store paper products--which are constantly being used up, and replaced--in a rolling wire cart like this one. The four divided sections are very tall and capacious, and the cart holds a lot of paper products. Best of all, when the cart is filled, it can be placed anywhere in the garage, because if it's blocking something it can be rolled out of the way.

This particular wire cart took me about 90 minutes to assemble. Snapping each clip onto a pair of steel wires required a fair amount of hand strength, and this was almost beyond my capacity. I did find that once the clips were attached to the wires, they were easy to remove with pliers, to correct the occasional mistake. The wire parts are easy to identify, and the assembly instructions are adequate. However, it would help if the drawings showed more clearly where the 42 clips should be positioned.

title: Smart design
text: The shape of this eraser fits more comfortably in the hand than a traditional blocky style of chalkboard or whiteboard eraser.  Much more comfortably,  and the ends of it can be used in crevices with ease,  so I can have better access into areas inside the edge of a frame.  With two different surfaces on one removable section,  I can use the one I need,  then reverse it when I need the other side.  There is also a section with a piece of blue microfiber fabric which we all are familiar with,  the kind we use for washing,  drying and polishing our cars,  homes, boats and pet's faces and paws. Keep the old ratty ones with holes or stains because they can be cut to the shape of this eraser and stuck to the textured area under the existing microfiber.  I expect the one included to eventually ravel away at the pointed ends because of their narrow form.  This is a very smart,  space saving little tool for home or work.

title: Beautiful Locked Diary
text: This is a very attractive locked diary. It features a padded cover made from vegan leather that is soft and pleasing to the touch. The diary is designed so that you can remove the pages and insert another B6 sized notebook when the diary is completed. The locking mechanism on the front is simple and easy to use. This diary comes in a beautiful box that makes it an excellent gift idea.

title: Great Christmas Cards!

title: Excellent buy. Really happy about these misprint pens. text: This is a great box of quality pens. No one at work cares what’s on a pen and it’s significantly cheaper than buying regular pens.

I am going to be buying this as long as it’s available.

High quality. I haven’t found one that doesn’t work yet. Way better than the BIC eco pen.

Also it’s great that these aren’t just going in the trash.

title: Excellent overall but with a few flaws. text: We get At A Glance planners every year. Good value for the price. This is the first time we have had a two person planner. We are computer driven, yet have stayed with this type of hard copy planner.

It is a large planner. It is an inch thick lying on a table. 3/4 inch compressed.
Too large for most handbags. Okay for a large tote, but heavy.
There is no planner page for Sunday. Four lines, no print.
Saturday is abbreviated, by ending at 6PM. Monday through Friday are 7 AM to 8 PM.
Therefore, if you a planner for Sunday, or outside 7 AM to 8 PM, there may be better alternatives.

This type of planner would be great for a busy two family household, or a small office.

With the layout of both users on the same page, the first user of the day can remind the second user that they have a scheduled event that day. Handy for a less organized second user.

The two user format would also be very useful to keep track of your school age childrens' activities.

The last page of the book shows calendars for 2018, 2019, 2020.

title: Five Stars

title: No bleed pens
text: Ok... NOT a fan of the moustache on the pens... but whatever.  They do work as a pen and do not bleed.  Not sure why they list them as "bible pens"... they are super lightweight - I wish they were more weighty.  They'll work but probably won't buy them again.

text: I needed something to help my neck and back.  I am on my laptop a lot at home and my neck down posture was causing a lot of neck pain.  This stand was perfect!  I can set it on my chair or sofa and it sits slightly below my head.  The table is very study and large!  This stand includes a drawer but it won't stay shut.  It is so nice I to have room for my mouse and phone.  I highly recommend this computer stand despite the drawer being malfunctional.

title: Excellent for Scrapbooks text: The "Ultra Duty" didn't seem much different then the "Heavy Duty" binder from Wilson.I have been scrapbooking for 40 years and the last 12 years have found using the Wilson 1 to 2 inch binders the best for my needs. The 3 outside pockets let me insert (or not) a 8x10 picture on the front and back, in the spine I usually put a book mark I have acquired at some bookstore in the past 12 months - lots of great memories. The two inside pockets are terrific, I am hoping they will change them to full page instead of the current third of the page they are.

I usually use white or blue and the color adds to the display. The ring is very sturdy and easy to open.

I can't say this is child tested tough. It doesn't feel sturdy enough to take a 5 day week beating for 9 months.

I’ve had AT&T phones for years so, I was expecting better, but the sound quality is tolerable. If things don’t improve I’ll return everything and make do with my old phones which were perfect.

The answering machine —to get it to just to take messages I had to turn off all call screening, and ‘smart call block’—which is okay because I only pick up when I recognize the caller anyway. The other features will be ignored for now; I just wanted something I could see!

title: Canon keeps getting better text: I have an older version of a Canon printer/scanner/copier, and while I was happy with that version, they've definitely upgraded with the MX922. I'll admit that this is for home use (so I don't mind the 250 sheet paper tray as much as other people, but yes, I can see where this would be annoying in an office environment), and it's pretty much perfect for that. It's a bit bigger than the previous printer, but this does have some newer features.

One of my pet peeves with a lot of electronic purchases these days are the lack of printed instructions, but the setup with this was rather easy thanks to the install program. Relatively speaking, it didn't take too long to get it up, running and connected to the wi-fi (don't plan on this taking ten minutes as you're not just connecting cables here). I love not having to get up and constantly flip down the paper tray, like I used to do all the time w/ my older Canon model. Prints look great, both color and black and white, and scans come through great.

title: LIFTING HANDLE ON THE SHREDDING HEAD IS A REAL PLUS
text: The best feature of this shredder is that it has a handle to lift off the shredding head so you can easily empty the bin.  I have always struggled removing the shredding heads and have nearly dropped one a few times.  The handle only requires one hand lets you get a good grip on it and makes it so easy.  Shredders are noisy in general, but this one is reasonably quiet.  It has the added feature of a slot for CD/DVD shredding and you can also shred plastic credit cards.  I didn't try shredding 12 sheets that it is supposed to handle.  I noticed that most shredders work a lot better if you don't try to use them at full capacity.  This does seem powerful enough to do 12 pages at once, if you want to do that.  Amazingly this comes with a complete 12 page manual, explaining the features of the shredder, maintenance, trouble shooting and warnings. There is also a separate one page troubleshooting guide.  These days manuals are a rarity, so I think that is a real plus.  Well designed machine.  So what's not to like?  Even though this is a crosscut shredder the pieces are a little bigger than with my prior shredder. It still does an adequate job of shredding, but would have liked to see smaller pieces.  Also, the waste bin is a little small and will require emptying more often than my previous shredder that has a much larger bin.  Overall, this is a great medium duty shredder and I like it a lot.
