title: Just the thing!
text: Mom and Dad (octogenarians) were using an old phone that would lose battery power fast, wasn't always completely put back on the charger, and was frequently difficult for the person on the other end of the call to understand them. They tend to resist any changes -  but we gave them these phones, and even set each receiver up for them in their house over Christmas. They have absolutely raved about what a difference the phones have made for them! They have extra phones now in rooms that never before had them - they aren't likely to use these often, but the extras mean the ringtone is playing from more places in the house and they are hearing it more often! My mom has Parkinson's but she's able to see the screen and use the buttons and dial successfully. They are thrilled with how easy the phones are for them to operate, and people who've called them have remarked that calls are so much more clear than before.

title: Must Use Gently
text: I had hoped that the Wooden Tape Dispenser for Washi Masking Tape would let me tear tape using only one hand. This is mostly true, but it does tend to slip off the spool holder very easily, so I really have to be mindful of the angle I'm using to grasp the tape and tear so it doesn't slip off the spool. The finish on the wood does no favors to help the tape grip onto the tearing plate. It often will just wrap back onto the roll. Washi is a low-tack tape, so if the wood was left unfinished, it would have a better surface to grip. I also got one splinter the first time I used it, so it could use a bit more sanding before being sent to customers. It comes with a fabric bag, I'm not sure why...... I like the idea and presentation of this tape holder, but there is certainly some room for improvements. I will use this tape holder until I find one that functions better for me. I like the drop-in spool style much better for one-hand tape dispersion. Thank you for reading my review. I hope you find my experience helpful to you, and you kindly will click the button below.

title: Solid Printer for a Small- to Medium-Sized Office text: There was a time when HP printers were the only real choice for anyone who really needed a reliable printer with accurate color reproduction and decent printing speeds. HP still makes some of the very best printers on the market, though others have gained a lot of ground on them and the choices are no longer cut and dry. HP's OfficeJet Pro X451 is a new high-speed inkjet printer that is designed to replace color laser printers. It is not an all-in-one device - it is just a printer - but what it does, it does very well.

Before I get too deep into this, there is something that merits mention - do not confuse the terms "wireless printer" and "WiFi printer". This printer is a wireless printer - it is not set up for WiFi connectivity and as such it requires a wired connection, either to an individual system, an Ethernet wall port or a direct connection to a switch or router. "Wireless" in this case means that the printer is accessible over a network and does not need to be directly connected to the system. This is the wrong printer to buy if you want it connected to a WiFi network and want to move it around without connecting to an Ethernet port somewhere.

Setup was easy but it took a long time. Once the printer was unpacked I followed the directions that came with it for installing the ink cartridges and loading paper. I turned it on and it prompted for a few set-up options and then launched into the longest calibration cycle I have ever seen - 8 separate stages of calibration and 8 sheets of paper later it was finally ready to use.

The printer comes with a CD for installing the drivers and printer management software needed for interfacing with this printer. I used a USB connection and found that the printer was not recognized before it finished calibration (which makes sense except that the printer pauses in between stages of calibration and then resumes, so it was not clear that it was done). To install, there are two options - download the latest and greatest drivers directly from HP or use what's on the CD that came with it. I downloaded the latest drivers and the process was relatively quick.

Once all set up, the printer was more than eager to please and I made some good observations. First, this is a really quiet printer. I have never had a printer that operates so quietly when printing. If you need a quiet printer that does not wake the whole office when it prints, this is a good printer.

Second, I found that the print quality is phenomenal. I printed a large and detailed picture on plain paper and the result was nothing short of great. The color balance is there and the details are clean and crisp. There's little about which to complain when looking for quality output but if you really want mind-blowing prints, put in photo paper and specify as much in the print preferences - the results on photos are spectacular, suitable for framing and mounting. I do not know yet how well the brightness and clarity will hold over time, though - many inkjet prints fade with time and I do not know how well HP's inks will maintain their integrity for finished prints.

Finally, this is a FAST printer. Inkjets as a whole have gotten faster without losing quality, and HP definitely has put some effort into squeezing speed from this printer. The advertised speed of this printer is approximately 35 ppm for black prints, and in draft mode that is probably pretty close. I did not send a large multi-page job to it for testing so I cannot really quantify the speed, but it definitely is faster than most other inkjets I have used in the past.

This is a very solid and sturdy printer. It was made to last for years under a reasonably heavy load and it should serve an office environment without too much trouble. I do wonder how long the ink will hold out once I get through the initial cartridges, though. I do not yet have a good measure for this yet.

The HP OfficeJet Pro X451 is a solid and well-designed inkjet that is intended for moderate office use. It is a solid printer that prints fast and generates very high-quality output, and it does this very quietly compared to most other printers. If you have a medium-sized office and you want the quality of a color laser but don't want the expense, this may very well be the printer to meet your needs.

title: Organize Your Business or Home Office text: No matter how advanced your use of technology may be, you still need to use paper from time to time. You also need a way to keep this paper organized and an organizational tool found in most any company is hanging folders. AmazonBasics Hanging File Folders, Letter Size, Standard Green are prefect for the job.

These folders are just like most hanging folders. They are letter size and are intended to hold standard 8.5 by 11- inch sheets. The green color reminds me of the hanging folders I first used when I entered the work force three decades ago. They make me feel a little nostalgic.

With 75 folders per package, you have what you need to organize lots of paper. You also have plastic tabs and small, rectangular pieces on which to write titles, for organizational purposes. You have all the tools you need to better organization, short of the file cabinet in which to hold them.

Technology keeps advancing but no matter how far it moves along, we still need to use paper from time to time. We still need ways to organize all those sheets and AmazonBasics Hanging File Folders are an excellent means to an end. You have everything you need and with 75 folders, you should be able to organize your entire business office or home with a single package.

title: PERFECT For Storing My Pastel Artwork And Putting These In A See Through File Folder Too text: I am learning how to work with pastels this year. The problem is that pastel work is hard to store and protect. I was looking for something that would help- then I found this!

WHAT I USE THEM FOR
I have pastel paper which is 9x12 in size. These sleeves are that size and the paper fits in them. I put a thin piece of paper on top of the artwork and then slide it into the plastic envelope/sleeve. Once I have all of my artwork in sleeves, then I put them all in a clear file folder and they are protected and together for when I want them again.

THE BOTTOM LINE
These are exactly what I wanted to store my pastel artwork in. They work great for me.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. The clear sheaths of plastic are so nice when it comes to storing pastel work. I can see what is inside (I use transparent paper over top) and I can store them in a clear file folder and have the protected and organized further.

title: Needs instructions. text: This is a good product, let's get that out of the way. It works well and does what it should. But it came without instructions and I've never installed one before so I was kind of lost. It took me a while to figure out how it works, and this whole experience could have been greatly improved with a simple printout that shows how to remove the spring from the base.
Basically, the spring twists out of the base and reveals a plate with a screw inside. Screw that plate into the wall, and then the spring screws back in similar to how keys go on a keychain (fish the edge of the spiral in and twist). Now that I know, it would be really easy to install another one. Maybe others already know this from experience, but personally I found it difficult for a newbie to figure out.

title: Very Good Mechanical Pencil text: I have for years preferred mechanical pencils to traditional wood pencils as mechanical pencils typically stay sharper and I can get finer lines with them. My instrument of choice is a Uni-Ball KuruToga which I have been using for almost 4 years now and even bought another for my wife. I was interested in trying this Zebra mechanical pencil and comparing it to my KuruToga. It compares well and is not particularly expensive.

This pencil has a nice hand feel to it and I can hold it and work with it without any more fatigue than when I use any other pencil. The barrel is ridged hard plastic so it is easy to grip, though I personally prefer a pencil that has a softer (rubberized) grip to make it even more comfortable.

The innovation with this pencil is the spring loaded barrel which is designed to absorb excess pressure and prevent the lead from breaking as easily. In use, it seems to work fairly well and I have had fewer breaks than with many other pencils I have used. When you bear down hard, you can actually see the spring in the tip of the pencil compress to absorb some of the pressure. I cannot say with certainty that this is the only reason that the leads break less – the leads themselves may be a contributor.

The main area for improvement with this pencil is the eraser, which is very small and is typical of a lot of the better mechanical pencils I have seen and used. If you plan to use this pencil a lot, plan to keep a larger eraser close by which is easier to use anyway.

The cost of this pencil is quite reasonable. As I write this it sells here for $7, which is not terribly expensive. While disposable mechanical pencils may cost less, they quality is usually not there and in the long run you end up paying a little more than you would for a good quality pencil in the first place.

My wife has confiscated this pencil from me and uses it now. She prefers it to the KuruToga, though I am still debating which I think is better. Regardless, this is a fine pencil and it will serve you well if you need a 0.5mm pencil that will not cost you a fortune.

The cards have the following (six) themes: Hooray for You, Bravo, Congrats, Yay You, Look Out World and Woo Hoo. The fronts of the cards nicely illustrated and colored black, white and gold foil. These are perfect for a lot of occasions – graduations (i.e., middle school, high school or college), retirement, promotions, or really any celebration. They are a great size and will only require the traditional stamp when mailing. Overall, I think for the price (under $15) you can’t beat it. I’d highly recommend them.

The price you pay for the pleasure of smooth writing is that now and then the ink will ball up on the pen tip and you have to "roll" it off onto some paper. I normally find some ink on my hands after using the new refills and the problem may be that I'm writing for so long and the pen has become warm. Even with this issue, the writing seems perfect and the ink is a soft sapphire, easy on the eyes and the pen writes like a dream. I'm writing out all my recipes with these refills and they look wonderful. Writing with a Cross pen always feels a little more luxurious and then pen has lasted for years.

~The Rebecca Review

title: Beautiful calendar that depicts mostly Smooth coated Doxies text: Dachshunds come in many colors, two (really three) sizes: Standards, Miniatures, and Tweenies (in between sizes) and three coat varieties: Smooth, Longhaired, and Wirehaired.

This makes for lots to love for anyone who loves Dachshunds. In the past the Daily Box Calendar captured that diversity of types of coats. So when I purchased not only one but two calendars one for home and one for my office it was in anticipation of seeing several Wirehaired Dachshunds like my little Miniature girl each month.

I was shocked when in trying to show someone at work the difference between the coats and I could only find ONE Wirehaired in the entire calendar! What?! And there were only several Longhaired Dachshund pictures out of over 300 pictures...Really?!!

The calendar consists of mostly Smooths. Which is fine if Dachshunds weren't so diverse. So if you're a Smoothie owner and Dachshund lover you will enjoy the entertaining photos very much. The pictures are beautiful and depict the antics of silly & serious Doxies.

I just wish there were more Wirehaired and Longhaired Dachshunds to enjoy with their Smooth brethren. It's like a owner of a Chocolate Lab purchasing a Daily Box Labrador Retriever calendar and finding mostly Black with only a couple Yellow Labs and the picture of ONE Chocolate Lab. They love all Labs but it's so great to see your variety represented too.

I plan to give my second Daily Calendar to one of the many Smooth Dachshund owners I see while I'm out with my little Wirehaired. Someone who loves Dachshunds as much as I do, who will love & enjoy a calendar that depicts their low long baby in all it's tail wagging happiness.Of course I am keeping one of the calendars because though I have a coat preference I am still a Dachshund Devotee. As my Dachshund ladened bookcase attests.

title: Flexible plastic cover looks good but does not provide support text: I am not a student but love paper, pens and ink. The [[ASIN:B007CGUHHG Five Star Composition Book, 100 College-Ruled Sheets, 9.75 x 7.5 Inch Sheet Size, Lime (72861)]] is a nice carrying size, fine plastic cover, sewn binding and black tape spine reinforcement. The paper is standard for five star with the blue lines and red line down the left margin. The rounded corners are cut well.

This book is fine for pencil, ballpoint, rollerball pens, however I would not recommend it for fountain pens because most will bleed through the paper to the reverse side. Some may actually bleed onto the page beneath. I use Rhodia pads when I want a high quality paper with perforated sheets and to my surprise, some can be purchased for the same price as this one. One thing to note is that the plastic cover on this is flexible, so care must be taken if you are writing in it without resting it on a flat surface for support.

title: Easy Assembly, Cheap Price, Not a Permanent Solution text: I received a 6 pack of boxes which are really 6 individual and deep file drawers. Each box is assembled with 3 separate pieces of cardboard with the instructions on the back of the file drawer. Also included is one metal square rod to reinforce each of the 6 file drawer casings. In addition, there are 12 plastic rails; 2 rails slip onto each file drawer for use in storing hanging files.

PROS:
- Easy assembly
- Boxes can be used for hanging files with supplied plastic rails
- Somewhat sturdy considering that they are just boxes
- Can be used for more than just files; for instance I would use these as cheaper and much sturdier versions of moving boxes whose only drawback would be that they might be somewhat awkward to carry but are very easy to open and close.

CONS:
- The 6-pack is actually 6 individual and separate file drawers
- The box says that the drawers can stack 5 high with the interlocking clips (which are not included and which I assume must be purchased separately)
- The file drawer part has a "Panel A" piece that says to detach for additional support but there are no instructions on how to use it. I guessed on how to install this piece but I can't be sure if I correctly used it to reinforce the handle located in the back of the file drawer.
- In order to reduce the shifting of the file boxes during use, I had to put it against a wall. Although it still shifted without the interlocking clips, it worked effectively enough as file storage.

In summary, I would only consider purchasing these boxes as temporary file storage or as very basic moving boxes that are cheaper (at the current price of $20.57 for 6) than regular moving boxes. Without the interlockinig clips, I would stack these boxes 5 high ONLY if set against a corner and back wall where they are supported on two sides by the walls and on the third side by some furniture.

I do not consider these boxes sturdy enough to use for permanent file storage where the files are frequently accessed. They are a good solution, however, for permanent file storage where files are accessed infrequently such as for old cases in a law firm or police, library, banking or other personal records.

title: Doesn't Work - UPDATES text: We received the round roller ones, same brand, as stocking stuffers a few years ago. They ran out of ink and we learned the company does not make replacement cartridges for that particular style as the ink is made for glossier types of paper and replacement ink cartridges would cost as much as a new unit. Because the brand was the same, we ordered this unit and a 3-pack of replacement ink cartridges. The ink cartridge that came with the original unit never "lined up" within the unit properly. We had our adult son look at it and he was unable to get unit to work smoothly. I'll have him take another look at it but I was quiet disappointed as I had such great experience with the brand in the past.
SELLER - GUARD YOUR ID: should you read this review, I'd be happy to try another unit and update my review as I have been very happy with your products.
UPDATE: Seller is very responsive! Within an hour or so of posting this review, Seller reached out and offered to ship a new one. I'll update further when it arrives and I have an opportunity to try it out.
UPDATE: we have received the new stamp sent to us by SELLER. This unit works very smoothly!! I'm very impressed with the SELLER'S lightening response to my initial review and the timely follow-up to make things right. Excellent customer service and we will definitely be purchasing from this seller for future needs.

title: Makes the item super portable with a nice handle
text: Ordered this to keep my new scansnap s1300i protected when not in use. Makes the item super portable with a nice handle. The bag has a pocket inside and outside where you can keep the cords associated with the scanner. My only complaint would be that it would be nice for the outside pocket to be a little bigger, you have to really squeeze the power cable in there. The neoprene seems pretty protective, but I wouldn't go dropping the item on a hard floor or anything purposely. I do think it would help protect it if it happened though, the foam seems thick enough to cushion the scanner.  I still think for the price it is a really good value for your money, especially when comparing the the much more expensive bag advertised with the scansnap from Fujitsu which is about twice the price, and it doesn't appear to be any larger than the COSMOS ® Black Color Neoprene Carrying Travel Case for Fujitsu ScanSnap S1300i Mobile Document Scanner.

title: Just what I needed! text: I've been using a P-touch for a number of years, and lost the instructions, so decided just to replace it, as I needed a way to label a bunch of crafts supplies.

After researching the options, I decided on this LW-300 model, and so far, it's performing BEAUTIFULLY! I've labeled a dozen jars of buttons, and about 50 file labels for my collection of craft paper pads (I make hand-crafted greeting cards). I'm still on the first set of batteries AND the original label cassette. No problems at all.

I'm really impressed with the variety of label designs, as well as the "special characters" that come standard with this. You get a cassette of 1/2" white tape/black ink, and I'm finding the print to be crisp and clear. I've done a few labels with just one line, but most are 2-line labels, and the print is clear and easy to read. Operation isn't difficult at all, once you "get" how to cycle through the options on the machine itself. The screen is not backlit, so you need to use this where there's enough light to read the screen.

I like that it doesn't waste a lot of tape, either. It seems to allow about 3/8" on either side of the printing. My old label maker left at least 1/2" on either side, so this is definitely an improvement.

My next investment might be a power cord, but honestly, if the batteries continue to last as long as these seem to be, I don't think I'll actually need it.

Very happy with this!

title: Stains everywhere. Beware! text: I purchased 3 of these cartridges last July. I use my printer but not all that much because these toner cartridges are truly crappy and just scatter and bleed ink everywhere on the paper. So, I only finally went through the first cartridge last week. Since I have two printers, I do have some choices, fortunately. I was really hoping to use this one more, but I can really only use this printer for printing out personal stuff. Like ebooks that I don't want to read off my screen, but prefer to print out to read in the living room or dining room or elsewhere. As far as that kind of printing goes, it's mostly legible. Just waaay not clean enough to use formally or professionally.

I waited until I was on my second cartridge before writing this review. I figured, maybe the first cartridge was just a lemon - that can happen... I did not try to exchange it at the time because I bought these before my original cartridge ran out, just to have backup ready. By the time that happened and I realized that the new cartridge was crap, it was really too late to raise the issue. I bought it from Blake Printing Supply at the time but, since I never tried to return them or even complain, I can't speak to their service or responsiveness in this situation.

The second cartridge I started on last week seems about 70% better than the first one. Still not clean enough for formal applications, but less frustrating for my personal printing needs.

So, if you're OK with having a cheap cartridge that makes your paper dirty, but still can print out your personal stuff relatively legibly, then go for it. If you want it for an office environment, or for printing out your new manuscript, stay far away from it.

title: Stapler text: Update: After using my first stapler for about a week, I tried stapling two sheets of paper together and the staple and stapler got stuck to the paper. I eventually got the paper out but it had 3-4 staples in it. I tried fixing the stapler by pulling it apart, but could not. The staple head was stuck to the bottom and I could not get it loose. I eventually had to just replace with another in the pack. I'm hoping this does not happen again because a week's worth per stapler doesn't really work. I adjusted my review from 4 to 3 stars.

This item is made with good quality is and is very sturdy. Inserting the staples was easy because you dont have to open the entire top like a traditional stapler. You press the orange button on the back and the compartment pops out. You put the staples on top of that and push it back in. You can press to staple too, rather than picking the entire thing up to do so. It is also strong and can push through a lot of paper.

title: Perfect For Transferring My Recipes Into text: I have a really nice recipe book. The problem is that it is falling apart. I wanted to find a good solid book to put my recipes into, and this is it.

COVERS
The covers of these books are tough. They are easy to spot on the shelf, but they are smooth, easy to wipe off, but unique so I can find them too.

PAGES
The pages inside are pretty thick. They have a date area at the top if you choose to use this as a journal, and lines which are more like college ruled than the super wide lines. Don't try to use Sharpies in them, but they will stand up to ink pretty well without bleed through as long as it does not soak the page.

BINDING
If you break the book in gradually a few pages at a time to loosen the binding, these books will lay flat on a table top. There is a thread sewn through the center of the pages in the book too.

RIBBON
There is a red ribbon in the book for page marking. For my recipe book, it is a perfect addition too as well as journals.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This set of two books is perfect for my recipes. The binding is nice, the covers tough, and the pages are thicker to help with spillage and re-use.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. These are just what I was wanting. They are thin enough not to take up too much room, but big enough to house most of my recipes.

title: Works Great for Me! text: I am very pleased with my order of the NetumScan Thermal Direct Perforated Shipping Labels. These arrived to me well-packaged and in great condition. I really like the fan-folded labels as they fit perfectly in my label feeder and print with good quality. I have not found the stack sticking together after using this for several months. Sometimes, failed prints are due to the quality of the labels, not the printer. That being said, it is very important to know how to use your printer to have good-quality prints. I find it's always worth my time to print sample labels when I re-load the machine or after it has been unused for several days. It's important to use good quality labels.

I will certainly re-order when my currently supply is depleted. They stick securely to poly-bags, cardboard, poster-board and over top of shipping tape. I am sending more packages to family and friends over the past several months as I do not see them in-person as often. This helps my doll collecting club still be able to do some of our crafting projects together, and share supply kits for the workshops we used to do at our in-person meetups. Shipping labels also are great for me as I can print directly from the site where I pay for postage. I can also prepay postage, print a label and send it family and friends to use on packages they send back to me. I use these with my at-home label printer to avoid spending time in lines at the Post Office. I've had no issues with these feeding well into my thermal printer, and find them to be a good value. title: Pencils are not as easily taken by a classmate

With bright and pretty colors and contrasting interior dyed wood, these look good enough to draw a rainbow, but the pencil leads are all the same gray and without color.  Once the kids get beyond their  initial surprise, these pencils are likely to become a favorite because chances are that they will not be lifted by a classmate.  The white eraser is attached without metal, a feature I personally like, and the eraser reminds me of the larger ones I regularly use.  I love these pencils, but because of the confusion they create, I have to deduct a star from the review.  I think this package would be a great gift for teachers who usually keep pencils on hand and wonder at the end of the day where they have gone.  They are also great for rewards.

title: Solid Performer For 35 mm Slides text: Okay, up front disclaimer. You are NOT going to get the same quality as a professional scanning service. YOu also fo not get the automatic slide feed everyone wants.

Out of the package, the unit worked well. I selected the correct holder for my slides, inserted my SD card (not included with unit!), set the film type (35 mm slide) and resolution, and started. While there is no autofeed, it is pretty easy to push the slides through manually. Positioning is helped by the LCD monitor, but I found it is not perfect. Expect some cut-off and some rounded corners with mounted slides.

I tried adjusting the brightness because many of my old slides were a bit overexposed. I found little benefit, so I went with the defaults and made adjustments in Photoshop instead. For reasonably well exposed slides, the defaults work well.

Picture quality was up and down. When I looked at some of the slides that appeared fuzzy or granular when I went to 100%m the originals appeared okay at 5X. On the other hand, I had several that were very sharp and well focused. I am still trying to decide if it is the Scanza or the slides.

Color saturation was a bit variable. Older, overexposed slides seemed to be lacking color and contrast even in good areas. Well-exposed slides were saturated with no obvious problems.

If you are interested in converting your slides to snapshots for on-screen slideshows and sharing, the Scanza is a good option. You can go through a few hundred slides in a day and get good results pretty easily. If you have many more, you should be considering a professional scanner. If you only have a few, I would try your scanner, if it has a suitable capability.

While branded Kodak, it is a Chinese product. It is meant for worldwide sales, so you can find instructions in virtually every major language.

title: nice planner, I like it text: I recently purchased the AIMPEAK Planner for 2023, and I am extremely pleased with my purchase. This planner has everything I need to stay organized in the new year. It has monthly tabs, an inner pocket, a pen loop, a PVC waterproof cover, notes pages, spiral binding, and 138 pages of white paper. It is also the perfect size at 7"x10".

I love that there are both weekly and monthly views to track my appointments and tasks. It is easy to use and the pages are thick enough so that my pens don't bleed through. I also like that it is waterproof so I can take it outdoors without worrying about it getting wet.

Overall, I think this is an excellent planner and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable organizational tool. It has all the features I need to stay on track and the price is unbeatable.

title: Nice Hand-Made Journal text: I have been a journaler for years though most of my writing is done on the computer. I have used paper journals, though, and I prefer leather-bound ones to cardboard-covered. I was interested in this journal and I am mostly pleased with it though there is some room for improvement.

The cover is pressed leather and is very pretty, and the outside of the cover looks pristine. Inside, the leather looks hand-cut and is uneven. It isn’t a problem but it shows that the journal is hand-crafted.

The paper is interesting to me. I have made paper by hand, and it has a very rough feel to it and is speckled with imperfections. The paper in this journal has the same qualities of hand-made paper. While it does make this journal feel more “rustic”, it does mean the paper is harder to write on. It’s workable but it does mean that more care and effort is required when writing. There are things that can be done to smooth the paper out a bit, and this doesn’t appear to have been done in the production process.

This is a nice little journal but unless you’re willing to accept its imperfections and prefer a more “commercial” journal it will disappoint. The paper is slightly rough, and the cover shows signs of hand craftmanship, both of which are not necessarily bad things unless you’re more interested in the actual writing process.

title: Decent printer, but can be difficult to set up.  Ink is too expensive.
text: Stylish and attractive with a somewhat small footprint and reasonably quiet operation.  It is not really fast printing, but adequate.  Printing starts right away, which was not the case with one printer that I own that takes forever to start printing.  Making a copy is very easy; just put your page face down on the glass and press the copy button.  Unfortunately, there is no sheet feeder for copying or scanning multiple pages, so it is a page at a time.  If you do a lot of page scanning or copying, you need a printer with a sheet feeder, but you will pay a lot more for that convenience.  There is no button on the printer panel to use to scan a document; you have to use software for that.  The driver for the printer, scanning software and manual must be downloaded from a website given in the instructions.  It makes some sense to me not to have the software included, as these things change over time and having it online ensures you get the latest version when you install but that does make a little more difficult for the novice.  Also until you download and check the user's guide, you really don't have a clue on how to scan.  The software installs a program simply called "scanning" on your Windows PC and you run that to scan.  One of the first things I did not like about this printer is that there are only two ink cartridges; one for black and one for color.  I have never liked that because if you run out of just one color, you have to replace the whole color cartridge.  The printer has an "ECO" button you can press that puts out less ink to help you save on ink when you don't need the very best quality, so that's something that can help save on ink.  The ink is a very pricey, so not sure this would be as economical as printers that have 4 or more ink cartridges  This only has color and black and the cartridges shipped with the printer did not last very long..  If you want to use this on USB, rather than wireless, a USB cable is not included, so if you don't have a spare around, you have to buy one.  After you download the software, you have to run it and apparently connect a USB cable initially, even if you are going to use it wireless.  You are given a choice in the install as to whether you want to go wireless or with USB.  On one computer I had trouble with either option; it kept telling me to attach a USB cable that was already attached.  I investigated and found out that the printer was showing up in Windows and I could use it with USB.  As far as wireless, there are two options; either with a WPS button or manual where you enter your router information.  On one computer, neither option worked, even after multiple attempts; I could not get wireless to work at all.  I tried connecting the printer to another computer and both the USB option and the manual setup for wireless worked perfectly on the first try.  I could not get the WPS option to work, even on the second computer.  Since the manual setup worked, I didn't need to.  (If you don't know, WPS is a button you press on your router and then you press a button on the printer within two minutes and it is supposed to connect automatically).  Was going to contact support about the wireless problem, but since I got it working with manual settings on one computer, I didn't call.  If you are not somewhat computer literate, this is not the best printer for you to try to set up; you might struggle with it for a while.  This printer also is supposed to be able to scan remotely with your smartphone with a free app that you can download from the app store, but I did not test that capability, as it seemed to me to be of limited value.

title: Not Worth It
text: This product has a neat idea, but a poor implementation.  First off, you have to scan a QR code to find out the website address where you download their app (they really couldn't be bothered to type it out).  Then you have to download the app and sideload it because they didn't want to publish through the app store.  If you haven't done this before, it involves turning off several security features in your phone.  Next, you have to turn off the "avoid bad wifi connections" feature if you have that turned on (in advanced wifi settings on an Android).  Then you can finally use the app.  After doing all of that (and against my better judgement) I tried this out and found out that it only prints one color at a time, and the ink cartridge they included was yellow.  A yellow which barely shows up on white paper, and looks like a stain from popcorn oil on my skin.  It doesn't show up at all on anything else.  So if they had included a better color I might have been able to tell you how the printouts look, but as it is I can only tell you about the myriad of other flaws and not about the one main thing that I would have liked to be able to tell you about.  I'm now left debating about whether I want to go to the expense of getting a better cartridge or just return this thing now before the poorly designed app is used to hack my phone.  I really wish I hadn't gotten this product.

title: nice if you don't want to grind your own text: I bought this nib for an Al-Star. I wish it and other italic nibs were options instead of only F and EF. This nib gives a hint of line variation that makes cursive much more satisfying. I haven't tried the 1.5 nib, which I imagine would give an even greater line variation but would require a larger script size. With the 1.1, I can write very similar size to a fine ball-point pen, but with much better looking script.

Upon examining this italic nib carefully, I was surprised to find the tip is beveled instead of square. This would seem to make it difficult to get fine hairlines. I decided to start with an "F" nib and grind an italic nib the way I thought it should be. With a very sharp right-angle on the tip, I get finer hairlines and much better line width variation without an excessively wide nib.

Although I polished the nib up to a 12000 grit stone and a strop, neither italic nib (Lamy's nor my own) are especially smooth. The trade-off of a nib that can make fine lines is that it must be sharp and more likely to cut or tear-out paper fibers. It can be polished further, but eventually, the sharp angle is polished off and the finest line width is widened.

Overall, I'm pleased with the italic nibs. I prefer my own to the one being reviewed here, but either is much more satisfying than a ball-end nib.

I didn't feel like going through the effort of exchanging it, so I kept the one I received. It fits a lot of stuff without being too bulky on the wall (hubby said nothing wooden - that looks too "granny"!) Note that it does not come with metal plaster anchors, just screws, so you may need to make a trip to your local hardware store for some additional supplies if you have plaster or drywall. Overall, pleased with the product compared to others available for purchase.

The paper is a little thicker, and the stacked rainbow colors add a decorative touch to your desk, table, or countertop. As message notes, they’re hard for the intended recipient to miss!

Assuming the product is competitively priced (you should always shop around a little on Amazon), these are a good choice for sticky notes. You get 24 pads of 70 sheets each, or 1,680 notes; plus some bonus plastic sticky flags for marking places in books and documents. title: Life saver if you need a lap desk. text: Had to buy and use a lap desk for about a week when I spent some “quality” time on the sofa due to back issues. This little desk is a great. The ski style feet slide easily, the non slip surface works nicely and the included stopper is helpful when the desk is tilted. The legs are independently height adjustable, and the tilt works well. I have used it a desk (set low with varying degrees of tit)and as a side table next to the sofa (legs set high, and flat). I dinged them one star for packaging, the box was a bit mangled and there was no padding inside. I can’t speak to its durability,I have only had it for a week, but it seemed to have survived its rough journey with out a scratch and is working perfectly. When I am done with it, it will fold nice and flat for easy storage.

This desk will support 40KG or 88 pounds according to the manual that is tucked in the little drawer.

title: Protect Your Security with AmazonBasics Cross Cut Shredder text: Every home and office needs a paper shredder. They are useful for destroying sensitive documents, credit cards, and other items that need to be protected from the hands/view of a potential thief. Amazon Basics has come up with a very good shredder with this unit and it’s a good choice for the home or workplace.

One of the greatest advantages with this shredder is its size. At nearly 23 inches tall, it can be reached with ease- much more easily than the short, low-to-the-ground shredders common in most homes. It also has a large, six gallon receptacle to hold the shredded paper and plastic. This means it can go a long time between emptying.

Another feature I like with this shredder is that it remains permanently on. That is, you don’t have to reach over and turn it on and off. You just leave it in the on position and it’s ready to shred the moment it senses a piece of paper, plastic, or CD. I also like that it’s on wheels because it glides with ease across my wood and tile floors. I can wheel it straight to the garage where a plastic bag awaits for the small bits of paper and plastic.

As for its ability to shred, it can hold a large number of sheets. The manufacturer claims 17 and I can believe it. The cutting is cross- cut so it is shredded well enough that one will be able to read the documents. It doesn’t shred things to oblivion like some other shredders, but it shreds well enough. No one will be able to read something or piece it back together after it has been run through this shredder and that is what matters most.

Shredders are essential for every house and office space and this Amazon Basics shredder is a very good one to consider. It rips up paper, credit cards, CD and DVD, leaving no chance for an identity thief to get your information. Its ability and price level make it a very good choice for your security needs.

title: great ink cartridges
text: These worked great for my HP photosmart 5520 printer. They were easy to install. I was able to open package and put them in without any issues. I then printed a few items. and they printed well. I print coupons so I don't have time for the print not to come out clear and readable. Even though these are not the name brand they still worked as well as the name brand ones do. I love the fact that I can see how much ink is in them and I don't have to guess if I am running low or if the ink is going to run out while I am printing coupons or one of my kids are having to print something up for school. They are cheaper than the name brand ones and they work just as well. My printer recognized them as being none HP but once I clicked ok then everything was good. It reads the ink level and everything with them just fine, no issues there either. I used to refill the original HP cartridges and I would have issues with the print quality afterward. I am hoping that I can refill these with no issues, but that will be awhile from now. Either way if I am able to refill them the good thing is I will be able to see the ink and won't overfill them.I like that they come with the chips that are needed. The chips are already installed onto them, so I don't have to try and get them off of my old cartridges or buy them separate. I have printed several coupons and other items so far and the print quality is good. My coupons scan without issue. As before with the old Hp cartridges after I refilled them the coupons wouldn't always scan which was a waste of paper and ink. So overall these are a good and cheap buy to the original HP cartridges

I still needed a little more storage for some DVDs, so I put this monitor stand on top of the cube as well. It looks really cute with the CD player on top and then the stray DVDs underneath. title: Large Lap Desk With Room for Most Any Activity text: I seriously underestimated how large this would be. Even though it was shipped in a huge box I thought they'd just gone overboard with the packaging again. No, this is a nice BIG lapdesk, and, at 5 foot 2 inches tall, it is almost too big for me. If I sit down at our sofa with it, it almost comes up to my collarbone with the legs at their shortest. So if you are a tall person, you have found the perfect lap desk! Everything works perfectly, it folds up compactly (alas, not enough to go under our sofa, but under taller furniture, like a bed, for sure), and the work surface is enormous! If you were an artist trying to draw a portrait from a photograph, you can easily prop up that photo and still have plenty of room to draw on a full-sized drawing pad. There are several different angles of tilt as well.

I'll admit I bought this because last time husband was in the hospital, we tried to do stuff like watch Amazon Prime on my laptop and it just wasn't possible with that big, awkward table they give you in the hospital. This would be perfect for sitting on the bed of someone who is bedridden or in the hospital for a long stay, so they could prop up a laptop, color for relaxation between the nurses running in and out, read, do a small craft like beading or drawing, etc. I have it; nevertheless I hope I don't have to use it for the activity it seems perfect for!

title: I don't see this one working very well text: Well, I am not sure how this is going to be 100% fireproof.

It is nice and thick, like an oily neoprene. It has a sturdy zipper as well. It looks to have enough room for most important papers.

However, I just don't see how this bag is anything but maybe fire retardant, not fireproof. There is a small opening at the end of the zipper. Fire wouldn't just stop because it should...it looks to me like it could pass right on into the bag at the zipper opening.

If you have super important papers, they should be in a safety deposit box at your bank, not in a cheapie bag at your home.

This is just my opinion on this bag. I am not going to set a fire to test it, so you'll have to draw your own conclusions as to whether you want to trust this bag or not. For me, it's a no.

title: Great Writer, Nib Is Good text: I am never confident buying a fountain pen on Amazon, you never know what you'll get. I did receive the Pilot Prera, fine just like I ordered. The pen is lightweight as expected, posts well no issues. I really have no complaints, it's a good writer. I had no scratchiness with this nib, cleaned it and it started right up. I believe it's legit, or it's a good writing fake if it is. Everything seems to be the real deal, so glad I purchased this here, some fountain pen stores are over charging for this pen.

The tip for those who don't know, whenever you get a new pen, use a little dish soap and water in the palm of your hand, roll the nib of the pen in the soapy water, rinse and dry well. Often manufacturers have oils left on nibs, so I always clean mine first. Then ink up, (always use a good quality ink, it absolutely makes a big difference, I like the Pilot Iroshizuku bottled inks), blot with soft rag until you get it going, and try it on different papers.
I had no issues with this pen but if you ever have a scratchy nib, try writing a bit with it first, good ink, different papers, sometimes it will become smoother and work itself out. If it still gives you issues, try doing some figure 8's on a brown paper bag, that might be all that's needed to help it. Too much on the nib and your fine turns into a permanent medium, so less is more.

title: EXCELLENT
text: This was as explained although a bit different than the Day Runner refills I've had in the past.  Basically the same though, just looks a bit different as it's Franklin Covey brand.  I actually think I like this one better.  It has a space for everything the Day Runner had, like work, Fax, Mobile, Home and Email, but that is in dark blue, so it breaks the monotony of ALL grey and I think it's a bit easier on the eyes.  At first, I rated four stars as I thought I would need extra pages, but then realized as I was comparing with my old Day Runner, that rather than doubling or even tripling up letters for one two-sided page, that these pages have a FULL two-sided page for each letter except wx and yz. title: Great in the Classroom! text: I work in a special needs middle school classroom. We have two autistic boys who love to color with colored pencils. I was keeping special colored pencils for them to use in a regular zipper pencil bag. Often they would end up taking all of the pencils out to look for that one special color that they needed. And when they did that, at least one pencil would roll off the desk. Now, they can unroll this pencil wrap and see all of the pencil color choices at once and no pencils are rolling away from them. Plus, both of the boys are particular about order and now the pencils are grouped by colors. One of the boys can't tie bows, so I end up having to tie the wrap back up, so a velcro closure would be nice, but this works fine. The wrap is well made and looks like it will withstand daily use.

*I purchased this at a discounted price in exchange for my honest & unbiased review. My thoughts & opinions are my own.

title: I Bet You Never Thought Of This Use (Bonus Funny Story) text: I like to have paper clips around the house. LOTS of them.

There is a family joke at our house about them. (skip if you are in a hurry)

One time when our son was little he had a fascination with caps that you could pound rocks on and they made a popping noise. I found them at a store (they were VERY hard to find) and with him with me, I diverted him using the cashiers as a tag team and quickly sneaked the package up to the register all paranoid that he would discover them, but he didn't. He was hard to surprise.

I wrapped them in a hurry too and could not wait until Christmas. I really built up the gift to him telling him he would be SO excited.

He saved it for last, opened it up and there was a whole collection of boxes of ..."gem clip paper clips"

He said in a monotone voice, "Oh wow. Gem clips. Yeah. I really am excited"

I grabbed the wrong package and in my hurry to hide them never realized it.

WHAT ARE THESE PAPER CLIPS LIKE?
These paperclips are just under 2 inches long. They are sturdy and strong, but most importantly, they are polished metal. That is important to me and let me tell you why. There are 10 boxes of these.

WHAT DO I USE THESE FOR ? (I BET YOU NEVER THOUGHT OF THIS ONE)
Not only do I use these for holding papers together and twisting into a number of ways, but in my fish aquariums ( I have many), I use these to hold seaweed down in the tanks which don't do well with suction cup seaweed holders.

I unbend the clip and make it into a triangle with the opening in the bottom. I slip the folded seaweed or cucumber slice or other vegetable onto the triangle, and then bury the bottom in the gravel (or other substrate). The piece that I slipped onto the triangle floats upward and stays where the shrimp and fish can peck at it. When I am done, I usually throw them away before the water can cause the finish to peel off at all. I might get two uses out of them.

THE BOTTOM LINE
In addition to the usual uses for paper clips, I also find these invaluable for my fish tanks to provide fresh snacks for my fish and shrimp. Because I use them only once or twice before they can corrode, I do go through them pretty quickly.

MY RATING
I give these five stars. They might not be Gem Clips, but they sure have a great finish on them and I can get two uses on them before I have to use a new one for my fish tanks.

title: Easy Set Up!
text: This was one of the easiest printers to set up. My last printer was a Cannon and I finally gave up on setting it up and had to wait for my husband to help me. This one was simple enough for my non-technical self to set up on my own. The touch screen panel works beautifully! My Cannon printer had a touch screen, but it was awkward. This one responds well to touch and has a clear, easy to read screen. The controls are more user friendly, too. I love that there are two trays and they have a large capacity. My Cannon didn't hold that much paper and I would have to go refill it because a note window would pop open on my computer telling me to add more paper. The WiFi connectivity works great. I love that I don't have to turn on my printer manually before it will print. This one wakes up and starts printing. Printed pages look nice. The color pictures on some recipes that I just printed out are a little fuzzy and not clear and sharp, but the print is amazing. I was a little disappointed to learn that there's no place to insert heavy paper. I just bought some 32 weight paper to print out pages for my planner. I will have to do that on another printer. Plus, my daughter tends to print on cardstock for school. It's not too noisy, but it's loud enough that I can hear that it's working when I'm in the other room. If it was too quiet, I would have to get up and make sure everything was working. So far, I am pleased with its performance.

title: Ink is also available in the lovely Mont Blanc bottle
text: Mont Blanc doesn't offer a huge selection of ink colors, so if you're determined to get a red MB ink, the [[ASIN:B008SBO7CK Montblanc Burgundy Red New Ink Cartridge 2010 Refill]] is your choice.  It's also available in the lovely Mont Blanc bottle, [[ASIN:B003M5T3XA Genuine Montblanc Bottled Ink Refill - Burgundy Red 105198]], which is a better value if your pen has a converter or you're comfortable performing the simple task of refilling your cartridge.  I was expecting the color to be as described, "For expression Burgundy Red blends rounded wine tones with flaming fire for intense passionate language."  In reality, when I compared this ink in my [[ASIN:B00C4180LO Mont Blanc Meisterstuck Mozart Platinum Line Mini Fountain Pen 107706]] and a [[ASIN:B00EVC948C Pilot MR Animal Collection Fountain Pen, Matte Gold with Lizard Accent, Medium Point, 91136]] containing [[ASIN:B0013D2XYY Private Reserve Black Cherry Ink Bottle 50 ML]], my impression was that the color is nearly as brown as the PR.  It is a little more red, but there's nto a huge difference between the two.  Nevertheless, the cartridges work as expected in Mont Blanc fountain pens.  I purchased mine in a pen store for a substantial savings over the current prices.

You could get a splinter if not careful.  As it is unfinished the frame is not stained as the description picture shows.  The plastic letters do not have tabs on the top and bottom of them, so when you stand the sign up the letters fall off.  Also, the slots are too wide apart so the letters do not fit in them securely.  There is a good variety of letters and punctuation marks.  The frame also does not have a standing leg on the back.  You must purchase a stand to set it up on a dresser or desk.  Overall, I was disappointed in the quality of this board.  Not one to purchase when there are others that are the same price and way better quality.

title: Canon Comes Through Again text: As much as technology has advanced, there are still some seemingly old- fashioned things we need and continue to use and one of them is printers. I still find that printing items, at least certain items, is preferable to viewing them on a screen and thus I still rely on ink printers to fulfill this need. And one printer up to the task is the Canon ImageClass.

I have owned many canon products in my day and I have found most them reliable and high quality. This printer continues my positive winning streak. Out of the box, it takes little time to set it up and once it gets going, it prints at a rapid pace, which makes it ideal for small businesses who need to print quickly. The paper tray holds up to 250 sheets, which is also a plus and more than other printers of this size.

This printer also functions as a scanner and copier. I have used the scanner function would good success, as the document came through clear and readable. I haven’t used the copy function yet, but there is no reason to suspect that it isn’t efficient and trouble- free. Most of what I print is word documents with words and no images. The printer seems to work fine for this task.

Canon ImageClass is reasonably compact in size, but if you need a printer to fit into a small space, this printer not work. Mine sits an open space on my desktop and it does fit, but there isn’t much remaining space on either side of it.

Canon ImageClass MF264dw is a quiet printer so don’t worry if you have dozens of sheets to print. You likely won’t even notice. It’s a good printer overall and one I’m glad to have in my home.

title: Great product text: Our grandkids love to draw, and we got them one of those whitboards that we put on the side of the refrigerator for them to use. It was nice, but it stuck on with double sided tape and kept falling off.
I saw these and thought they would be better than the whiteboard. As it turns out, they were amazing. You get 8 sheets that are 9X12 and they are fully magnetic so they stick to the fridge great. There are a bunch of them so the kids can draw all over the place and they are easy to take off.
All in all, for less than $10 these things cost just over a dollar each and are well worth it. Of course, if you have one of those fridges which is not magnetic, and I can't understand why those are even made, then these work work. We always had letters and numbers and tons of pictures on the refrigerator so these sheets fit right in.
They are definitely worth getting. You could use them for a lot of things and any place that is metal. The front of a filing cabinet, a tool box, even a little red wagon (if it's not plastic).

I liked the idea of the scratch off maps, but had no desire to put a full poster sized map on the wall much less find a place to store it. this one at 11x17 fits into one of my old art portfolios where it can lay flat and I know where it is.

I also like that it came with a couple of scratching tools. We had fun marking off the states we have visited and remembering hikes and museums and shared experiences. It also pointed out that we have no plans to go anywhere new. We are only returning to states we have seen so it should inspire a new get away.

The cons are that it still isn't something I would put on the wall. Also the scratch off stuff is a little obnoxious and we accidentally put a scratch in Kansas, but all in all, it is a fun memento.

title: Smooth Writing and Quick Drying text: Note: There are multiple products attached to this listing. I am specifically writing this review for the 12-count box of blue 0.7mm gel pens.

My wife does a lot of writing and she is very fussy about her pens. Her favorite pens have slowly been drying out as she uses them up, so she has been looking for new pens to replace what she has been using. I selected these, hoping they would work out for her. So far she has been happy with them.

Normally, my wife doesn't care for gel pens in particular but she agreed to try these. Her first observation is that these dry quickly and don't smear as much as others she has tried. That's a huge plus right there. None of the ones we have tried have skipped or globbed either which is good. We also have seen no issues with bleeding through the paper. Some of the other reviewers here have complained of dried out pens and inconsistent writing, but so far we have not seen those issues with the box I have received.

Based on our using these pens, I am happy to recommend these. They write smoothly and they smear less than other gel pens we have tried.

title: Wi-Fi Setup is Tricky, Control Panel a little difficult to get used to; otherwise a great printer
text: Unpacking and doing the basic printer set up and filling with ink was pretty easy.  The instruction sheet is clear and easy to understand and follow.  This printer is different than any other I have had in that it doesn't use ink cartridges, but instead uses ink tanks.  You fill each tank with the appropriate color of ink from a bottle (bottles are included to fill each color tank fully).  You can actually see the ink levels from a semi-clear window on each tank; you also can view levels from software.  Print quality seems decent with good colors.  I liked the fact that the printer is not overly large or heavy.  It has a reasonable footprint for the capability it has.  Now the negatives.  First of all, since there are tanks with ink in them, if you tip up the printer much when moving it, you could potentially spill ink out.  The tanks have covers, but not sure how secure they are; there is an obvious warning on the box not to tilt the printer after the tanks are filled.  If you wanted to ship the printer, you would have to find a way to drain the tanks.  The control panel on the printer is a little confusing until you get used to it.  I kept wanting to press the LCD display, but it is not touch screen.  You use buttons to the right of the screen to navigate.  To make a photo copy is a number of presses on the panel.  Even turning the printer off is a three step process.  Another brand of printer I have is easier to operate.  Another gripe that I have when setting up is that when you are unable to connect from your computer, if you have to end the program, you have to start all over from the beginning with a complete reinstall of software.  The only real negative to this printer is the Wi-Fi setup.  I could not get it to set up properly, until I used a USB cable.  At first I thought the problem was that my router was running at 5GHZ and not broadcasting a 2.5GHZ signal and actually ended up setting up a separate SSID for dedicated 2.5GHZ.  That did not work at all.  Finally by using the original SSID of my router, was able to connect my computer to the printer with WiFi, but ONLY by using a USB connection for the setup (USB cable is not included).  After you connect, you can remove the USB cable and then print with WiFi.  This printer only works on 2.5 GHZ and I think it is time that manufacturers start supporting 5 GHZ on their devices.  If you want to use this with WiFi, you better know a lot about your router.  Fortunately you can use the printer on a network (Ethernet cable), a USB connection or wireless.  Scanning is a little hard to figure out because you have to download and install a separate utility from the Epson website and it is not quite clear what it is that you download and install; fortunately I guessed correctly, as I got scanning to work from my computer; however, I could not get scanning to work from the printer panel.  A label on the top of the printer mentions FAX capability, but the outside box does not and apparently a different model does faxing.  As far as how long the ink lasts, I am not optimistic as the black ink has already gone down quite a bit and I have only printed about a half dozen pages.  I think once you get over the oddities of setup, this is a good printer.  A little weak on setup.  Nothing included to set it up; you have to download from the Epson website.  That's probably a good thing as you always have the most up-to-date software that way.

title: Great project folders - perfect for medical sorting and project organization. text: I used to use these in the office all the time. After a recent round of a lot of medical/doctor/hospital visits for my husband, I found myself wuickly being overwhelmed with the sheer quantity of the bills from the hospital, doctors, radiologists, labs, etc etc. They ALL bill separately for your part of the cost, and with Obamacare guidelines, there is no longer just one account for your name - every procedure has a new account number. I bought these to try to keep the bills, estimation of benefits, doctor bills, etc under control. Turned out that I needed HALF of this box just to have one folder per account set up by these various entities! Good grief. 13 different accounts for the treatment of the same medical problem! Yikes...

These have been invaluable to keeping up with the accounts without losing my sanity. I am also going to recommend them for my daughter to keep her projects separate for her college courses. Don't know why I didn't think about them sooner... I tend to associate these with office use only, but they are great for home and school as well. Love them!

title: Not heavyweight, but perfectly fine budget cards
text: These are quite pale, more off-white than cream. The cards are shipped flat but with a crease, so they are fairly easy to fold and burnish so they stay folded. The surface is quite smooth, more like a manila envelope than cardstock--the paper has no real tooth. They certainly are not a heavy weight of paper (again, not cardstock weight), but they seem fine for simple day-to-day use. I will look for something a little heavier for more special occasion cards.

title: Perfect starter kit for learning calligraphy. text: This Kuretake A to ZIG Calligraphy Starter Set comes with everything you need to start learning calligraphy. I am left-handed and I tend to struggle with calligraphy. This set took me a little time but my letters did begin to look pretty good. I think with more practice I will be a lot better.

The set comes with two books. A workbook, which I found very helpful, and a book with the alphabet and greeting card examples. There are 3 double-sided markers and a blender. I didn't realize the smaller end was just a smaller version of the large size. There are also cards and envelopes included.

I will be recommending this Kuretake A to ZIG Calligraphy Starter Set to family and friends.

title: Frozen ink slots, menu loops incessantly with one error message. Unusable text: I have a Bluetooth HP printer that works like a charm after two years, but it doesn't scan. I thought I would use this one as an upgrade of sorts, despite having had trouble with two previous Canon Pixma printers in the past.

Unfortunately, this printer is a failure for me. Just as persnickety and error prone as the other two I had trouble with before. I had it out of the box in five minutes and the packing materials removed and plugged it in. It immediately flashed an error code saying the paper cartridge was not installed properly. I followed the directions and for fifteen minutes the screen looped from the error code to the menu and back to the error code. Meanwhile, the ink slots are frozen and the belt won't move to allow me to even try to install the ink containers. It's simply unusable at this point.

The frozen ink holder problem is the same one I had with my first Pixma a few years ago - at least that printer waited a few months to act up. This will be the last Canon printer for me, I'll stick to the little HP printer.

title: Pencil Sharpener
text: I’ve been trying to figure out why this pencil sharpener is so expensive. It does seem so significantly superior to all other electric pencil sharpeners. Does it work? Well, yes it does. Is it somehow magically so much better? Not that I can tell. It still has the problems of a mechanical pencil sharpener. The pencil sharpening mechanism is deeper, meaning shorter pencils become trash. It does have an automatic stop, but that never works with colored pencils. It does have a large shavings area, so you have to empty it less often. The sharpening hole isn’t big enough to accommodate more than a standard sized pencil. The point on the pencil isn’t better than other sharpeners. I still have issues with lead breaking with this one. It is as loud as electric pencil sharpeners usually are. It works. It is fine. I just can’t figure out why it would be any better than cheaper versions.

title: I Am SO HAPPY With This Thing! text: My living room has been in a state of flux for a while now. Something happened where it required a remodel and we are not quite done with it. The problem has been remotes. They are all over the place and I am tired of wasting time search for them. Then I saw this..

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This storage caddy is a lot smaller than I expected. That is a good thing. It is 5"x6" and about 5 1/2 inches high at the back. It has a little glass window in the front which is not easy to break,thankfully due to being recessed.

There are three sections, one of which has a removable divider in it. There is a rubberized bottom on it to keep it from sliding all over when you put things in or take them out.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
I am so HAPPY! Every single remote fits in this caddy, there is plenty of room for it on the small end table, and my remotes are all ready to be used and seen easily from across the room. The black color means that dirt won't show up over time too. I have five remotes in them including a BOSE which is HUGE, DISH, and then TV, DVD, Roku, and even a place for my glasses if I want to stick them in there while I am doing close work.

The compartments are the perfect height and everything looks great in there. I could not be happier.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This caddy is handy to have. It fits on a very small table top, does not slide around and fits even large remotes without struggle. I LOVE how it organizes and my family is VERY happy with this- especially me.

MY RATING
FIVE STARTS. I would give it 10 if I could This has made me VERY happy.

title: Plan Your School Year text: Electronic planners are commonplace now that we live in the information age. But there is still something to be said for a traditional planner; one that is physical with pages for writing appointments, tasks, deadlines, etc. For teachers, these traditional planners are valuable for organizing and a good one to own and use is the Teacher Planner 2020-2021.

With this planner, you get an organizational tool that covers a full 12 month span, but rather than a calendar year, it covers 12 months that are more in line with the school year: July 2020 through June 2021. Each month has a two- page spread with the days of the month presented in squares, with five lines on each for writing things down. In addition, since this is intended for teachers, there is also a weekly calendar that covers Monday through Friday, with a larger amount of space to write down more detailed descriptions of tasks. Flip through the pages a little more and you will find a 12- month calendar for 2020 and 2021, plus a list of holidays.

This planner is quite useful for teachers. My wife happens to be one, so I knew she would like this planner and find it helpful. She likes that each week of the school year has its own, two- page spread where she can write down appointments and organize due dates. This is cool, and since this does cover a school year, it can also be utilized by students.

Possibly the best feature of this planner is the fact that it is spiral bound. Too many planners I come across are constructed more like an actual book. And that means you can’t turn to a set of pages and have the planner lie open, with pages in easy view. These planners tend to want to close shut, just a like a book. But this planner is spiral bound and remains open to wherever you turn.

I use electronic calendars, but I still like traditional planners. They are great for taking with you wherever you go and it’s nice to write things down using a pen or pencil rather than typing things on a keyboard. It’s a handy, practical planner for teachers and students and it earns an easy recommendation.

title: Great for personal thoughts and ideas! text: A solid set of notebooks made with a nice exterior cover. Although not genuine leather- I prefer the synthetic as it doesn’t “break in/down” so it seems to keep shape and integrity better. Plus, any smudge or spill can easily be wiped clean without issue. So light weight it easily slips into purse, backpack or briefcase- and flat structure allows for easy stacking.

Lines on paper appear light.. a guide for those using journal style (ha! these keep you from writing up hill!) they also help to create metric measuring if needed- In fact, I’ve made a few loose sketches in the book and these don’t interfere with doing so! paper quality exceeds expectations- using pen or pencil Ive has no issue with tear, bleed, smudging- A smooth finish

As with any composition style notebook- they are a challenge to open flat and not interfere with what you were doing.. this notebook has tried to combat this issue by using flexible stitching in the seam.. it’s not perfect! But, far easier to work with then some of alternative glued spines.. I think those who prefer to use this type of journal know it’s a trade off; ease and convenience to keep/carry and the known struggles with the binding!

These make a great gift or personal purchase. At a higher price point of $19 you were paying for quality and these journals have integrity. Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe!

title: Expensive & complicated, but looks great and they resist wear and tear pretty well. text: I got these to go with the Smead Life Planner System with the hanging file folders & big box. [[ASIN:B01D02X1Z0 Smead Life Documents Organizer Kit (92010)]] The quick fold tabs are new to me and I really like how they work. Essentially they fold in half and sort of stand up, creating a stiff "tent" above the folder that is easily visible and stiff. You attach the plastic tab in the little slots on the folder and it stands up without anything else needed.

This is kit comes with 45 of the plastic quick fold tabs and the sticker type sheets you print your own headings/labels on. You color code them for each section you're making. This is an expensive set up actually and it's more complicated than simply doing it by hand to be honest, thus the one star deduction. But...once it's finished and installed, the box looks great and the various files are easy to locate and keep organized.

title: Excellent--Yet Needs Improvements by Adding Additional, and Taller, Stoppers, and Moving Legs Inward text: Delivered in one day. Appears to be exactly as advertised. So far feels comfortable to use. I'm enjoying the tremendous amount of "real estate" available. That is a huge advantage over other portable lap desks and trays.

Since I've been using it only a few hours, I'm not star-rating this laptop bed tray desk's comfort or sturdiness.

In my opinion this product needs an obvious improvement, namely the additions of additional, and taller stoppers.

Why taller? (Note, multiple stopper could come in various heights.) To accommodate products such as the AmazonBasics ventilated adjustable laptop computer holder desk stand, the Road Tools Traveler CoolPad®, and Steklo laptop stand adjustable aluminum computer riser, all of which allow for ventilation and reduced heat build up.

Why more than one stopper? Because I doubt that a single stopper of the current size is sufficiently strong to withstand over time the weight of a laptop when the table is tilted. And, to allow for varying positions of stoppers to accommodate multiple devices, such as a laptop and a smart phone and/or a tablet such as an iPad.

Also, for someone using this in bed or sitting normally on a couch, the leg spacing is fine. But, when one stretches out lengthwise on a couch, the tray's legs are so far apart that the leg nearest the front of the couch actually extends out beyond the couch's front edge. Each of the tray's legs could be positioned further inward by over an inch (2.54 cm) without any risk that the tray would tip over. Moving the legs inward would increase the places that the tray could be used.

Even without those improvements, my star-rating thus far remains at 5 stars.

title: Nice printer text: I did something I normally wouldn't do before writing this review. I checked out the reviews for the Epson XP 850, the previous model. What I found were a ton of angry, frustrated reviews about this printer.

The problems were, in no particular order;

Ink splattering

cartridge failure

poor print quality

ink cartridges used up over just one or two prints and switching to black and white from color didn't change that problem

paper jams

Trouble cleaning the heads

Poor customer service

To sum up, if I was in the market for a printer, scanner, the XP 850 would never make the list of possible buys.

I am only going to address the printing capabilities of this Epson. I haven't used the fax machine or the scanner. In fact, now that I think about it, I haven't sent a fax in years. Anyways, clearly Epson had a faulty line on their hands and I'm thinking that this model, the 860, is the correction to all the faults.

First off print quality - I used plain old 8 1/2 x 11 to print out a picture from my son's birthday party. The picture was a bit grainy, like a newspaper color photo. So I determined to buy real photo quality paper to try the photo again. The picture quality went up a lot. I can't say it was professional quality, the lighting was poor, the group was big so the photographer took the photo at a distance. But having higher quality paper did make a difference.

Ink Splattering - I noticed no splatters in all of the 40 pages I printed, not on the color photos and not on the black and white documents I printed.

Cleaning - I've not had to do this yet, so I don't know, it looks fairly simple and the areas were easily accessed, so I don't expect any difficulties.

Paper jams - none so far.

Poor customer service - Also, not something I've experienced. The printer is working perfectly so there's been no need to call Epson.

For me this printer is a fun convenient way to print photos and household documents. The printing is a bit slow, so if you are someone with a home office and you print a lot, there are better printers out there and definitely less expensive ink cartridges.

title: Fantastic-Durable and Reliable text: I sell nail polish online and use bubble mailers on a regular basis. I only use mailers I trust to hold up during the shipping process. When it was time to order 6" x 10" mailers, my regular brand wasn't available so I ordered these. 25 -6" x 10" mailers come in a pack. As you can see, they have a cute pineapple design. They're very durable and provide ample protection . The adhesive strip holds beautifully-once the mailer is sealed its not coming open until a knife or scissors is used to cut it open. Its both waterproof and tear-proof. I have no issues affixing shipping labels, 'fragile' and 'thank you' stickers to the mailers. All stay in place and do not peel off. There's a feature that I especially like that I don't recall seeing on the other bubble mailer brands I use-the inner lining of the mailer is a gray film which prevents anyone from seeing the contents of the mailer. I really appreciate that feature!

These are awesome bubble mailers. Right before i sat down to write this review, I ordered another pack. The price is very reasonable and I will continue to purchase/use. Recommended for shipping/storage needs.
