title: High quality mobile whiteboard, please read my review if you are new to mobile boards like me... text: I've never owned a mobile white-board before, so some of my assumptions were different than reality. Here are two wrong assumptions I made, which I did not dock any stars for, since one should never assume. LOL!

1. The flipping action is simply to get to the other side of the board. It cannot remain horizontal like a table. There is no locking mechanism to keep it in table form. For some reason, I had assumed you could do that. Gather around with your generals to look at the map. LOL! You can't do that.

2. When they say adjustable... I assumed some sort of rail system where you slide the board up and down, and lock it in place anywhere from 59 to 70 inches. In reality, you can only choose between 2 height locations... 59 inch or 69 inch. Their stock photos say 70 inch, but their manual says 69 inch. Anyway, whenever you want to change from one height to the other, you need to remove 4 screws with an allen key they provide, or use your own screwdriver with an allen bit. Then reinstall the screws at the new height.

Despite my incorrect assumptions, I really like this mobile whiteboard. The bars and poles are made of some sort of metal and feels very sturdy and high quality. The caster wheels are plastic, but for something light like this, it is good enough. The caster wheels can lock too. The board has nice smooth corners molded by ABS plastic, and the fact that it's magnetic was a pleasant surprised. There are some accessories that the manual did not even talk about, but after playing with it for a bit, I realize they are clips/clamps to clip things to the board. I also found these little rubber feet that the manual doesn't discuss. I realized they are for you to cover the screw holes of the height location you do not use. View my pictures to see what I'm talking about. This item is 5-stars!

title: Stars are for the idea - expect it to JAM! ALOT! text: Ordered this for a big presentation I had, it was a waste of money. We have a printer that meets the specifications outlined, the only one being that it be used with a printer that prints 11"x17". We have a Konica (bizbub c452) which is capable of printing on card stock.

I tried using this in the tray with varying stock setting and in the by-pass try. 1 or 2 came out good and then jam. I'd modify and repeat, same results. Finally moved it over to a desktop printer, same results. Finally gave up after wasting about an hour on this.

Maybe the results will be different on an inkjet...

This idea is fabulous, a pretty inexpensive way to customize all sorts of presentations and there is a CD included (no install required) that very easily allows you to format, but not at the expense of the time required, or for that matter the amount of product you end up wasting.

Now I just want a refund.

I did a ton of research on what printer to buy because I needed to be able to print double sided black-and-white pages and scan in documents for online coursework. This is the result of my search and I couldn't be happier. It is also very cheap per page when you account for the price of the unit and the price for its toner compared to other printers. Do yourself a favor and whatever you do, don't buy an inkjet.

title: 4.5 Stars Great Fine Point Marker, but Difficult Cap to Remove text: These are definitely a Fine Point markers, but they bleed through. Unfortunately my puppy got ahold of one of markers so I am down to 11 of a 12 pack. As long as I only plan to use the front page of a paper this marker is okay. But if I need to use the back page I'm out of luck. I'm using it now on the back of my Papermate Flair review & it is bleeding through and obscuring some of the things I've written.

I like the Sharpie Ultra Fine Point Permanent Marker, but it is impractical especially in filling out a form, or any other action that requires it not to bleed through to the back of the page. Also something very Annoying is how Difficult it is to take the Cap off each of these markers and even to press the cap down so that it is completely closed. This is important if you have arthritis or nerve damage in your hand.

If you are a Sharpie person you'll really like it - just be aware of the cap removal difficulty & bleeding through. I won't be buying them again after I use the pack of 12. But if I ever get to a point where I only need to use the front page of a notebook then I'd certainly consider these markers.

title: Big, Impressive Card Needs Extra First-Class Postage text: This BIRTHDAY WISHES BIRTHDAY CARD WITH FOIL is a generic card that's suitable for anyone's birthday. Maybe it's slightly better for women, because of the two "diamonds" that are glued onto the stylized flower design, near the top. The flower design itself, done in copper foil, is raised from the card surface. The copper foil contrasts nicely with the silver background.

This is a big, impressive card that you might want to keep on hand for an unexpected birthday. It comes with a plain white envelope, and is "printed on sustainably sourced paper". At 1.3 ounces, this card will take two stamps for mailing; however, the envelope (6-1/8" high by 9-1/4" wide) falls within the size limits for machine-sorted mail (and thus doesn't qualify for an "oversized mail" surcharge).

Because this card is heavy enough to require extra postage for mailing, I rate it at 4 stars ("I like it" on the official Amazon scale).

title: Motivational Sayings Can Make a Difference text: Children can benefit from receiving reminders when they do well and from receiving encouraging words when they have doubts. In a classroom setting, one easy way to achieve this is with posters and a possible choice for encouragement is this Growth Mindset Posters Bulletin Board Set from Tenare.

This set contains small, individual sayings intended to motivate kids. They are made from carboard and can be placed on walls, chalkboards, or any place else where kids can view them and, hopefully, be encouraged by what they read. There are two pieces shaped like halves of a human brain, a rectangular piece, plus individual words and short sayings, separated into two subgroups: Fixed and Growth. The Fixed have to do with fixed mindsets; the growth have to do with ways to change or improve.

One issue I have with this set is that some of the statements are negative. I understand that the whole idea is to get kids to realize that these negative thoughts can be changed through growth. But if you’re working with kids who are under performing, they may already be thinking those things and certainly don’t need to hear it or see it permanently displayed on a wall. If they’re not thinking these negative thoughts, then I think it is best not to plant the seed.

So, to make the set best, I recommend using only the positive ones. The colors on both definitely brighten up the room and if you stick with the positive statements of encouragement, the desired outcome will be achieved. Yes, these are just sayings but sometimes, this is all you need to get children to do better.

Statements of encouragement can motivate children and this Growth Mindset Posters Bulletin Board Set is generally good overall. I don’t like the negative sayings, but the positive ones are nice and they do look good on the classroom walls.

title: Mediocre Laser Printer from Canon. text: The imageCLASS MF8280cw printer is definitely not your average home printer. Unfortunately because the cassette holding only 150 sheets of paper it's not really much of a business printer either.

Make sure you have a friend around to help you move and set up this printer. You're also going to need a sturdy place to put it. At almost 60 pounds and measuring 17" x 19" it's quite a beast and will take up quite a bit of table/desk top real estate.

Print speed, advertized at 14 ppm, is good but not all that fast. Print quality of text is, as are most laser printers, exceptional. Print quality of images on the other hand is poor. I've tried numerous color profiles and settings on board the printer but I haven't been able to achieve color matching that I would even call fair let alone good. Even printing simple pie charts with specific colors (red, green, blue, etc.) set by their decimal numbers the color output was off. Blues are too dark. Yellows are orangeish. Grey areas are blue tinted. I spent an hour or so and used up close to 50 prints trying to get good color output but the best I could get out of the printer was mediocre.

Scan speed is amazingly fast but scan quality of images is only good. Text scanning quality is very good. The highest resolution setting for scanning is 600 DPI which isn't that impressive. It's good for documents and not much else. The biggest annoyance with scanning was every time I wanted to scan something I would have to stop what I was doing, wake the printer up from standby mode, switch to the scan mode and then change the device setting to 'remote scanner' even though the printer is connected to my PC via a USB cable. I found this to be annoying.

Copying is quite fast and accurate. I scanned several invoices and documents and all were square and true with good quality.

I only used the fax feature once but it worked quite well and reasonably quickly.

The ADF tray hold 50 sheets and does a good job of feeding paper. You don't have to sit there and nudge items to get the rollers to grab them.

Wireless setup seems easy and painless although neither of my tablets will see the printer and my PC lacks a wireless card. The printer pulls an IP address from my wireless router but that's as far as I was able to get with testing the wireless capability.

In conclusion... this printer is too large for most home offices and the limited paper capacity makes it cumbersome for all but the smallest of businesses. Currently a replacement set of four toner cartridges for this printer will cost you well over three hundred dollars and with an average of only 1,450 pages per set of cartridges this is rather expensive to run. There are better options out there.

title: Really cool
text: [[VIDEOID:555101fff271d9c66c1f29ad92445017]] I remember using similar colored pencils as a kid, but this is a serious upgrade.  Instead of the buttery crayon feeling that some colored pencils can have, these feel more like a regular pencil.  This is a big deal for me because I wanted to use them for writing more so than coloring or drawing.  I have problems with my short term memory so I am constantly making lists and leaving myself notes.  I thought these would be a fun way to make them more colorful and interesting.  It turns the mundane act of making a grocery list into a Lisa Frank journal activity.  The pencils are easy to sharpen and hold a nice, fine point.  The colors change automatically as you write so each word turns out a little different.  It's a really cool effect.

title: Great Beginners Watercolor Paint Set text: Young artists will like the Mead Academie Watercolor Paint Set. A better than basic set with 12 assorted colors and a small brush, this paint set is ready to go out of the box. Just grab a cup of water and some paper, and you’re ready to go.

This paint set looks pretty simple and in many ways, it is simple. But I find it better than others of its type for a couple of key reasons. The most important is the brush. Paint sets like this often come with a brush so this is nothing unusual but with other, similar paint sets the brush is often very cheap in quality and doesn’t paint well or last long. The brush here is much better. I also like the assortment of colors because they include shades you don’t see in other sets.

The tray, with its assortment of colors, hinged lid, and included brush, reminds me of the paint sets we used as kids. The three sections on the lid can be used to mix colors and the paint is non- toxic and safe. Its small size makes it easily portable and there is enough paint to last many months with normal use. Sure, there are fancier, more deluxe paint sets out there but for the money, this set is going to be difficult to match. It has everything for the young artist in your home with few if any flaws.

title: Impressive looking. For signing documents. Not as utilitarian as less expensive gel pens. text: Looks very attractive. Impressive looking for signing documents.

However:

1. The instructions are microscopic in size. You can guess what It's saying, or use a magnifier to read the instructions. I have outstanding vision, 20/10, and the print was ridiculously tiny, even for me. Inexcusable for a pen of this price. Total disregard for the consumer.

2. This pen is best for larger hands. My wife is petite, with small hands, and found it unbalanced. It threw off her penmanship.

3. The nib is described as fine point. To me it is a medium point, best suited for signing documents. The fine point gel pens have a much finer line than this fountain pen nib. Would not use this as my everyday pen.

title: Helps me keep track of meals to make, & groceries to buy. Mon-Sun, w/ note section text: I prefer my calendars to be listed Sunday through Saturday, but I got this for a specific purpose where the weekend being listed last works greatly in my favor. I keep this on the fridge as part of a food prep organizer and tracker. I jot down what we will be having, and I also jot down foods that need to be used up. Since the weekends tend to be the spot with most variability, I like seeing those days put together. It is why I chose this particular calendar. It is shown in the product pictures, so it shouldn't be a surprise. It magnetizes to my fridge just fine.
I also like the included markers and eraser, which are also magnetized. If you are doing something similar to me, I would like to add that it is helpful to have a magnetic pad of paper or a blank wipe off board next to it for jotting down extra notes, or keeping a list. However, this includes a column labeled "notes" at the end of the week for that. Keeping track of foods to buy, prepare, and what needs to be used up helps a lot in figuring out how best to utilize the budget and to make sure nothing goes bad by forgetting about it. This $12.99 "investment" greatly helps me to save more money in long run by being organized and aware.

Wipes off easily. I tried this with the included markers and some other dry erase markers I have, and it all cleans off with ease. All around good product, glad I chose it.

title: DON'T BUY THIS!!! Drinks ink like a man stuck in a desert!!!! text: I have to be honest, this is my first Epson product. It had all the features I wanted and I liked the speed and compactness of it all. The specs, on paper, was great!!!
Now here is my main problem with this printer: It drinks ink like a drunk at Mardi Gras!!!
I work from home and do NOT use this printer as my primary printer. In fact, I print very little on this printer, but I've spent so much to replace cartridges on this printer that I have to say that it is more worth it to me to sell this at a loss and get a new HP. The cost just is NOT worth it. I do NOT believe in buying those ink replacement things.. After the warranty is up, however, I may have to try this.

I've only owned it for 8 months and I've replace 3 black cartridges and am replacing color when I barely do color printing. If ONE cartridge is out, it won't let you just print black like my old HP. I think after this I will be going back to HP. My old one was a workhorse and lasted YEARS!! This printer is truly just a way for Epson to make money on ink!!!

title: Cute and sturdy. text: Fun little item. The board and accessories come nicely arranged in a cellophane package with a ribbon closure so it’s suitable for gifting with minimal additional effort. I forgot to take a photo before I opened it but it looks more like it came from Etsy. I’m actually going to order a few more for coworker gifts.

I do wish there were more frame and color options but I went with the traditional looking black/oak framed style. I’d love to order it in a metal frame and larger size, like a true vintage board. The felt is soft and I didn’t have the issues that others mentioned where the lines were crooked. Mine is very straight and the felt is tight and symmetrical.

The plastic letters are not a great quality, the only flaw with this, and they were hard to snap out so I ended up trying both an Exacto knife and scissors to cut them loose. That whole process is a bit tedious but I discovered that cutting was a lot faster than snapping, which left behind a little stump that then had to be removed so you’re doing twice as much work. Plus, the snapping is rough on your hands because the stumps left behind have sharp edges. Just cut them with a knife or box cutter so you can do it in one step. I’d pay more for letters that are already loose and, even better, organized alphabetically. Digging through the bag of letters, numbers, and symbols isn’t super convenient and the punctuation pieces are so tiny they just disappear into the bottom.

Overall, a nice item with a quality feel. I’m happy to have it and guests get a kick out of it. I look forward to putting pithy statements on this for years to come.

title: Works to Re-Attach Air Fresheners to Garbage Cans text: This SAUNDERS UHU TAC HOME DECO REUSABLE PUTTY (2.1 oz (60g), 32 pads (48710)) is useful to have on hand for attaching lightweight items to all sorts of surfaces. It’s definitely reusable, and it comes off smooth surfaces without leaving marks. (I’d recommend testing it in an unobtrusive area before using it on a painted wall, but would expect it to come off without pulling off a layer of paint.)

My favorite use is for re-attaching [[ASIN:B00AN5L8FS Air Wick Stick-Ups]] to the inside of my garbage can. I have to remove the Stick-Ups when I roll the can to the curb for pickup, or they’ll fall out with the trash when the can is emptied. This reusable putty makes it easy to pull them off and stick them back on.

The main key to success is to use enough putty pads to handle the weight of your object. This UHU TAC product is intended to hold items up to 4.4 lbs. “under optimal conditions”. For slightly heavier objects, try [[ASIN:B0085T0G2K UHU TAC PROPOWER]].

title: Great Quality! text: This seemed expensive, but now that I have it, I see it is very well made and well worth the money! It is very well designed and easy to use. It has little stickers on it at all the right places to tell you how it works. I got the large version and I am glad I did because it gives me more space to fit my Surface Pro keyboard and monitor and also a portable external monitor in the book holder using the slot at the top and there is till room for and 8 1/2 x 11 page of notes.

Some examples of the thoughtful design are that the book holder has a place for it to be stored on the underside of the lap desk. There was a sticker there forcing you to read the instructions about which direction to pull the book holder out from where it clips in to be stored. The book holder fits into the slot at the top and it also has fold out arms, so if you want to use it on any surface without putting it in the slot, you can do that also. The surface of the lap desk is a little bit textured. It is enough that I can lay my phone on it when I have the lap desk at an angle and it does not slide down. It is not always enough though to keep my mouse from sliding down (depends on how much tilt I put on the desk), however, there is a tiny lip just above the slot at the bottom (the one that holds the laptop stopper) that keeps the mouse from sliding off the lap desk. The fold out legs are simple to use and seem very sturdy. The "slide" design of the legs work very well to be able to slide the desk across the mattress (if you're working while sitting in bed) and the legs are spaced well so that the lap desk is pretty steady even though on a soft surface. The little drawer is perfect to store some pens, so they are easily accessible. The little slot at the bottom can also hold two pens end to end and is deep enough that you can rest your wrists over top of that slot while you're typing on a laptop and can't feel the pens. I don't have a light clipped to my lap desk yet, but it is designed so that one would be easy to clip on. The slot at the top works well to hold an iPhone.

This is a great addition to my COVID-19 mandated work from home situation and even though I have a good home office set up, I'm not sure I'm going to want to go back to sitting at the desk all day now that I have this option!

title: Helps Motivate Kids text: When you teach a classroom full of young people, you need to do what you can to motivate them. Rewards and direct recognition are best, but it also helps to remind the students to achieve their best. And one good way is by using this set of 11 Motivational Classroom Banner Poster Decorations.

These posters are large in size, but not too large. They measure about 40 inches wide and 14 inches tall. Each one contains an inspirational, motivational message on one side and the name of a month of the year on the other. With the months, you just need to flip the appropriate poster around when its time comes around, display it for the duration, then flip it back the other way to display the message when it’s time to move on to the next month. There are 11 months- the only one without a display is July, and that is because the typical school isn’t in session in July.

The month side of each of these posters is colorful while the message side is like that of a blackboard. The posters look nice on the walls or boards of a classroom. It’s best to display the messages at an angle, as they seem to get attention better that way and students are more apt to look at them. My wife says that the kiddos do look at these posters and make comments on them, so they do have an effect.

Young people need motivation and sometimes, a simple message is all it takes. This set of 11 posters from Global Printed Products is high in quality and achieves its intended goal, which is to encourage kids to be the best they can be. It’s an excellent set of posters that belongs in every elementary school classroom.

title: Can quickly pay for itself text: Before I delve into the value proposition I want to describe what this scanner can do and why I love it. It's standalone, so you can scan slides independent of a PC, although you will need a computer if you want to use the 128MB internal memory of the scanner and transfer the slides on it to another host.

I tested this scanner with a [[ASIN:B009QZH7BU SanDisk Ultra 32 GB MicroSDHC]], which is the max size SD card it will recognize. Since this scanner will scan to either 14 or 22 megapixel resolution my card holds either a little over 6500 images at the lower resolution or about 4100 at the higher one.

One of the reasons I love this scanner is you can do some basic editing while scanning. By basic I mean color correction and brightness levels, as well as some orientation operations like flipping and mirroring.

Another reason this is handy is you can scan not only 35mm slides, but color and black and white negatives that were common from times past. Indeed, I have a cache of family photo negatives going back to the late 1940s/early 1950s that this device successfully (and quickly) scanned.

Now for the value proposition: I checked some local and internet based scanning services. The price leader was twenty-two cents per slide. Doing the math this means that if you have over five hundred slides this scanner will pay for itself. Actually, if you have 550 or more slides this AND the SD card I mentioned above will be paid for based in their prices at the time of this review.

One final note: you can process about six slides per eighteen minutes assuming that you do a little color and brightness tweaking on each. This is a more manual device with no automatic controls, but for home jobs it is more than fast and not terribly labor intensive. For me the value proposition is solid!

title: A Very Happy Addition to Our Home, Great Flexibility, Great Value text: This is my first experience with an all-in-one office printer, and so far I couldn't be happier. We love the ability to copy at home and the duplexing is great.

Usage - My wife was not too happy about the idea of adding this device to our family. She still glares at my old, unused, dried, ink-clogged printer in our small office space. However this printer quickly proved it's worth when our son forgot his extra vocabulary sheets at school. Within seconds we had enough replacement copies for the week. Two days later we printed an iron-on transfer so my son could go trick or treating as a member of Camp Half Blood from the Percy Jackson Series. Then in the following weeks we have used it far more than we ever would have guessed.

Size and Construction - The Box this printer comes in is heart-stoppingly huge. Out of the box, it's still a pretty big device (perhaps the purpose of the packaging is to make it seem smaller.) The glossy black plastic does not have the most classy, rich feel to it. It shows dust, fingerprints and cat hairs far more than a matte finish would have. Also the plastic feels a little cheap. But overall the construction seems decent, especially the design and construction of the touch screen. The controls are simple and intuitive.

Setup - Setup was amazingly simple. We are a Mac household and I'll vouch for the ease of the wireless setup. I simply needed to let the printer find our wireless network then input the WEP Key when prompted. We installed the client onto our Macs and we were off and printing. The HP software does seem a little bloated at around 150 Megs (we did not install the scanning software.) But we were printing and copying less than 10 minutes out of he box with no frustrations.

Print Quality - We are very happy with the print quality. Our needs are not great, and they are greatly surpassed by what this printer is capable of. We copied a number of color pictures from Toy Story books for our youngest and they came out beautifully. Also copying black and white text docs look great.

Wireless - The wireless seems to be the difference between use and disuse. We leave the printer powered off to save electricity, but it is so convenient to print to the queue, then just power the printer on. Much easier than our old finding the cable for our old printer.

E-Print - OK we aren't able to use it yet, but we are impatiently looking forward to iOS4.2 which promises to release our iPad and iPhones to print directly to the printer, without being tethered to a computer. I can't wait, at least the printer is ready now...

Noise - I was a little worried when first setting the printer up. The initial setup was pretty noisy but seems good now. Warm up noise is reasonable and scanning and printing are fairly quiet.

Cost - The cost of the cartridges seems a little high at $40 for an XL set of inks, but I guess when I look at per print price, the cost is very reasonable due to capacity. We'll see how this works out in the long run, but so far the math seems reasonable. I sure don't see a lot of generic replacement cartridges for this printer though.

All in all, greatly exceeds our expectations. We are very happy to have it in our house.

title: Stop Wrist Pain Before It Happens/Ease It If You're Already Suffering
text: My husband spends all day typing at his computer for work.  He has tendonitis in his wrists from so much typing, so I got him Aelfox's keyboard memory foam wrist rest to help alleviate his pain. He's now used it 2 days in a row (both were 10 hour work days) and he  is stunned at the relief he is already experiencing thanks to the wrist rest! He commented to me that he's so used to feeling pain while he works, he just cannot believe its possible to work feeling NO pain now. I sat at his desk and tried it out as well. The memory foam inside is nice and durable and at the same time, extremely comfortable. The wrist rest doesn't slip and slide on the desk either, it stays put where its placed.  It measures the same length as his keyboard and is the perfect size.  Neither of us are gamers so we passed the mouse pad along to his brother in law and nephew who are gamers.  Both say the mouse pad feels great with the gel interior and they're slowly getting used to using it. If you've never experienced tendonitis before, trust me, you don't want to. I had it years ago from repetitive motion (from typing)and wound up needing surgery on my wrist for it. It can be EXTREMELY painful.  Protect your hand and wrists NOW so you don't wind up suffering down the road. The Aelfox keyboard wrist rest will protect your hands and wrists while typing and the mouse pad will protect hands and wrists while gaming.  Both are 'must-have' items for those who type/participate in gaming on a regular basis.

title: Sometimes you have to Gift yourself text: This is an action packed calendar! Dachshunds doing what they do best. Have a great time! Running, playing, just straight out enjoying themselves. If you look these Doxies seem to be smiling while they are having a good time.

If you own a Dachshund you know they are busy. If you don't want a busy body in your house don't get one. They are hounds who love being outside and in the bedroom with you.

My little Miniature Wirehaired who has one speed - fast! I used to wonder if she'd ever be able to go up all the stairs to where the bedrooms are? She runs up at top speed. She weighs 8 lbs at 2 years old because she cat naps (literally with the cat) and then she's all action. Usually doing something that makes me laugh.

My daily thought is what is she going to do today? And usually I can't even imagine. It is such an adventure living with a Dachshund whether it's Smooth, Long haired, or a Wire. Standards, Minis, and Tweenies. All types of colors.

If you want to smile and laugh a lot you need to get a Doxie. If you can't get this calendar and enjoy their antics!

title: Excellent for labels and stickers! text: I have used similar products in the past to print labels to place on my equipment when used at jobs- light stands, cameras, microphones... I love having custom sizes and shapes with my logo and contact info in case anything gets misplaced, and doubles as a little advertisement for my business when people see it. I fill a full sized page with different sizes and varieties, and cut them out as needed.
My kids love this too, we can print faces and characters for them to put on their notebooks and school supplies.
One thing I noticed is that unlike some other vinyl sticker paper, this was actually much easier on the loading mechanism. These things are usually notorious for getting jammed when loading, but so far this has gone pretty well without any hangups. The back is still a little bit hard to peel at first, but that's par for the course. I think for what it is, this is an excellent product that I'd highly recommend for customization.

title: Very Funny Christmas Card with Cute Message Inside! text: When I first saw this Christmas card I had a good laugh. Then I thought I better get some before they are all gone! Each year I try to send out a funny Christmas card because so many people send serious ones I figure I can be a little different.

These cards are a good quality and the envelopes are nice and sturdy too. The cards arrive in a plastic box container so they survive in the mail and don't get damaged.

The inside message reads: "May Your Christmas Be Unforgettable." Just cute!

I'm happy I have these early as I can get all the cards ready before December! Now all I have to worry about is stamps and thinking about what to say in a holiday letter!

~The Rebecca Review

title: Don't do it. Just don't. text: I am begging you: Don't buy this printer. Don't do it. The price will tempt you as it tempted me. I've lived with my canon printer for 2 years now and it is truly terrible. The worst part is honestly the ink. I NEVER get more than 60 pages per ink cartridge. That is a really low yield when the black cartridges cost $17-20 each. That means for a $17 cartridge, i'm paying almost 30 cents per page printed. So this "inexpensive" printer WILL COST YOU when it comes to ink.

Let me also add that i've never printed photos until last week. What a racket. It won't let you print on 8.5x11 photo paper. You can ONLY print onto 5x7 or 4x6 photo paper. Well, okay. That's annoying but i'll play your game printer. So when I used a NICE piece of glossy photo paper and I made sure all the settings were correct, I printed a photo and it looked awful. I expected it to at least look decent. But no. It looked like garbage.

I am seriously a cheap person and I will never buy a canon printer ever again. I've learned my lesson. Sometimes cheap is just CHEAP. I'm going back to HP. I got a free printer from HP with my laptop back in college and it lasted me 10 years before it finally died. I can probably recall every time I bought ink for that thing. It was a crazy work horse. This canon printer? I know i've bought ink at least a dozen times. Do yourself a favor and get something better. You will kick yourself for having wasted your time and money on this printer.

title: Not my Style
text: The ink quality is good, but it runs out of ink really fast, and the writing isn't as smooth as I would have expected with a ballpoint pen. It takes effort to write with, but at least it has a nice weight. I've had better flowing writing with Ink Joy, which is much cheaper than this pen. The grip isn't that comfortable either.

title: Fantastic Eco-Tank printer!
text: This printer sounded too good to be true - never having to buy another expensive ink cartridge?  In setting it up, I asked for help from our resident IT guy, as I was a bit leery about filling the ink tanks, etc.  The set up was a breeze, and so was the filling of the tanks.  The printer comes supplied with  two sets of ink bottles - enough for two years, or in my case, perhaps more.  I'm a writer, so make multiple copies of what I write.  The printing is crisp and clear, there are no streaks or, strange lines - just perfect copies.  It holds a good volume of paper and prints quickly.  I am 100% pleased with this printer, and salute Epson for coming out with the "Eco-Tank" - what an improvement!  The size is also perfect - not taking up any more room than my old laser printer.  If anything changes with time, I'll amend this review.

title: Warm Hands Always a Plus
text: Husband likes this. He has circulatory problems and his hands are often cold even in the summer. He says it's a little small for his usual mousing radius, but it would be huge if they made it the size he wanted. Note that the little warming pad you put inside it cannot be microwaved; it has to be heated in hot water. So it might take a while to get warm to use. Hubby has a USB-powered hand warmer that he uses to warm the inside instead and then he can put his hand in and have it warm.

To get it to “ding” you have to gently tap the top, and then let go immediately. The little mechanism inside is more of a lever, than a bell I would say. So it doesn’t “ding” easily.

title: Good magnetic erasers, if oddly patriotic? text: As far as erasers go, they seem to work well on dry erase boards, or at least as well as any other I've tried. I like the magnetic part, they can stick to most metal-backed white boards or the front of my fridge (where we used to have a little magnetic whiteboard for family notes).

My son loves it, he's got a whiteboard setup where he plays office at home, and the fact that there are six in a box means my other kids can share them too. I have to be honest though, the USA logo on it seems a bit superfluous, I don't understand why I'd need that on my erasers. I don't think they add much value to the product but hey, maybe you're into patriotic themed erasers. If you are, these definitely do the trick!

title: Beautiful Set Of Cards With Excellent Storage Box text: Although I am an artist, sometimes I prefer to have pre-made cards ready in case I quickly need to send something out when I am short on art time. This set is PERFECT.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a really nice thick sturdy box which has a print of one of the cards on the outside. It is very compact yet holds all of the cards, envelopes, and stickers perfectly.

APPEARANCE
These are high quality looking cards. There is a beautiful stripe of metallic gold around the edge of each card face. The colors of the flowers are realistic and although they don't look handmade like a watercolor does, it is as close as you can get without being watercolor. These are really nice cards.

WHAT ELSE?
There are envelopes for each card and gold stickers too.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a very nice quality set of cards. You can make them into anything you want which makes them even nicer. If you have the ability to do calligraphy, you can turn them into any type of greeting card.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. These are a great substitute to my own personal art watercolor greeting cards. I am much happier with these than I thought I would be. This is also something you can give as a gift to someone who loves handmade looking items.

PRINTED
These are printed in China.

title: Hold Up My Heavy Larger Books Very Well text: I have been looking for some good solid book ends which do not take up too much room yet will hold up larger books. Let's take a look at these..

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
These book ends are heavy metal. They are a really pretty bright navy if that makes sense with a little bit of cyan mixed in (your printer ink blue is cyan if you have inkjet color). These come very well wrapped in a bubble mailer so they are not chipped or scratched. They have the deer cut out from the metal and there are four little pads on the bottom to keep them from scratching or moving when holding up books.

HOW DO THESE WORK?
When I got these, I ran right to my bookcase and put them in. I am thrilled to say that they held a bunch of rather large oversized HARDCOVER books in place without sliding or bending at all. They have held well and don't see to move.

ANY PROBLEMS?
So far there are no problems. These are sturdy, look really nice, and are just like you see in the photo with this listing.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a well wrapped, nice colored heavy duty pair of book ends, this set did the trick for me. They don't take up too much room, yet they hold up heavy books, even the oversized ones.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS for these. Not only do they work well, the look really nice too. I like them. Kudos to the company for wrapping them so well so they arrived to me in good condition too.

title: Finally, a journal I can rave about; it is handcrafted quality at its highest standard! text: Over the past year I ordered three vintage journals that ranged from not so great to good enough. However, this journal is pure perfection without being dirty vintage.

The craftsmanship of the leather binding is impeccable. The stitching is clean, the buckle closure (which is actually a snap closure) is stylish, and the feel of the leather is supple. The included dog bookmark is a sweet and useful touch, especially for animal lovers like me.

The journal itself is made of recycled cotton paper but still has a vintage look without being "dirty." I love that the journal is replaceable (meaning removable) in the sense that I can use this leather cover for any other appropriately sized notepad or book.

In summary, this removable vintage leather-bound journal with dog bookmark is exquisitely handcrafted to the finest detail. If I could give it 10 stars I would.

title: Great map for giving adults and kids a good overview of geography! text: I am a homeschooling mom who is spending the next 2 years "galloping the globe" with my son as we immerse ourselves in world geography, cultures and history. I wanted a nice map that we could hang in a prominent place in our school room (which also happens to be our hearthroom just off our kitchen). I knew I would need a laminated surface for dry erase markers and the sticky dots we would be using on the map. I also needed something large enough to use as a reference without having to be right on top of it. This map fit the bill quite well.

It arrived in great condition, well packaged and quickly shipped. It is worth nothing that my map did not come with a hanging strip as originially advertised. I contacted the seller and they were very prompt in making it up to me. The lack of a hanging strip turned out to not be an issue in the long run since we ended up mounting the map semi-permanently to the wall by framing it with molding and holding it flat to the wall.

We have been using it since August and it has been a dream. The dry erase marker comes off nicely when needed and borders etc are easily definable on the countries. I like the little flags at the bottom as well. The only thing we have to be conscious of is the distortion- esp. at the arctic areas- which makes some countries (i.e. Greenland) appear positively enormous. This is a function of the type of map it is, and we just pull our globe down for comparison when we are studying a new country in order to give it a more realistic estimate of how that country really fits into the size of things. Once your child can understand how things have to be stretched to show them flat it is just a matter of remembering that.

I'd certainly order again!

title: These labels are almost too easy to remove; they are small and thin as well and almost half price on the Avery site text: The labels are super tiny, sort of thin and see-through, and easily come off. Attached is a picture of one item I labeled so that the size can be seen.

I do feel these are great for canning because the labels can be easily removed. However, they are almost too easy to remove. I was able to lift the corner of the label and remove it immediately. When I ran the label under water, the adhesive disintegrated as it should.

One other dislike I have besides the small size and thin texture, is that I found it almost impossible to see the label outline and as a result it was difficult for me to remove it from the paper backing it came on. I guess I can chalk that up to older eyes but the delineation between the label and the sheet it comes on needs to be clearer.

Nevertheless, these do work as designed and are easily removed from plastic, glass, and canning lids. The fact that a laser or inkjet printer can be used with the appropriate Avery template from their website is a plus. At the current price of $14.14 for 50 tiny labels ($.28 cents each), I think this is very expensive for what they are. However, when I looked on the Avery site, the list price for the same labels is $6.25 so I would order them there.

title: warps text: I bought this whiteboard because it was the size I needed: 4x6 and because it was porcelain on steel rather than melamine. It has a plain aluminum border and a tray. It cost less than fancier boards in this size which can fetch up to five hundred dollars (twice the price I paid). It arrived by freight in a battered box, but managed to avoid any damage. It's comprised of a masonite backer board, a thin steel sheet with the porcelain finish and the aluminum border that holds the edges together. I haven't had it long enough to know whether the porcelain finish is as durable as I'll need it to be. The only complain I have is the flatness of the board is poor. I hung it by the pre-installed slotted holes in the back. I used two sturdy 50 pound wall anchors. The problem is the board does not lie flat against the wall, nor does it stay flat. I blame the masonite backer board. It is inadaquate, and the mount hangars are inadaquate. I could probably fix it by using large tube of Liquid Nails in a caulking gun and just glue the board to the wall solid the way some mirrors are mounted, but it would be permanent. The board would be destroyed to remove it. I will probably just try to hold it down with some double-sided tape or additional hardware.

I don't know if the more expensive ones are better or not, but this one is utility quality. If I were doing an install in a well-furnished room, a company conference room, a well-appointed classroom, a boardroom or anything like that I would look elsewhere.

title: Good Value Pack of Pens text: We go through a lot of pens in my house (my wife is a list-maker) so I look for economical packs of pens like these to keep us well stocked. I received the 18-pack of blue medium-point pens and so far they've been good pens. I wouldn't call them perfect, but they're a good value for what you get.

As I write this these pens are priced just below $0.60/pen, and that's a very good deal. That alone is a good enough reason to look at these as an option for bulk pens.

In use, there work reasonably well. I have had a couple of duds that have quit on us before the ink is gone, but most of them seem to be decent and work well. We have not run through the whole pack, of course, but we have had more work properly than haven't. Writing is smooth with no skips and relatively little globbing. We haven't had any of them leak, either.

Overall, these are good pens and they seem to work well. The best feature is the pricing for this pack which makes them very much worth a look if you are looking for bulk pens.

title: Great portable scanner at a reasonable price
text: I love this thing! I had an older model before through my job and missed it so much that I bought a brand new model. This is really very portable. It fits well in my laptop bag. I also use it at home with my desktop. It scans in both sides of documents quickly and easily. The only issues it can have is with extra long receipts, but I get around that by cutting the receipts in half before scanning. This is one office tool I rely on heavily. The software that comes with it is nice for organizing, but I have my own system. This scans well right to PDF. It's also a reasonably price. I have a heavy-duty laser printer/scanner/fax, but I prefer using this for all of my scanning. I'm very attached to this piece of office equipment. I would definitely purchase another if needed, but this one, after a year, is still working like a champ!

I've used them for a central focal backed by colored cardstock or mirror board, and also for envelope seals.

Adorable and humorous cards.
NobleWorks produces high quality cards at reasonable prices.

Cons.
Consider whether you need 12 identical cards. These cards will be most appreciated by dog owners.

We love anything dogs. These are cute cards. This is a single design card, so the only problem is getting 12 of the same. Do you plan to send these cards to 12 different people? When next Christmas rolls around, you may wind up sending the same design to the same people.

NobleWorks produces fine quality cards at reasonable prices.

title: Great Printer For the Home or Office text: This is a fantastic laser printer that is easy to set up and offers a variety of features. The printer comes very well protected with packaging that ensures the item will arrive in good order. First you have to remove about a dozen pieces of tape that keep the lids and compartment doors from opening during transit. The toner cartridge is already installed, but you have to open the toner compartment and remove a layer of shipping foam before operation.

The printer includes a CD for installation. I connected my printer to the network via Ethernet cable and ran the installation software off the CD on my laptop. Once the software had been installed, I was also able to use the printer with my desktop. This was convenient because my desktop doesn't have a CD drive.

The printer has a lot of features and comes in a compact size for a laser printer. It's an ideal choice for work, home office, or if you have a several school age children who have to print out assignments. There is a small touch screen on the printer that is easy to use. The large toner cartridge means you won't have to replace the toner for months. This is a good choice for all your printing needs.

title: comfortable, attractive, but easy to damage text: This is a nicer gel pad than the last few that I've had. It has just the right balance between softness and resilience, to provide support and comfort. Particularly important for me because I have carpal tunnel syndrome, and my wrists ache furiously if they aren't in just the right position while using a keyboard.

The only issue I have with it is that the skin seems rather thin, easy to puncture. My young son was able to pinch and break through without significant effort (or benefit of sharp objects). Fortunately, I was able to do a repair job with clear tape.

I also wouldn't recommend the Daisy pattern, unless you love flowery and bright quite a lot. Not a big deal, but it doesn't really work for me with the basic black keyboard. Grates after a while, to be honest -- I find myself steadfastly ignoring it ... :-)

title: REALLY Good Printer text: **UPDATED**
I initially gave this printer 4 stars based on my use making color copies from my HP Desktop computer on Microsoft Word. My feelings on that are the same. However, after using it with my MacBook, I'm upping my review to five stars, simply because it does excel in some key areas for me. I don't have the settings issue with the Mac and this printer, which is funny since I have them going from HP to HP, but not from Mac to HP. Go figure. There is really no set up on the Mac. Your wifi finds the printer and you use it. Easy. This printer also is great with cardstock. My Brother laser printer slightly rolls my cardstock. It is an annoying issue I have just always dealt with. This printer, no rolling or curving my card stock. It is flat when it comes out of the printer! It also doesn't skip or have feed issues with cardstock like my previous Lexmark printer was prone to. So, it does a better job than some other very expensive printers that I own. The image quality stays crisp, even when doing all black and even when doing draft quality. That is pretty impressive. So, despite the small draw backs of settings issues with my HP, this is a REALLY good printer.
I like this printer. The only reason I wouldn't give it a full five stars is because of one issue I have with the settings. It connects easy enough. The printer walks you through setting it up. It doesn't hold much paper. Around 20 sheets seems to be about all it can hold. It has no tray, so be aware of that when it is spitting out copies. Ink was simple to install. It does work while it is charging. My other issue is the settings. It ignores whatever I put in on my computer end. Like, I say on Microsoft Word to print 5 copies, it ignores that. You have to open the printer settings every time the printer box pops up when you choose this printer and change the settings you need changed there. Also, the power saver mode turns the printer off. It doesn't reawaken when you click "print". You have to go to the printer and manually push the power button, wait about 30 seconds, then click "print" on the computer. You don't have to use the power saver mode. It does give you options on that.
If you need to print a lot of stuff very often, this is not the printer for you. If you need to print one or two things every now and then, this is the printer for you. It would work well for students. It does fold down to a pretty compact size.

text: I have bought these boxes of pens in the blue, purple, red and black colors.  I really love them.  I mean LOVE them.  Especially the purple color. These are great pens.  They write smoothly and do not skip.  The ink dries pretty fast except if you’re writing over white-out. This brand is my favorite of all gel pens.  I just wish the other colors would come in the boxes such as orange and green.

title: Strong, flexible, reliable for a rubber band ball text: Recently I pulled out some old storage tubs and found an old rubber band ball I had made as a child, about 6" in diameter. Many of the rubber bands had held up, but some had melted/broken over the many years of it being in an attic, so despite being a grown adult I wanted to protect my creation from further deterioration. For this purpose I purchased these rubber bands as a basic layer, and some ceramic mold rubber bands as an outer layer. While admittedly this goes against my long-maintained policy of never using wide rubber bands for the ball, needs must when the devil drives. Besides, when stretched, they hardly counted as wide rubber bands at all

These are perfect for the job. They easily stretch to cover the 6" ball, though near the end I was approaching the limit. Zero broke on me - which was a common experience I had when making the ball all those years ago - and all felt very secure and quite elastic. There was some small variation in size, but all the rubber bands fit over the ball. the wider form factor made stretching them over the ball much more comfortable than they might have been, as it gave each band more surface area to grip onto during the process.

Only reason for dropping a star is the price, could be less expensive for the quantity you get - which wasn't bad, but wasn't great either.

Would recommend for rubber band balls.

title: Such an improvement!
text: Since I recently moved into a home with vinyl floors and my home office is on the second floor, my previous office chair was making a lot of noise as I rolled around. I bought a new office chair but the wheels that came with it were plastic. Noisy and did not roll smoothly as I made my way to the drink fridge and back! I chose these rubber chair casters (very much like roller blade wheels) even though there were less expensive models to purchase. I could not be happier with my choice and the value. They were easy to install and  now I glide across the floor without bothering the whole house. No marks on my vinyl floors either. I am hoping to get an area rug for my office so hoping they roll over thin rugs as easily.

title: Reminds me. of the Enterprise from Star Trek. Really useful in the kitchen for nutritional info on food boxes
text: I had to laugh when I put this together and turned on the two LED lights in a dark room for the first time. The entire unit looks like a little sculpture of the Enterprise Starship from Star Trek! That's a good thing though in my book. The lights are bright enough to see the inside of a dark toaster oven - looking for crumbs - and with the adjustable gooseneck, it's easier to hold & weighs less than a flashlight. Put together and used properly, this is a very good magnifier for reading, needle threading, button sewing, and jewelry cleaning. However, I have been using it primarily in the kitchen to read the fine print on the ingredients and nutritional breakdowns on food packages. The silver color blends nicely with our stainless appliances actually.  I received a free sample unit of this desktop magnifier to test and review and I have been very pleased.

title: Perfect for this couple (ages 50 & 65) text: We just downsized to a smaller home and that means down sizing everything.

This printer / scanner / fax / copier is a GEM!

1. Read the quick startup.
2. Removed the blue tape (inside and out so look carefully)
3. Plugged the Epson into the surge protector
4. Connected the phone line into the Epson
5. Connected the Epson into my land line phone
6. Connected the Epson to the hard drive of my 7 year old HP Pavilion Desk Top
7. Turned the Epson power on
8. Ran the Epson software CD on the HP
9. Downloaded the Epson software to my Asus Laptop
10. Downloaded the Epson software to my Sony Laptop
11. followed the Epson screen to create a header record for my Faxes
12. followed the step by step instructions on the Epson to set up for Faxes
13. sent a fax
14. got a fax
15. scanned a picture
16. printed from all 3 devices
17. made a copy

It was seriously impressive how easily and quickly the setup process was.

It was the easiest I have ever set up a fax machine.

The 20 pound printer fits neaty on my home office desk in easy reach for whatever I want to do.

*I have not tested my HP touch or Ipad or Samsung Droid cell phone

title: Just the Felt Tipped Pen I was Looking for text: What I hoped for and finally received. Smooth writing. Though listed as medium this marker can be mistaken for a Fine point depending on how you write. How much pressure you push down on the paper when writing. I write all the time so I need a marker that can write smoothly, easily, and without putting pressure on my hand. Well this pen fits the bill. Another Papermate product INKJOY GEL is my second favorite, but sometimes it's best not to use a gel pen and this Papermate POINT GUARD NEEDLE felt tip stick pens are just what I need.

Of utmost importance - it doesn't bleed through! Not only to the next page, but not even the back of the page. Hurray! I used another Felt tip pens on the back page and it bled through. Luckily I bought two 12 pack boxes - but I plan to buy more. I also purchased three other (Fine point) felt tip pens / markers. I was disappointed by the other three different brands I purchased in comparison to these pens, which I plan to use daily.

title: Ok labels

title: Screws and Screw Driver Were Easily Stripped, But Nice Unit text: I have been looking for a two shelf stand for a living room table so that I can put a matching lamp on the other side of my couch. This looked perfect.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a nice sturdy box and well packed to keep it from damage.

IS IT EASY TO ASSEMBLE?
This is not too hard to assemble, except it comes with an Allen Key which is white metal. That and the cheap metal screw heads makes it difficult to tighten the screws once they are almost in completely. I had a lot of problems with this. I would suggest you look for another allen key if you have one that fits. It might be less frustrating.

Other than that, the unit was not hard to assemble.

STURDY?
This is plenty sturdy for what I want it for. I plan to put my lamp on top, with some other items next to it and some fish food containers under it because it will be near my fish tanks.

WOULD IT HOLD A PRINTER?
Yes, this is plenty strong enough to hold a good sized printer for home use.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a nice unit, but there were some issues with assembly due to the cheap metal stripping out easily.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. If they had better screws and a tool included, it would have been five stars.

title: Perfect markers for "premium" coloring books ... text: I've finally found the pens to use for my nicer coloring books -- the ones with brilliant artwork but that contain images printed on both sides of the page. Alcohol markers bleed through (Copic, Spectrum Noir, BIC Mark-its, Sharpies, etc.), so unless you're willing to sacrifice the image on the opposite side, alcohol markers are more or less off the table.

These are water-based markers and are much less likely to bleed through or feather (seep outside the lines). You still need to be a little careful -- for example, you don't want to hold the tip of the pen to the paper for a long time as it WILL bleed through. Just color "normally," and you should be fine.

The 36 color set is perfect. You have enough variation within each color family to get some really nice shading effects. The triangular shape is really comfortable, too. I have severe osteoarthritis in my hands, so I have to be careful (I use "cushions" with my colored pencils). But these are really comfortable.

So glad I found these -- solid 5 stars from me. Highly recommended to my coloring enthusiast friends!

title: Tape is good, it's tape?
text: Tape works well, it sticks it's tape. Package 📦 came packed perfectly. All in tact, delivery was on time. I recommend this tape.

title: A good addition to the home or small office. text: I found the Fellowes Saturn SL 125 12.5-Inch Office Laminator to be reasonably useful. We've run several dozen name tags, award certificates, 8"x10" images and other miscellaneous items through it without encountering any problems. The lamination speed is acceptable. The outside of the unit remains acceptably cool during operation. The cord could be somewhat longer. No matter where I used it I needed a short extension cord to reach the wall outlet.

My only two real complaints about the unit would be:

1) Slow heat time. It takes quite a few minutes to get to operating temperature. It would be best to line up a large batch job to run through the laminator than to turn it on and wait repeatedly during the day to do things piecemeal.

2) The smoke colored plastic door/hatch that covers the input feed slot I found not only VERY hard to get open but had to literally pound on to get closed. As this is cheap, brittle plastic I can see it breaking rather easily.

All in all the device preformed quite well.

title: Excellent color if you can get it!
text: HP genuine ink cartridges are the ONLY ONES anyone should be using because the other kinds offered  simply will NOT work in the HP  Officejet 8020 series printers.  If you look at the reviews  you'll see what I mean.  Who wants to spend nearly $200. for replacement ink cartridges that are NOT HP and that their printer will reject?  Be careful!  On the other hand, HP needs to get on the ball and start making their 910 color cartridges available to us.  I have been trying to get the HP 910 Cyan blue cartridge for at least a month with no results!  Amazon was good enough to have the Magenta, the Yellow, and the Black 910 cartridges, but no Cyan blue.  What on Earth is going on with HP?  We pay nearly $200. for their brand new Officejet printer and then can't get the correct color cartridges!  Wow, that's really bad!

This printer holds a lot of ink! The wireless set up was pretty complicated. It took about half an hour and multiple attempts to get it paired with our wireless router and ready to print. title: Novelty Meets Functionality text: I selected this unique paperclip holder for some fun in the office. It is a clever conversation piece but it also is practical and well made.

Do the clips hold papers together? Yes, they do. I was a little concerned that this was more novelty than function but I tried using the clips and they hold well. This comes with 20 cows...er, clips...and while it is difficult to find more of this exact shape to refill when these are gone, regular clips will work.

The top fits on snugly but is not hard to pop on or off. You can pick up the whole thing and flip it upside down, and the top will remain in place. The magnet is strong enough to pick up 3-4 clips and not drop them when popped off.

Of course, there’s the novelty aspect. This is a great conversation starter as well as an office gizmo that is sure to get a few chuckles from others. However, in some environments it might wander off when you’re not looking… And if you have access to a UV light, it gets even more interesting.

This silly thing makes me smile. It’s first a novelty item but it is very functional too. It’s a great gift idea for the office – or just for yourself.

I use it to remind hubby of the day. We have been retired and tend to forget what day it is. And, he tends to forget more than I do. The grocery list can be on the other side. You can also make notes about the bills to pay.

Close it up easily..... stand it up easily. Take it where you need. Attach notes to it, because you will get magnets to post the notes. I like this, it is helpful. The set comes with a few different colored markers. Erasing is easy and you get an eraser.

Nice, handy, portable!

title: IF....YOU NEED SOMETHING COMPACT, INEXPENSIVE, COMES COMPLETE - this could be it text: I just needed something for a small space to keep a handful of folders.

And FIRST before I get to all the PROS, those who complained the folders are BENT. They straighten out and I had NO problem once I hung them and started filing the folders!

HERE are the PROS:

LOOKS - yep it's plastic, but this black plastic filing organizer blends in just fine and doesn't take up much space.

STURDY - for what I use it for, it's perfectly durable and sturdy

EXPANDABLE - Yep, comes with some files, but PLENTY of room to expand with more or change to the box bottom folders that expand.

PRICE - OMG HARD to beat re price. I paid about 11 and change total, got the organizer, files AND tabs and inserts. EVERYTHING I needed in one package for little bucks.

BOTTOMLINE: At the price I paid, I don't see how it can be beat if all you need is one small filing organizer.

title: Not for Photos
text: Unless you like all the photos you print to have that Louvre-like watercolor property, this is NOT the printer you want in your house. I use a printer mostly to produce small photos for a "picture-a-day" journal I keep. I also print lots of non-traditionally-sized prints for cards, scrapbooks, and other projects. Even using HP glossy photo paper, this printer managed to deliver streaked, smudged, and generally fuzzy photos; closely examining the print straight out of the tray showed us that the ink was actually beading up on the surface of the photo paper, leading to that misty, soft-edged look sought after by the Impressionists. If fuzzy photos are your thing, this is the machine of your dreams. If you favor a clean, crisp snapshot to record your memories, look elsewhere..

I don’t know why they don’t supply it, it only cost about $4.97 they could add it for $5.97, but either way you can’t go wrong with this phone. title: Strong and Dangerous
text: This chair mat is thick and solid. It laid flat as soon as it was unpacked with no curling and doesn't slide around. Rolling a chair over it is super easy and it protects my carpet - which are the two reasons I bought it.  I took off one star because it is dangerous to unpack. I read other reviews saying it was tightly rolled and popped open as soon as the tape was cut, so I was extra careful to lay it down in an open space. Even though I was expecting it and trying get out of the way, this mat exploded out as soon as the last bit of tape was cut with enough force to bust my knuckle open. Be VERY careful opening it around children or pets.

title: Truly NON slip- it grabs my desk, and even pushing on it is hard to move. Awesome text: 36" wide, 20" deep. It takes up a good portion of my large desk!

I was quite skeptical at first, but I have quickly taken to it. The amazing thing, is that it has become one with my desk. The pad does not slide at all. I can push on it and it doesn't move. It is like it is glued down (it isn't, it just grips that well). My mouse reacts well with it- operates as normal. Considering how much space it takes up, I wondered if it would interfere with being able to write on a piece of paper. So I took my mechanical pencil and a slip of paper and wrote my name. The pad is has texture (hard to tell in my pic, but the product pic is accurate), but it is smooth enough to not pick up any texture, and firm enough that I could easily write with a pencil without the graphite breaking. I usually write on a pad, so it would not have really been an issue if it didn't work, but at least I can provide that information in this review.

I had planned on using this on an end table (actually situated between two pieces of furniture) if I didn't like it as a desk mouse pad. I have a table about this size and it could use a cover on it. Since we always use it for drinks, etc, I thought it would be great there. I still think it would be, especially since it does not slide around. But I learned that I love it for my desk.. now I am just going to have to acquire another when it becomes available for purchase.

The synthetic leather does not stink. I smell a faint odor when I put my nose right up to it, but it doesn't seem to be off-gassing any. The more I think about it, the more I like this desk mouse pad. It has potential for other uses. I do recommend!

I haven't had this long, so if I learn anything new I will certainly be back to update. I keep on top of my reviews and try to be as helpful as possible.

I like to use a basket because the mechanism of the shredder is fused inside the lid, so it is heavy and awkward to lift the lid to empty the shredder.

I could have kept the shredder and just taped the basket because the problem was not severe. However, I felt that a new item should be in mint condition at the time of purchase.

title: Very Happy It Worked text: I was a bit concerned that my printer's packaging was damaged, as seen in the picture. But after unboxing I saw that the printer had not been visibly damaged at first glance, as seen in the second picture. After a fairly lengthy set up (Thanks to the YouTube videos I knew what to expect) I was able to get the printer set up and I tested printing a picture from my PHONE of a salad I made this week, as seen in the third picture. The paper used was just copy paper and not Epson photo paper so it seems a bit dull looking, but you can see the rainbow line of the "Congratulations" sheet that the colors are vibrant.

I got two bottles of black ink with my purchase of the printer. Nice little bonus since I print documents a lot.

Benefits of EpsonPrint App on my phone:
I am thrilled that I can use my Note9 phone to take a picture and then print it without using a computer or laptop. this is a big game changer. I am also thrilled that I can take a picture and email it to my printer, with a customized email address I set up at EpsonConnect.com.

Some YouTubeers complained about the small command screen. I had no problems seeing the commands, using the small screen to set up my WiFi password, or anything that others had difficulty with. I am 71 years old and do not have 'young eyes' so I don't know what those young people's problems were.

I was hesitant to pay the larger cost upfront for the printer but after realizing that the ink bottles were equal to a hundred cartridges (which are just too expensive) I decided that in the long run I will be saving money.

title: Great quality
text: I ordered a 'Wood Framed Magnetic Chalkboard 22 inch by 30 inch Magnetic Wall Framed Chalkboard' for review.  This chalk/magnetic board is very well made.  The wood frame is well stained, well sanded and the joints are well done.  It is not a lightweight board and feels very durable.  The chalk markers that are included work well on the board and are vibrant.  This set also comes with a cloth eraser, some stick chalk, and some little magnets.  The magnets stick on the board securely.  The chalk does require some coaxing and a little water on the eraser to get it off the board.  It does come off clean with a little effort.  The quality seems to match the price point, but honestly, we have not purchased another of these, so I am not sure how comparatively it is priced.  Overall, well made and looks great.

title: It's HP ink.  And it works!
text: These are genuine HP ink cartridges.  Your printer will gobble up the ink and pour it all over the pages.  They read every time in my Envy 7640 unlike some of the generic brands.  I do feel that HP's ink cartridges could be a little more efficient with its ink management.  It seems as soon as I put it in, I'm out.  That's more inherent in the design of the smaller cartridge, though, and I suppose if I was made of money I'd buy the larger ones.  For now, these will keep on slapping ink to paper in my home.

The magnet is pretty strong and after about a week, maybe ten days the adhesive pad started to fail and eventually the post came free leaving the adhesive disk stuck to the floor. That took some scraping to get off the tile completely. I considered putting this in bedroom with the screws and decided I just didn't want to deal with the noise. In a game room, cellar or professional situation this might be okay. I don't recommend the glue pad or using this in an area where you'd want peace and quiet.

text: This acrylic shield/sneeze guard is really helpful during this time of Covid-19. It's a large size. It was very easy to put together. There are 2 feet and that just slip into the slots. It just depends on how much higher than the table they are. Just something to consider. You could easily pass a text book or binder through the opening. title: Great buy text: I used to have a Palm V, which I absolutely loved. I did everything I needed it to do and was small and sleek to boot. After I clumsily broke it, however, I needed to buy a new PDA. The Palm V had been discontinued, and I thought that the Vx was ridiculously expensive, so I bought the Visor Platinum.
VERDICT: It is considerably larger and clunkier-looking than the beautiful Palm V, but its faster speed and USB connection are great! On top of the neat new (to me, anyway) applications like the world clock and enhanced datebook, I added AvantGo and Vindigo (NY, SF and LA). The Platinum's memory isn't even close to being full. I'm hoping that the nice platinum finish won't wear off over time, but that remains to be seen.
The things about the Platinum that I don't like are its thickness, its lack of a rechargable battery like the Palm V has, and its clunky snap cover. For a PDA this size, they should have had the swivel cover like some Palm devices have.
Overall I'm very happy with my purchase... it does its job very well and is a hell of a lot cheaper than the Palm Vx.

title: If You're Looking For Double Sided Tape, This Is Not It! text: If you're looking for double sided tape this is not it, unless you like
spending half your day trying to peel it apart from the non-sticky part.
I thought at first that it was just hard in the beginning, you know, to get it started. That's why I originally decided not to return it, but boy was I wrong!
I remember when I originally saw it on Amazon and it took me forever to figure out which width I wanted to get.
Usually in these situations I just order all of them, and my husband will say in his very passive aggressive way, "why not just get one, my Love. Then if you use it up, Honey, you can always come back for more."
No, he doesn't understand what it means to be creative. Ugh!
If I've used it all up and need more than I need it Right Now, not whenever it gets delipvered.

Then he ends it with the one thing that makes me the most crazy, "Why don't you 3 Amazon be your supply closet. They've got an endless amount of everything, a lot more room than we do."
Thank goodness I heard his annoying little voice this time, because sometimes he's right.

title: 4 hours to put this sucker together! text: This is a very nice, sturdy on wheels double drawer file cabinet. Once it was put together my son rolled it from the living room to my desk in the dining room and it rolled along great even across a porcelain tile floor.

The drawers hold letter size files and there is room enough for multiple tabs and color coded notations., in other words, your regular type of American size files.

I have a combination of letter size and legal size file folders, so to truly use this I will need to buy a few more hanging file folders.

Something else I really like, there is a wheel on the bottom of the file cabinet drawer and it rolls open smoothly when you need to get to your files.

This little cabinet comes in a wood tone, a rustic color that I am just so tired of, so the black veneer, to me seemed like a welcome neutral to introduce to my office area.

I was able to use all of my letter size hanging folders in the bottom drawers and it was enough space to clear out most of a file folder box.

title: Good Means to Thin Black Lines text: Technology has changed the way we write, but regardless of this progress, we still need writing utensils. If you’re looking for a fine- tipped ink pen in a convenient package with plenty of pens to go around, then you might like this set of Japanese Technical Gel Ink Pens.

Utilizing black, gel ink, this pack of 12 pens have a tiny, .35 millimeter tip, which means they produce very fine lines. The gel ink dries quickly and because so little ink is dispersed, it doesn’t smear. I would also assume that each pen lasts a while, but I haven’t had these long enough to know for certain.

The tube of these pens is clear and I like that fact because it means I can see the ink on the inside of the pen, thus I can monitor how much is left. The thin lines are good for multiple uses and while I use them for ordinary writing, they are also useful for artwork and other situations where thin, narrow lines are desired.

We still need ways to write the old-fashioned way and we likely always will need them. Japanese Technical Gel Ink Pens are a very good means to write thin, black lines and while I prefer a little thicker pen body for more comfortable gripping, these are still good pens overall.

title: Better than Average Spiral Notebooks text: I have used my share of composition notebooks as well as spiral-bound notebooks over the years. I prefer the traditional composition notebooks over spiral-bound, but for spiral bound notebooks these are just fine and will serve well.

The main thing these have in common with traditional or standard composition notebooks is the cover. The cover has that distinctive black-and-white design and the cardboard is a little thicker than with normal spiral-bound notebooks so they'll wear better in a book bag. These are easy to identify and will last a bit longer than other notebooks.

The pages are perforated and are relatively easy to tear out. It's easy to get a clean, straight edge on these when they're torn out. They're also college-ruled too so there is more room for straight writing. There are some charts on the inside covers too, which may or may not be helpful depending on how these are to be used, though it's clear these are designed for students.

These have attributes of both composition notebooks and spiral-bound notebooks. They're superior to normal notebooks. If you need notebooks with removable pages and are made to stand up to some abuse in a book bag, these are a choice to consider.

title: Great Idea; Would Be Better If Made With Heavier Plastic text: These flexible plastic AVERY TABBED SNAP-IN BOOKMARK DIVIDERS are a great idea. They easily snap onto the rings of a standard three-ring binder, so you can bookmark sections of, or specific pages in, a filled ring binder. The colorful designs incorporated in the bookmarks are cheerful, and the designs are sufficiently memorable that you can find a particular place without reading the labels on the bookmark tabs. (These come with a page of printable labels for the tabs.)

However, if your ring binder isn't very full, the bookmarks will snap OUT almost as easily as they snap IN. (Mine actually fell off the rings of an empty binder when I closed the binder.) I would like to see these snap-in bookmarks manufactured in heavier plastic, which I think would cure the snap-out problem, and make them just about perfect for my needs. Because the bookmarks snap out too easily, I rate them at only 4 stars ("I like it" on the official Amazon scale).
