title: Still Prefer The Epson LabelWorks But This Is A Decent Basic Label Maker text: I never knew how much I could use labels until I got my first label maker. I have used that for a LOT of different purposes and have found it useful. My previous label maker experience is with a more luxurious model from Epson. However, for quick little labels that I want to use on items on the go, I thought it would be handy to have a smaller sized label maker to take with me and use quickly for quick labels that I am not quite as concerned about perfection on. This label maker seems like a valid choice.

WHAT IS THIS LABEL MAKER LIKE?
Measuring 5 1/2 inches by 4 inches, this label maker is very portable. It has a clear LED screen that is just black and gray. It does not have back lighting to use in very dark areas, so be aware of that. There is a standard key board on this which makes it not have a huge learning curve for typing. The label maker only comes with one small starter roll of labels which means you will have to buy more pretty soon after purchasing if you plan to make any significant amount of labels.

The instruction fold out sheet is invaluable. I would highly suggest that if you get this, you immediately print it out via copier- more on that later.
You can control the font, designs, size, width of label contents, length of the label, and even up to two lines of text. The unit takes 4 AAA batteries which it does not come with. You will want to have them handy before you attempt to use this.

The back comes off easily to insert the batteries and the tape roll which is good. You don't have to unscrew anything or really struggle with tight fitting plates that don't want to come off. The keys are easy to press and are not too close together. The printer slot for the labels to come out is at the back of the machine, along with the cutter tool.

HOW DOES THIS LABEL MAKER PERFORM?
I have to say that I am spoiled by my current label maker, but this one is a decent contender for the smaller label maker needs. The instructions are mandatory for you to run this machine. I will say that one feature I like is that if you want to print out the different graphics that you can use on the label maker, you have the ability to do that. Then you can stick that label on the bottom or side of the unit in case you misplace the instructions.

I tried to make a variety of labels- from simple contents labels to more fancy labels with borders and design. Both worked beautifully. You can save a label or print multiples of the same label with this machine. You can also preview the label before you print it.

WHAT I DON'T LIKE ABOUT THIS MACHINE
There are only a few things I am not fond about with this machine.
1. You can not preview the graphic with the label- it only shows as the listing A1, B2, J3, etc.
2. You can only print straight labels, not the type that wrap around cords.
3. When printing deco labels with repeating designs, you have to have a resting period. This overheats quickly.
4. The labels are very flimsy and have a single back on them which can make them a bit tricky to peel apart

FEATURES I LIKE
1. You can print out the pictograph list on a label and stick to the machine for reference
2. Instructions are clear and make this easy to use
3. Keyboard is standard so no learning curve for typing text
4. Labels stick well to anything I have put them on including glass, frosted glass, metal, plastic, and wood.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Although I really enjoy using my [[ASIN:B005J7Y6GS Epson LabelWorks LW-400 Label Maker]] much more than this label maker, I did find this useful for quick jobs. It does what it says nicely, and although the labels are a bit flimsy, they do stick well. I did like the feature of being able to print the pictographs on a label to put on the machine in case you can not find the instructions. I did not like that it lacks some features such as back light, printing labels horizontally or vertically, or to wrap around cords like the Epson does. I also didn't like the single backed tape vs the split back tape of the Epson.

If I had to make a choice, I would still pick the [[ASIN:B005J7Y6GS Epson LabelWorks LW-400 Label Maker]] with the tape bundle. I find the labels to be more sturdy and substantial. However, this is a decent label maker and I still give it four stars.

I will update as I use this over time to add any more insights or details that might be helpful in your buying decision.

The only reason for the single star deduction is that the entire thing is rather flimsy and we won't be using it for international travel - It wouldn't hold up to a long trip or a series of several trips with multiple flights, hotels etc throughout the year such as my husband has with work. But for simple vacation & domestic stuff, this is a very nice, light weight, functional product.

title: LOVELY IMAGES, FABULOUS PRICE, GREAT PAPER QUALITY! text: Each year for the last several years, I get a kind of Zen/Nature wall calendar. As I have to look at it all year, I want great pix and large enough daily spaces to write appointments. I look at MANY calendars before deciding.

PROS:

FIRST, THE SIZE. 12 X 24 when opened. I always check because this is about standard but I have not checked and been disappointed in the past with a too small calendar.

SECOND, LOOKS GREAT on my kitchen wall. LOVELY SERENE IMAGES AND the IMAGE takes up a little more than half of the calendar. You know how usually you unfold a calendar and the image is on the top half and calendar/days are on the bottom? WELL, in this one the IMAGE extends a bit into the bottom half making for a stunning large image, yet there is still PLENTY of room to write in the daily boxes.

THIRD - PAPER QUALITY! VERY IMPRESSED. I have had some much more expensive calendars with low quality, flimsy paper. This has a nice substantial paper, glossy and clear images. it's not stiff, like light cardboard heavy, but not like tissue paper either.

FOURTH - the daily boxes are an OPEN grid which means if you need to, you can extend a tad outside the box.

FIFTH - THE PRICE! IF you have checked out nice wall calendars, NOT UNCOMMON for them to be between about 12-15 BUCKS. I liked these images BETTER, or at least as much as, the much more expensive ones.

SO WHILE IT'S ON SALE, GRAB IT! If you like the images, I think you'll love it on your wall. I do.

title: Great buy! smooth, long lasting, very black crispy lines!
text: [[VIDEOID:948e1a2f37a13da87e905ded5f45e29c]] Decided to try this pen set, after constantly buying sakura micron pens for years, and feeling like while their quality is top notch , I feel, they seem to run out very quickly anymore, so after searching for days I decided to give these off brand pens a chance. I can honestly say these pens are great to draw with! The quality of the ink seems very close to that of sakura, I would say the black is a deeper black with these pens, as opposed to sakura micron. They also have lasted me longer then any other doodle pen I've used in the past.  The pen case and body are nearly identical to sakura, and it seems the nib sizes printed on the cap don't wear off as easily as sakuras. They write very bold lines with very minimal if any, feathering or spreading. The sizes seem to be accurate, the cap has a nice click when u cap it off, insuring u will not leave one partially open and it dry out. The ink is very quick drying and doesnt smear on paper. They don't seem to bleed through very easily to the reverse side of ur paper, as I showed in my pictures, where I traced back over my lines 1-5 times and the bleed through has little to no difference between one line and 5 times trace over.  . These pens are a awesome deal for the price, coming from a true sakura pen junkie!!! With the smooth crispy lines , no skipping, or drag to them, no leaking tips, no blurred or smeared lines, dried extremely fast, many sizes in one package, makes these pens a great buy for all artists, especially if your looking for a deep black pen with no weird bluish shine to it that seem to last a long time- and have stayed consistent in color after many many uses. Try them they are my fav off brand ive tried so far, I usually say eh they are okay and always go back to sakura. But I am adding this brand to my favorites!! If u love cool pens u got a check out sakura gelly rolls, I love them all but some awesome ones are: glaze, moonlight, souffle, stardust(sparkly), silver shadow. Absolutely best pens for adding bold colors and textures to ur art or scrapbooks! Enjoy!

title: I Mean WHAT Can I Write About Push Pins, Right? More Than I Thought.. text: When I first got these, I thought, "Geez, what can I say about push pins?" As it turns out, more than I expected.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
I know this is going to sound silly, but I am thrilled with these push pins for one reason in particular- they come in a screw top plastic container. You have no idea how annoyed I have been with the different packaging that push pins come in. They always open up and fall out and drive me up the wall. These, however, come in a SCREW TOP plastic round container. That was a big plus right there.

HOW DO THEY PERFORM?
These are typical push pins. They come in various colors, have a cheap plastic head on them (Well, in terms of hammering anyway) and they have a pretty sharp edge on them to use on bulletin boards, but also other uses.

USES THAT I HAVE FOR THESE
When we go to coffee shops and other businesses in our area, there are usually bulletin boards for cards to be put up for local businesses. Since I have some businesses in our family, I always carry a little baggie with a few push pins and business cards in them to put up on the boards. You can not believe how handy that comes in.

-bulletin boards at home
-curtain tie backs
-put on boards for lightweight hanging spots for organizing lightweight things with light strap handles
-cat toys on the tower (pound with hammer into the wood lightly and it holds for a month or two)

THE BOTTOM LINE
A great container with a screw on cap had me impressed with these, but all in all, I am glad to have them for the variety of uses that I use them for and more that I am sure I will come up with.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. Who would have thought I could get excited over PUSH PINS? LOL

title: Very Nice Spiral Notebooks text: My wife uses notebooks for all manner of things around the house - tracking meals and spending, making lists, keeping track of when appointments are coming, and a lot more. I selected these notebooks with that thought in mind, that she would use these for keeping up with stuff in the house. These have proven to be decent notebooks so far.

Instead of a thin cardstock-type of cover, these have a poly cover that will not easily rip or tear easily, and that has a couple of benefits. First, it will provide longer protection for the pages in the notebook. Second, the color makes identifying the notebook easy (distinct from others in the pack due to color) without concern that the cover will go away.

The pages are perforated and make tearing out sheets easier. It's not difficult at all to get straight, clean edges on pages that are removed. I personally like that the pages are college ruled, so there is better use of room for writing more.

These are decent spiral notebooks and they will get used up over time in my house. They're made well and the colors make them easy to tell apart when using different notebooks for different purposes.

title: Life Coach Yourself! text: Do you like to make lists?

Did you forget what you ate for breakfast yesterday?

Do you like purple planners?

If you answered 'yes!' to all of these questions then you should get this planner!

I have a love and obsession relationship with planners. When I die, one of my friends and family will find that I had written in, 'dying' on one of the days in a planner.

This planner is pretty nice. It has spots for a lot of lists and aspirational planning ahead. It has a full page of US holidays to keep aware of and spots for contact information.

Each of the monthly spreads is entirely blank, so if you go awol from your planner for a month or two (it happens, right?) you can pick up without having a huge amount of wasted pages.

There is one built in bookmark, it is thin and practically colorless, why colorless?

there is no pocket for a pencil or pen, which I find myself absurdly annoyed with.

All in all, this is an okay planner.

title: Remove the interior pockets and they would be excellent text: Having received three of these Avery Durable clear cover binders over the past few weeks, I can no longer remain silent. The exterior looks good, particularly when personalized sheets of paper have been inserted into the cover sleeves, each one has perfectly functioning slant rings, each one holds the tabbed dividers perfectly, but the interior pockets look as though they were sliced with a knife. These are very fine for home purposes, but I would not consider them for distribution of materials requiring more than occasional use and would hesitate before using them for student purposes which require daily use.

The hardware is excellent in these binders and they are attached well into the rear of the binder so the sturdiness is increased, I just do not like the flimsy plastic parts of the pockets which are terrible.

title: Run away from Uniden Corporation!
text: RUN AWAY FROM UNIDEN CORP!  They have the WORST customer dis-service of any corporation I've recently dealt with.  If you email them, you will get an automatic message that your model, even if brand new, has been discontinued, with no email address to reply to.  If you phone them, chances are high you will get cut off.  I recently replaced my Uniden cordless with this model, purchased locally.  The phone is okay, but for something this huge should have better features such as a flashing red light when a call comes in and a rechargeable battery - both of which were standard feature on my much smaller cordless version.  So I have no idea if you lose all your data when your 4 AA batteries go, and that's why I was trying to speak with someone at Uniden.  I have no idea how long this phone will last, but it will for sure be a throw away when it breaks down, even if that's before the warranty period expires.  Anyway, there are plenty of other options out there.  Life is too short to spend it dealing with companies who behave as if they're doing you a favor to take your money.

title: Great Teaching Aid at Home
text: My son is a senior, enrolled in the medical academy of his local high school. Students do not have access to a learning lab, as large parts of their educational experience is being currently withheld. I'm doing my upmost best to provide him with as many tools to learn as possible at home so the Anatomy Posters by Global Printed Products is a valuable visual aid for us. It's a nice size, everything is labeled well. The paper quality is nice and I feel confident it will prove to be durable as it's thick and glossy. The sheets are delivered in a roll inside a bag. They have quite a bit of memory, so they need some help to lay flat. In total, there are 15 different anatomical systems displayed, as that is the usual organization to study anatomy and physiology at the high school and undergraduate level. Structures are color-coded to differentiate, as are they labeled reasonably well. The minor details are not provided, for example the foramen of bones, but this is appropriate for my son's level. I'm very pleased to have this order, it's affordable and is of great value to my household as nearly all the adults in my family work in the medical field and the next generation is desperately needed to join us as soon as possible with as much knowledge as we can manage to help them acquire.

title: Great quality and value! text: I ordered the 'Large Flashing LED Neon Open Sign Light for Businesses with Remote Control – Extra Bright Lightweight & Energy Efficient - for Restaurants Offices Retail Shops Window Storefronts – Blue - Red' for review.

I ordered this with the idea to use as background light for shooting videos or photography and it has been loads of fun to try and incorporate it into different scenarios. The light itself is of very good quality and is VERY bright. I love that it is so surprisingly lightweight as well. It really doesn't take much to hang it and even a small backdrop clamp can hold it up with ease. The included fob works well and it is a nice bonus to be included with this sign. It can be used to turn the light on and off as well run it through a few different lighting effects. If I were to complain about anything it would be the fact that the included power cord is very short. You will most likely need an extension cord to hang it where you want. This really isn't a con per-say as most businesses who will buy this, will most likely have a plug fairly close to where this sign might hang. For my purposes however, I will need the extension cord no matter what. Overall, I am very pleased with this LED sign and would like to add more to my expanding photography props. I hope that this was helpful.

title: Decent Mechanical Pencils text: I have preferred mechanical pencils over wooden ones since I was in college, and I have several around the house that I use on a regular basis. I selected this box of pencils to take with me to the office. So far I am very pleased with them.

First, I have the 0.7mm pencils. I usually prefer 0.5mm pencils because of the finer writing tip (a result of a background in mathematics). That said, I have had no issue with these and have been able to write fairly fine lines with these without much difficulty.

These feel solid and sturdy enough to take some jostling and drops. These are not the most solid pencils I have ever used, of course, but they're better than disposable pencils and so far have held up to some light abuse.

I'm happy with these pencils and based on my working with them I am happy to recommend them. They write nicely, they're a bit more sturdy and well-made than cheap pencils and they're not outrageously priced.

title: Great for snack bins

title: Good for Small Hands text: Office supplies are a necessity and even though we don’t use as much paper as we once did, paper still hasn’t gone away completely and we still need a way to attach pieces of paper together. A stapler is the best and easiest means for this task and one possible option is the Staplers Office Small One Touch Stapler.

Compact in size, this stapler fits into small spaces so it’s easy to store. It uses standard staplers, so you don’t need to shop for anything special. It doesn’t hold as many staples as other, larger staples and that means it runs out more quickly and must be refilled more frequently.

The best feature of this stapler is that it requires less effort to use. You don’t need to push down hard with your hand- a softer touch is all it takes. Don’t get the wrong idea- it still requires pushing, just not as much effort as conventional staplers. I’ve used electronic staplers that truly are touch- activated, but this one isn’t quite like that. You still need to push.

Due to its small size, this stapler is best suited for young people. I like that it can hold up to 25 sheets of paper but the small size makes its use limited overall. I still think it has some good points to offer, but I can’t give it more than an average rating for the reasons stated above.

title: Works! Keeps corner of rug down on floor. text: Works like a charm. I had previous carpet tape on two modern rugs that my interior designer laid down, but never stuck to the corner and the rugs kept curling up on the corners.. I then bought some heavy sticky plastic rug "corners" to secure the rugs. Neither adhered to the rug and I gave them one year each. I put this tape on the corners yesterday and voila'- corners of the rugs are down on the floor , not curling up.

This two-sided has a removable film on each side, so you can lay it down , get it situated, then remove one "film" , make your corner at perpendicular angle and remove the other layer of film. Have a good pair sharp of scissor to solidly cut the tape at a good angle. Tape will tear, but the tape will bunch up or tear unevenly.

title: A Must-Have for Cat Owners text: CATPOWER's cat shaped sticky notes are just too cute! Everything about it is fun, starting with the packaging. The box they're in has cute pictures on the front and back. If you're giving this as a gift (and it IS worthy of gift giving!) you do not have to wrap it. The box itself is decoration enough. The sticky pads are contained in a small metal tray, perfect for storing the unused pads and small enough that it doesn't take up much room. I'm a neat freak. But I do confess to having a kitchen drawer filled with 'odds and ends' that are kind of just thrown all around. Thanks to the tray, I won't have to search the messy drawer to find the pads. 12 pads are in the set totaling 360 sheets in all. They come in a variety of colors: blue, green, orange, pink, purple and yellow -there are 2 pads for each color. The sticky adhesive works well and is located on the left side of the cat. 2 cat shapes are available...laying down and sitting up. I liked the laying set so much, I went and purchased the sitting shaped pads as well!

The price is VERY reasonable...actually cheaper than I expected. I just love both sets. A 'must have' for cat owners.

title: Durable and Lies Flat text: I've worn through a carpet with my office chair before. The simple act of pushing a chair back to stand up and pulling it forward to sit down can absolutely destroy your floors. It doesn't happen overnight, but you'll see considerable wear and tear after a few months.

These days, my office is in a room with a wood floor. I restored the wood floor over a period of a few weeks. This entailed getting on my hands and knees and scraping, sanding, and painting the floor. I'm not inclined to lose all that hard work to scrapes from an office chair.

My main concern was that this item would have a curve to it when I pulled it out of the box. That turned out not to be the case as you can see in the above photo. The moment it arrives, you can uncoil it and have it lie flat. Be a little careful when you unwrap the item, it springs open and if you're cutting the plastic wrap with a knife it could be dislodged from your hand.

The material is durable and doesn't make noise when you pull your chair across it. One side is smooth and the other side has a texture. The size is as advertised. This is a good choice for a home or office.

title: Very good comfort on a hard surfaced chair. text: We just purchased a new leather sofa and the seat is on the firm size. I thought this would soften it. Instead, it made sitting on the sofa very uncomfortable and I could feel every indentation. I put a bath towel over it and that didn’t help.

I then placed it on my Aeron look alike chair. It is perfect for that purpose. It provides excellent comfort.

The directions mention placing the cushion with one side up and the other side down. I couldn’t tell the difference between the two sides. You will be sitting directly on the gel coils. It is not encased in a cotton or nylon cover. That may be a problem if you are wearing shorts while using it. Placing a towel over it should solve that problem.

I’m not sure why it didn’t work on my sofa. The cushion is made for hard chair seating, and using it on a sofa changes the body contact area. Possibly, it needs a hard chair like surface to spring back firmly. The sofa, although firm, just had too much give.

It is a good cushion and I can recommend it.

title: Lower-End Quality, Not Ideal for All Uses text: I selected these cards for labeling packing boxes, an ongoing task in my house. My wife was excited to work with these and so far she likes them though I see some issues with the quality.

I'll get right to the point on these - these are not the highest quality cards. If you are working with markers or pens that saturate the paper when you write, these will allow bleed-through. The card stock used is not the best quality and is not thick or sturdy so if you need cards that have some heft or are sturdy, these will definitely disappoint. For our purposes, these are just fine, but if you're thinking flash cards or small handwritten signs, these are not the best choice.

These are ok. For my particular case these work just fine, but many others will find them to be just too thin and flimsy for a lot of uses.

title: Utility labels text: Bottom line: What can you say about these printer labels? They work as they should. When I buy labels, I would try to buy this 3M brand. I did note that these labels are:
* Durable

title: I wish Lamy and Amazon made the nibs available for a better price, but as it was I could get ... text: I bought this just for the nib. I wish Lamy and Amazon made the nibs available for a better price, but as it was I could get the whole pen for just a little more than the nib and shipping. Amazon was not and still is not today selling the nibs, so Prime or Super Saver shipping isn't available.

Rather than changing the nib on my Safari, which I could just push off with my fingernail, I just swapped the barrel and cap. The long barrel on the Joy is impractical, but I do prefer the smooth black section and feed to the Safari's coarse textured grey one. I don't care for the red clip on the Joy's cap, but again, I bought it for the nib.

The nib is decent, I suppose for the price. The 1.1 italic nib gives me exactly what I was looking for whereas the fine nib on the Safari was a big disappointment. The 1.1 nib is a bit scratchy, but it writes beautifully. I think the tines may be a bit too tight as no light passes between them, and I can barely force a piece of fine paper between them.

Together, the Joy and Safari are decent pens and they've helped me figure out what I care for in a pen without costing me a fortune. I continue to use the Safari barrel and cap with the Joy's section, feed, and nib, along with a converter and Noodler's black ink for every day carry. I don't think I'll ever become a collector or desire to own luxury pens. I'll admire them, but I only want a pen for EDC that's like the one I have. It could be better if the nibs were smoother, and the different nibs had better availability.

title: Say “I love you” for Valentine’s day with an expensive and intricate card such as this text: This is a lovely card with a very intricate pop-up design made of thin wood. It is also expensive at the current price of $14.99 but it is beautiful and simple. The card front says "I LOVE YOU" (no quotes) with a heart substituted for the word LOVE. The card inside has the same pop-up message intricately designed in wood with hearts and a base that looks like an "ice-cube-divider" from those tin ice-cube trays of yesteryear. 

The inside message is a continuation of what is on the front of the card and says (without the quotes):

 "....WITH ALL OF MY HEART. HAPPY VALENTINE'S DAY"

The envelope is white with a deep red interior.

This is a wonderful card for the special someone or significant other. It is also well made and well executed.

title: Great idea, but the plastic is too weak for the width text: This is a really good idea, in theory.
Sterlite makes great storage containers, and most of us have at least one in our homes.
I purchased this one at a chain store, not here online.

We were pinched for space, so I thought this would be great to hold crafting supplies
that would still be within easy reach. It sort of worked!
I had all the drawers with something in them - I tried a variety of things.
Fabric ended up being way too heavy, even though that is what I hoped to use it for.

The thing is - this is a fairly wide drawer to pull out. When there is much of any weight
in them, they don't want to pull out! Mine did not seem to be warped, yet that is how it
acted. The drawers became almost impossible to pull out if there was actually stuff in them.
I ended up using it to hold bubble wrap, which was a real waste of the "real estate" this thing
takes up. It worked okay for bubble wrap, but I was needing more storage for other things.

So, it is back to the drawing board for Sterlite on this design - it's too wide for the thin
plastic that is used for this one. If they'd thicken it up a bit on the drawers, it would be
really good. My little 12" wide Sterlite 3-drawer bin on rollers has thicker drawers than
this big one does!

So, I'd have to advise taking a "pass" on this one until they beef up the plastic drawers.
Otherwise, if you only have really lightweight things, like hosiery, scarfs, socks, etc, it
MIGHT work for you, but I wouldn't count on it.

title: Love Them!!
text: I received my "Thank You" cards exactly when I expected them (which was super quick) and quite frankly they are adorable.  The quality of the card stock is excellent!  The colors are vibrant and beautiful and the designs are darling without being childish or old lady looking (sorry if I offended any old ladies out there).  They are the perfect amount of sweet without being sappy.  I plan to buy a few more sets so I can use these cards for years to come.  I even received a nice email from the owner/artist inviting me to contact her if I have any issues with these cards (which I don't).  I thought that was nice and love it when someone does that little bit extra to make sure that I am a satisfied customer.  Lastly, they are the perfect size.  When you have a lot of Thank Yous to dole out, it's nice to have a card that gives you enough room to write a proper thank you but that is not so large that you have to write a book to fill up the empty space.

title: Exceeded my expectations text: I love these sheets! They ran through my printer with no problem and dried very quickly. Cuts nicely. I did find that I had to adjust the print settings below what was recommended in the instructions. I'm not a photoshop expert but these worked for me.
After shrinking the image was crisp without much skewing. It has a matte look and feel. I always seal my projects as they are not waterproof otherwise.

title: Good product

title: This is high on the best purchases I've ever made for an art supply, infact it may be #1
text: The pencils are all buttery and I love to draw with them. I'm doing birds right now. There is no comparrison to the other kits of colored pencils I have. I originally got smaller prisms sets - the 12 color, then the 36 and the skin tone, but they didn't have a grey in them and only a few blues. This set is everything and I don't want to be without it again. I'l have to keep ordering it as my pencils get used down. Thank you Amazon for the quick delivery. I am very happy with this. I've sharpened over 100 of this 150 set and no breakage. It is August in the Pacific Northwest and wax pencils do much better sharpening in warmer areas because the was melts together. If you have an issue sharpening, do not wear your pencil down. Stop immediately and place the pencils in warm water for at least 15 mins so the wax inside melts together  as sometimes it doesn't stay all together when they're made. I learned this on Prismas site. Never put them in the microswave, it will melt the wax too much. I didn't have to do any of this with my big set. It's perfect.

title: One Of The Most Frustrating Experiences Yet (I WANT This To Work) text: EDIT- I KNEW as soon as I wrote this review, I would find a work around. It is not thrilling, but it works. I had to do some extensive research to find anything with N41 in the title that fits the HPRT printer. I ended up finding another driver dated from 2018 in Chinese which works. The caveat is that this driver only has millimeters and not inches at all.

BUT, I did finally find a driver that would work. I forgot to add in my original review that the flash drive that came with this had a malfunctioning video which only played music on any player I tried it on. I also wanted to say that all links in the manuals led to things that did not work.

I am putting my review to 2 stars because honestly, unless you do what I did to get this thing to work, if you end up with a malfunctioning set of driver links, flash drive videos, etc, I just don't think that is acceptable for a unit of this price.
-----------------
ORIGINAL REVIEW

I have been around tech for quite some time. I am not a novice. I no longer have the time to troubleshoot for days on end to make equipment work. I was hoping for a better label experience than I had with another printer. This one, unfortunately so far, has been WORSE.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a box very well cushioned. It is wrapped in plastic so if your box arrives soggy like ours did, you will have a chance of this being protected.

INSTRUCTIONS
There is a flash drive included in this with instruction manual (that you have to print if you hate reading on devices), sample print out, and driver installation instructions.

CORD
The cord with this is RIDICULOUSLY SHORT. If you are going to use this at a desk that does not have an outlet really close to where you want to put this, get ready to get a suitable extension cord or power strip. That frustrated me right off the bat.

INSTALLATION OF DRIVER
I would love to tell you that this installed easily and I was on my way to try this printer. Instead what I got was two hours of intense frustration that made me want to throw this away. I am THAT frustrated.

No matter what I tried to do, I could not get this driver to install. I tried EVERYTHING I knew how, other than intense tech level investigation. Most of you buying this would not be doing that. I am reviewing this with you in mind.

WHAT HAPPENED?
I got the software to unload in my system. It says that the device is installed. I have it show up as unknown. I go in by hand to install the driver (which was unpacked already) and it still shows up as not installed. I have tried automatic via windows, automatic via the printer company web site, and manual installation of the driver.

PRINTING
I can not get this to work. I would love to get it to work. I would love to have a label printer I can use. This, however, is not installing and I can not get it to install. My parameters are Windows 10 down to 7 (tested on two devices) which are both included in the compatibility list.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If I am able to get this to install and work, I will update this review. I was putting off reviewing this for a while planning to be the hero and have the fix to get this to work if you are having issues like I have.

MY RATING
ONE STAR. I can not give any more for a device that will not install so I can not go any farther with it. This device comes with the promise in the listing that it will be simple and easy to set up and use. My experience has been the opposite.

UPDATES
I will update if I finally am able to work with this and get it to install correctly. I feel that I have done everything that the average person would do to install this, so until I have a work around, I will leave this as it is for now.
